jobs.title: Experienced Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Los Angeles & New York, United States
URL: http://careers.citrusbyte.com/apply/tPTZOv/Experienced-Backend-Engineer

Citrusbyte is a software development company which believes in using simple tools to solve all types of problems. We work closely with designers, engineers and our clients to create and improve products of great quality. We have considerable experience building custom systems for both startups and enterprises - check out our portfolio for more information about our clients.

We strongly advocate minimalism and this is represented in the tools we choose to work with. Every team gets to decide their own stack depending on the requirements of the project.

Our main offices are in Los Angeles and New York, but we work remotely with people from all around the world.

Our engineers have experience in a consultative environment, excellent communication skills and a desire to work with talented teams building innovative products. We work closely with our clients, sharing our experience to help them better define their products.

Most of our projects are written in Ruby, so experience in this language is required.

We believe that less is more and value simplicity above all else. This is reflected in the tools we choose to work with. For this reason we tend to avoid using big frameworks like Rails and instead use smaller tools like Sinatra, Roda or Cuba.

We have also done projects in Node.js, Go, Python, Lua, etc. And strive to learn new tools and languages everyday. We believe in always choosing the right tool for the job and we are very open minded about trying different technologies.

Skills & Requirements:
  • Smart, gets things done.
  • Passionate about software development.
  • Excellent communication / consulting experience.
  • Open minded and always learning
  • Experience working in a distributed company
Duties & Responsibilities:
  • Architect and build web applications.
  • Work with product designers and clients to clarify requirements.
  • Plan and prioritize work in a collaborative remote team.

To apply: You can apply directly at our careers page: http://careers.citrusbyte.com/apply/tPTZOv/Experienced-Backend-Engineer

jobs.title: Full Stack Web Developer
jobs.content:
__Location:__ Gospel Oak, London

__Type:__ Full Time

__Experience:__ 2+ years

We are looking for a full stack web developer.

Our flagship games, Zombies, Run! and The Walk, combine innovative real-world gameplay with captivating stories and design. We want to find someone who can help us improve our existing games and develop new games that are just as revolutionary and innovative as Zombies, Run!

___We are open to candidates working remotely.___

As web developer at Six to Start, you will be primarily responsible for sustaining and improving the infrastructure that powers Zombies, Run!, a popular fitness app with over 2.5 million downloads.

Youll be enabling the native mobile clients, along with maintaining and developing independent user-facing applications. Youll need to be able to work independently and be happy taking initiatives on features. Most importantly, itll be very important to manage complexity and technical debt with confidence while developing at a rapid pace.

While there is a lot of responsibility in the role, you will have an abundant amount of freedom in implementation and if wanted, a strong voice in the outcome of finished products that will roll into the arms of the products many fans.

__Responsibilities and Requirements__

* Comfortable developing functional websites using modern JavaScript practices
* Experience implementing and consuming traditional REST services
* Strong knowledge of RDBMS (Postgres is used primarily), and some knowledge or a keen attitude to learn noSQL databases
* Must be comfortable administrating and caring for linux servers

jobs.title: Senior Android Developer
jobs.content:
__Location:__ Gospel Oak, London

__Type:__ Full Time

__Experience:__ Senior (2+ years)

We are looking for a senior developer with experience in creating innovative Android apps or games.

Our flagship games including Zombies, Run!, Superhero Workout, and The Walk, combine innovative real-world gameplay with captivating stories and design. We want to find someone who can help us improve our existing games and develop new games that are just as revolutionary and innovative as Zombies, Run!

___We are open to candidates working remotely.___

__Primary Responsibilities__

* Developing new features for our existing games, and maintaining them to take advantage of new OS-level features
* Developing and designing new apps and games

__Additional Responsibilities__

* Working with our web developer to ensure good communication with our online services
* Working with our iOS developers (several of our games are available on both platforms)

__Requirements__

* At least two years of experience developing Android applications.
* An enthusiasm for quickly learning and applying new and emerging technologies.
* An interest in games and game design, and a tenacious approach to problem-solving.

__Also, highly desirable:__

* Experience in a related field (e.g. any of: web development, UI/UX design, sound engineering, iOS development, hardware hacking, etc.)
* Experience adapting or 'porting' games or apps from one platform to another

jobs.title: Java Chief Software Architect
jobs.content:
Are you one of top Software Architects in the world? Do enjoy solving the incredibly complex problems that no one else has been able to complete? Are you 10x more productive than the typical developer? Are you interested in earning $100,000 USD while working for the best companies from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you.


Company Description:

Crossover is redefining the way people work. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent. Crossover has developed a unique method of finding, curating, and managing remote contractors. Our platform connects customers to the worlds best talent for both technical and non-technical jobs. But we dont just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.


Job Description:

You will play a dynamic leadership role in our fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for developing solutions to complex architecture problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources. As the owner for the architecture and technical delivery of a multi-million dollar revenue per year enterprise software product, you will effectively work as the CTO of the engagement with a startup mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect and developer on the most complex elements of the product to technical team leader to solution evangelist ensuring that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product.


Key Responsibilities:

Developing expertise in one or more of our proprietary enterprise software products.

Leveraging your broad technology capability set and maintain a level of excitement in using various technologies to architect, develop, and iteratively deploy real enterprise class software

Achieving an expert level understanding of our customers environments and their use of our products.

Architecting and leading weekly technical delivery of one or more products in a way that maintains an unyielding focus on quality while matching the needs of the target customer base.

Creating solutions architecture, algorithms, and designs for solutions that scale to the customers enterprise/global requirements

Leading a small team of Software Engineers to apply software engineering practices and implement automations across all elements of solution delivery

Manage accountability of team members, with pinpoint focus on quality; Personally accountable for resolution of the most technically challenging issues

Ensuring our customers are supremely confident in the adv

jobs.title: Experienced Mobile (Ionic, Angular) Developer
jobs.content:
You write clean code and care about its quality.
Self-education is your primary personal strength.
You want to keep up with the latest technology.
You are excited about JavaScript as we are.
Then we are happy to bring you aboard!

About us

Ruby Cluster is a small team, crafting useful web apps, helping small business and startups.
With the technology of bleeding edge, we deliver business value for our clients. Worldwide.

Our approach

Our workflow is tuned. We use source control (git), we make daily builds, we track features/bugs (in trello),
we fix bugs before writing new code, we write specs before development, we use best tools, we have testers,
we run usability testing, we meet daily on stand-ups, we over communicate issues, we keep improving ourselves.

Skills required

  • Ionic
  • Angular
  • Vanilla JS
  • CoffeeScript
  • Jade
  • Stylus
  • Git

We follow industry best practices

  • DRY, KISS, GIYF
  • Simple, Modular, Decoupled, Events-driven code
  • Functional programming and Prototyping inheritance
  • git flow (branches, pull requests, merge and rebase)
  • Code quality guides, running code linters
  • CI servers, automated deployments
  • Agile, Scrum, Trello
  • Stand-ups, Pair Programming

About You

Your overall experience

  • 5+ years of hacking in web development
  • 2+ years of poking JavaScript
  • 2+ years of stashing in GIT (pull-requests, git flow)
  • 1+ years of building on Ionic or Angular

Personal skills

  • Reliable and responsible person
  • English: good verbal and writing skills
  • Good team player
  • Team workflow follower
  • Experience in working with a globally distributed team
  • Constant self-improvement
  • Strong work ethic
  • Sense of humor

What we offer

  • Long terms working relationship
  • Part-time to full-time workload
  • Interesting projects and problems
  • Usage of technologies on cutting edge
  • Opportunity to level up your skills
  • Support of highly skilled team members
  • Compensation based on experience

We prefer working with the best developers worldwide with good verbal and written English communication skills.

* Backbone.js, Marionette.js
* Angular
* Responsive design
* Bootstrap, Semantic UI, Foundation
* html5, css3, haml, sass, less, styl
* TDD, BDD
* git

#### We follow industry best practices

* DRY, KISS, GIYF
* Simple, Modular, Decoupled, Events-driven code
* Functional programming and Prototyping inheritance
* git flow (branches, pull requests, merge and rebase)
* Code quality guides, running code linters
* CI servers, automated deployments
* Agile, Scrum, Trello
* Stand-ups, Pair Programming

### About You

#### Your overall experience

* 5+ years of hacking in web development
* 2+ years of poking JavaScript
* 2+ years of stashing in GIT (pull-requests, git flow)
* 1+ years of building on Marionette.js or pure Backbone.js 

#### Nice to have experience

* ECMAScript 6

* Ionic

* Ruby on Rails

* Successful projects

#### Additional bonus if

* You are writing about technical stuff in your personal blog
* You are maintaining popular open source library
* You are an active contributor on StackOverflow

#### Personal skills

* Reliable and responsible person
* English: good verbal and writing skills
* Good team player
* Team workflow follower
* Experience in working with a globally distributed team
* Constant self-improvement
* Strong work ethic
* Sense of humor

#### Responsibilities

* Build new applications as a member of the team
* Develop new features and fixing bugs for current applications
* Focus on best practices and company standards guide
* Be available and communicate frequently with the team
* Develop application front-end and stunning UI/UX
* Writing clean modular DRY code
* Follow code review comments
* Be able to accept positive criticism for the written code
* Meet project requirements and deadlines
* Help to resolve clients' issues

### What we offer

* Opportunity to level up your skills
* Support of highly skilled team members
* Compensation based on experience

jobs.title: Healthcare-Improving UX Design Lead
jobs.content:
Greenhouse link

Make An Impact On Healthcare

More than 250,000 Americans died last year as a result of medical error1. Sadly, many of these deaths could have been prevented with existing best practices for quality and patient safety. A hospitals best tool for standardizing and implementing these life-saving improvements are their written policies and procedures. PolicyStats mission is to improve healthcare delivery by making those policies and procedures easier to find, access, and manage. Our clients (across 46/50 states) use our SaaS application to ensure that their policies are correct, their staff can find and implement those policies, and that their policies support regulatory compliance.

You deserve an environment with clear goals, problems that are meaningful and challenging, the autonomy necessary for creativity, and the support/resources necessary to make a dent in the universe. We want to provide you with that environment so that together, we can improve healthcare.

Help Us Collaborate Towards Awesome

We need a senior UX designer to lead our design process and help us take our product to the next level. Our product team understands the importance of good design and we need someone to help us, guide us, and teach us. Were a process-driven team looking for a fellow process nerd with strong opinions about how to bake good UX design into iterative product development. Weve recently been freed from the tyranny of supporting Old IE, and were excited for the opportunity to improve interaction for the hundreds of thousands of people that rely on PolicyStat.

How Youll Help Further PolicyStats Mission

  • Youll work with the rest of the product team to make our clients more successful by iterating on existing design, completely reworking systems, designing new features, and improving our processes.
  • Youll establish, document, and own a design system to standardize and improve our design practices.
  • Youll work with our engineers to write and run usability tests towards improving our product.
  • Youll design interactions, build mockups, write copy, perform design reviews, and collaborate as part of our product enhancement workflow.

Totally Strict Job Requirements

The Perfect Candidate will have:

  • Strength in Structure and Interaction design, according to the 4-layer design taxonomy2
  • A hunger for information on entrepreneurship and user experience
  • Experience improving design in a continuous delivery environment (we deployed ~500 times last year)
  • A portfolio demonstrating some of their design work
  • A process-oriented approach to design
  • Technical expertise with at least one prototyping/wireframing tool (e.g. Sketch, Balsamiq, UXPin)
  • Expertise in creating and administering usability tests towards improving design (we use Validately)
  • Expertise in clarifying data, indicating relationships, and hinting at behavior using using color, style, iconography, web typography, information design, and visual hierarchy
  • Experience implementing incremental design changes using a UI framework (e.g. Twitter Bootstrap)
  • Experience using responsive design to deliver great experiences across a range of devices

About PolicyStat

PolicyStat is a rapidly-growing SaaS company ( >50% yearly growth for 6+ years) with a product our clients love (>99% renewal rate). Our company has been named one of the Best Places to Work in Indiana for the past 3 years and were on the INC 5000 list of Americas fastest-growing private companies.

We pay market rate, provide full benefits, equity, flexible hours/PTO, conference/travel budget, and excellent hardware/tools.

We welcome candidates of all genders, creeds, races, and sexual orientations!

jobs.title: Senior Data Scientist
jobs.content:
Discovering new music can happen at anytime so whether its over a morning coffee or tagging the number one on your weekly shop, we bring a unique brand of magic to millions of our users every day. Making this a reality has been achieved through our most important asset, our people. So come and share your talent with us and help determine how the world will Shazam next, be the reason all our users stop, smile and say ‘wow’.


Role Scenario


We are looking for a creative, detailed-orientated and experienced Senior Data Scientist with solid scientific knowledge and engineering skills. You will be passionate about music and the music industry and contribute to our data-driven music features like our music recommendations and content generation algorithms by analyzing our massive datasets, interpreting trends and identifying actionable insights and opportunities. You will utilize statistical models and machine learning methods to help take these features to the next level. 


Where Does The Role Sit? 


The role is a Senior Data Science position and will be based in our Data Engineering team who are responsible for our data platform and building our data driven features. The team is based in our Redwood City office.


What Will You Do?



  • Analyse large, complex datasets to reveal underlying patterns, correlations and trends.

  • Assist with the implementation and scale-up of Shazam’s machine learning models

  • Drive development of machine learning techniques to model customer behaviour and preferences.

  • Create prototypes for new personalisation features and turn machine-learning outputs into operational data products.

  • Set up and conduct large-scale experiments to test hypotheses and drive product development.

  • Research and leverage new machine learning methodologies to improve current products and influence the future roadmap.

  • Use historic data to forecast key trends and predict events of interest.

  • Leverage quantitative techniques to answer non-routine business problems.

jobs.title: Developer (Data and Usage Analytics)
jobs.company: Data Analytics Digital Public Library Of America
jobs.content:
The Digital Public Library of America seeks a full-time Developer to support large-scale processing and analysis of descriptions of and usage data about open access materials from libraries, archives, and museums across the United States. This position will be directly involved in improving DPLA's ingestion and extract, transform, and load processes, in addition to helping develop processes and platforms to identify usage patterns of content aggregated by DPLA across user-facing platforms, social media, and APIs.

We are seeking a curious and enthusiastic individual who recognizes both their technical strengths and areas for growth, who can help us work effectively to further DPLA's mission to bring together the riches of America's libraries, archives, and museums, and make them freely available to all. A belief in this mission, and the drive to accomplish it over time in a collaborative spirit within and beyond the organization, is essential.

Responsibilities

Reporting to the Director for Technology, the Developer:

  • Improves DPLA's metadata ingestion and ETL processes to generate RDF metadata and address data quality issues at scale in a repeatable manner over time.
  • Implements hooks and workflows for data collection, analysis and reporting on data quality and usage metrics throughout DPLA's infrastructure.
  • Collaborates closely with internal and external stakeholders in data management and reuse of DPLA content, including the DPLA Data Services Coordinator, DPLA engagement and use staff, and staff at DPLA partner institutions.
  • Actively contributes to the development of staff- and partner-facing tools for data analysis and business intelligence.

  • Performs other related duties and participates in special projects as assigned. As a member of the DPLA Technology Team, the Developer:

  • Contributes to design, development, testing, integration, support, and documentation of user-facing applications and back-end systems.

  • Supports content management policies, process, and workflows, and contributes to the development of new ones.

  • Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in planning and implementation of applications supporting DPLA's mission, strategic plan, and special initiatives.

  • Maintains knowledge of emerging technologies to support the DPLA's evolving services.

  • Embodies and promotes the philosophy of open source, shared, and community-built software and technologies.

  • Ensures both high quality and reasonable throughput in data processing.

  • Brings creative vision around possibilities for work with data that we haven't yet imagined.

Requirements

  • 5+ years professional experience in software development or a related discipline.
  • A proven ability to build large, reliable, and scalable infrastructure.
  • Experience with data integration to support analytics and business intelligence.
  • Demonstrated experience with REST API design.
  • Demonstrated experience working effectively in a team environment and the ability to interact well with stakeholders.
  • Desire and enthusiasm about learning new toolsets, programming languages, or methods to support software development.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent problem-solving and organizational skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with extract-transform-load workflows with varying input sources.
  • Broad experience and understanding of analysis and aggregation of metrics from heterogenous sources, including usage analytics
  • Experience developing visualizations, dashboards, or other user-facing tools to support business intelligence.
  • Advanced knowledge of semantic web technologies such as RDF, SPARQL, and LDP, and semantic enrichment and reconciliation processes.
  • Demonstrated experience with standards, data models, and protocols including Dublin Core, MODS, METS, MARCXML, IIIF, OAI-PMH, OAI-ORE, and ResourceSync.
  • A successful history of working effectively in a geographically-distributed organization.

This position is full-time. DPLA is a geographically-distributed organization, with headquarters in Boston, Massachusetts. Ideally, this position would be situated in the Northeast Corridor between Washington and Boston, but remote work based in other locations will also be considered.

Like its collection, DPLA is strongly committed to diversity in all of its forms. We provide a full set of benefits, including health care, life and disability insurance, and a retirement plan. Starting salary is commensurate with experience.

About DPLA

The Digital Public Library of America strives to contain the full breadth of human expression, from the written word, to works of art and culture, to records of America's heritage, to the efforts and data of science. Since launching in April 2013, it has aggregated more than 13 million items from 2,000 institutions. DPLA is a registered 501(c)(3) non-profit.

jobs.title: Java Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Job listings do not always do justice to a company's environment and who would work well inside that culture and environment. If you would take the time to read this short article, besides the listing of skills below, it does an excellent job of describing who we are looking for. If the article speaks to you and what you are seeking in your career, please contact me. 


The Best Job Description for an Engineer Ever Written



Asynchrony Labs, a subsidiary of World Wide Technology, Inc. has opportunities for Java Software Developers to assist in the analysis of business, engineering and scientific problems, as well as the documentation and development of well-defined methods, procedures and programs in the delivery of practical systems solutions.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Pair programming, Agile, Test Driven Development
jobs.content:
Pivotal Labs: We Transform Ideas into Software.


As a recognized leader in highly disciplined agile software development practices, Pivotal Labs has been building high reliability software for over 20 years. We build consumer and enterprise web and mobile applications for global clients, and have a growing practice building applications for the iOS and Android platforms. We also developed Pivotal Tracker, the project management and collaboration tool used by thousands of software developers worldwide.



We Can Go Fast Forever.
 
We pair program, all day, every day because we know it delivers remarkable results. We practice and teach an approach to software engineering that applies across industries and organizations, so you’ll experience all types of teams, products, and technologies. And we believe in working at a sustainable pace – you’ll typically code hard for 8 hours each day, but then you’re off work to relax, recharge and refocus.
 
We Court Perfection.
 
Working at Pivotal means you get better at what you already do well. We set up regular retrospectives to figure out what we're doing wrong so we can fix it, and what we're doing right so we can improve on it. We consistently practice Test Driven Development, which results in high-quality, reliable and more maintainable code. And we believe that methodical, steady, relentless forward momentum drives consistent results.
 
Get Breakfast Everyday. And Get Paid to Master The Latest Technologies.
 
To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks are available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded Pivots who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly Tech Talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers on beer night.



What we do.




  • Pair program, all day, every day.




  • Experience all types of teams, products, and technologies.




  • Regular retrospectives to figure out what we’re doing wrong so we can fix it, and what we’re doing right so we can improve on it.




  • Test Driven Development.




  • Collaborative, open-plan office space




  • Weekly Tech Talks, ping pong, and other social events.




  • Free Breakfast everyday weekday and unlimited snacks.





What We’re Looking For




  • Strong knowledge of Java / Go / Ruby and/or other programming languages



  • Strong knowledge of Spring and/or similar frameworks


  • 3+ years of relevant work experience




  • Strong communication skills and interest in a pair-programming environment




  • Passion for growing your skills, tackling interesting work and challenging problems



  • Exceptional software engineering knowledge; OO Design Principles


  • Experience in test first development and pair programming a plus




  • Experience in web front-end development a plus




  • Experience deploying to cloud environments a plus



  • English fluency is a must, and ideally you speak fluent French also



Interested in becoming a Pivot? We’re seeking amazing developers to grow our Paris office which is opening soon. Apply by sending us a CV and a cover letter.

jobs.title: Growth Hacker
jobs.content:
[Greenhouse link](http://grnh.se/cutdi4)

# Make An Impact, Grow Your Skills

You deserve an environment with clear goals, challenging problems, the autonomy necessary for creativity, and the support/resources necessary to make a dent in the universe. We can provide you with that environment.

Your goal will be both clear and challenging: fuel growth [1]. Youll use the growth hacking toolkit to optimize and scale up lead generation outside of our core market, translating an ad-hoc strategy of periodically picking up non-hospital companies via our website into a well-polished, data-informed growth engine. You will be equal part entrepreneur, product marketer, mad scientist, inbound marketer, and sales strategist. You will wield a budget and have the direct support of PolicyStats CEO, VP of Product, and VP of Business Development.

# Help Us Collaborate Towards Awesome

We're a self-funding (cash flow positive), rapidly-growing company (>50% annually for 6+ years) with a product our clients love (>99% renewal rate, clients in 45/50 states). We work with our clients to improve healthcare delivery via their organizational playbook: policies and procedures. Our hands-on implementation and support teams help our clients use the PolicyStat web app to improve the quality of their policies, to ensure their staff can find and use those policies, and to ensure that their policies support regulatory compliance.

Until now, our sales and marketing efforts have been almost entirely focused on hospitals and integrated healthcare systems. Despite that, weve acquired a diverse set of customers outside that core market. To continue our growth, were ready to broaden our focus to include some of these other markets, and were looking for a growth hacker to lead the charge.

# Your Objective

Your true north will be growth, but some of the tactics to achieve that goal will probably include PPC, landing page optimization, customer development interviews, content marketing, SEO, direct sales, and social media.

# Totally Strict Job Requirements

There are none! But The Perfect Candidate will have:

- An innate hunger for information on entrepreneurship and digital marketing
- T-shaped [2] web marketing skills
- A deep understanding of analytics, running experiments, and data-driven decision making
- Experience performing customer development
- Experience crafting go-to-market strategy
- Experience in B2B sales

Our product team understands the importance of good design and we need someone to help us, guide us, and teach us. Were a process-driven team looking for a fellow process nerd with strong opinions about how to bake good UX design into iterative product development. Weve recently been freed from the tyranny of supporting Old IE, and were excited for the opportunity to improve interaction for the hundreds of thousands of people that rely on PolicyStat.

# How Youll Help Further PolicyStats Mission

Youll work with the rest of the product team to make our clients more successful by iterating on existing design, completely reworking systems, designing new features, and improving our processes.
Youll establish, document, and own a design system to standardize and improve our design practices.
Youll work with our engineers to write and run usability tests towards improving our product.
Youll design interactions, build mockups, write copy, perform design reviews, and collaborate as part of our product enhancement workflow.
Totally Strict Job Requirements

# The Perfect Candidate will have:

Strength in Structure and Interaction design, according to the 4-layer design taxonomy[2]
A hunger for information on entrepreneurship and user experience
Experience improving design in a continuous delivery environment (we deployed ~500 times last year)
A portfolio demonstrating some of their design work
A process-oriented approach to design
Technical expertise with at least one prototyping/wireframing tool (e.g. Sketch, Balsamiq, UXPin)
Expertise in creating and administering usability tests towards improving design (we use Validately)
Expertise in clarifying data, indicating relationships, and hinting at behavior using using color, style, iconography, web typography, information design, and visual hierarchy
Experience implementing incremental design changes using a UI framework (e.g. Twitter Bootstrap)
Experience using responsive design to deliver great experiences across a range of devices
About PolicyStat

PolicyStat is a rapidly-growing SaaS company ( >50% yearly growth for 6+ years) with a product our clients love (>99% renewal rate). Our company has been named one of the Best Places to Work in Indiana for the past 3 years and were on the INC 5000 list of Americas fastest-growing private companies.

We pay market rate, provide full benefits, equity, flexible hours/PTO, conference/travel budget, and excellent hardware/tools.

We welcome candidates of all genders, creeds, races, and sexual orientations!

[1]: https://hub.jhu.edu/2016/05/03/medical-errors-third-leading-cause-of-death

[2]: https://blog.intercom.io/wp-content/uploads/2013/09/DribbblePostImage7.png

jobs.title: Senior Fullstack Developer
jobs.content:
Our IT-Team takes care of the concept and realization of our web application. We continuously develop our online loan marketplace and implement new product features.


We decided to ramp up a team fully focuses on innovations. The team will be led by an experienced Product Manager with deep technical understanding and intention to implement state-of-the-art features in the FinTech world.


Currently we are looking for a really experienced Fullstack professional who (1) wants to take engineering responsibility for new financial product innovations. Who (2) knows, that engineering is about supporting business instead of choosing the newest framework just because it’s new. If you think you could handle the mentioned challenges successfully, please keep on reading. Otherwise please skip.


Team insights


https://www.smava.de/jobs/project/it/


https://www.smava.de/Bilder/development_infographic.png


Tech Stack you need to handle



  • Java Spring (DI, Security, Scheduling, Tx)

  • PostgreSQL

  • JUnit

  • Maven

  • ActiveMQ

  • Apache CXF

  • HTML5

  • CSS (Sass, Less)

  • backbone.js

  • Jira

  • Confluence


What we would like you to do:



  • Take engineering responsibility (Backend/Frontend) for new financial product innovations with perspective for a Teamlead position

  • Pick up requirements from your Product Manager and Architects and turn them into execution plan

  • Integrate 3rd party systems into new product innovations

  • Implement representation layer and visualization of data

  • Code review of future team members

  • Deliver high quality code to Release Management team

  • Participate in internal and external Stakeholder Meetings and Tech Talks

  • Nothing more nothing less


How we would like you to do it



  • Implement REST endpoints to query, manipulate and persist data

  • Implement Spring based services that handle business logic

  • Adjust database to store required information

  • Control access rights using Spring Security

  • Make sure that frequently accessed information is cached in ehcache

  • Work in Confluence with our architects on concept implementation

  • Split epics and user stories in JIRA into specific tickets with precise estimation

  • Generate SOAP service stubs and Data Types from WSDL using Apache CXF

  • Implement secure communication with 3rd parties

  • Make sure that our system is not overloaded and is distributed using ActiveMQ

  • Ensure data consistency by controlling transactions scope

  • Submit your code to your feature branch in our Git repository

  • Manage Jenkins jobs to deliver your code to the QA team

  • Manage dependencies of multi-module Maven project to build in fail-safe and timely fashion

  • Implement Backbone.js based Views and Models, define user flow using routers

  • Render representation of interface using Handlebars.js

  • Control loading and utilization of modules using require.js

  • Customized display using Sass


Mission to accomplish



  • Full digitalization of loan application process

jobs.title: Software
jobs.content:
Company Overview



uShip is the world's first and largest shipping marketplace. Consumers and businesses can compare and book bids from hundreds of thousands of customer-reviewed transportation service providers, ranging from independent owner-operators to the largest freight carriers and brokers. Customers save money and service providers use their empty cargo space - everyone wins! We're an Internet company focused on solving a real-world problem and having loads (pun intended) of fun along the way. Our service providers are even featured in A&E's real life drama, 'Shipping Wars.'



Since launching uShip in 2004, our mission has been to be the world's leading online solution for shipping anything, anytime, anywhere. We are passionate about empowering buyers and providers of transportation services to efficiently conduct business on an unbiased, transparent and competitive platform.  uShip is headquartered in Austin, TX .



If you are a motivated, smart, and driven individual who wants to work in an energetic and entrepreneurial environment with outstanding career and growth opportunities, then this is the career opportunity for you!



What you'll be doing:




  • Developing web applications using Microsoft .Net and open source technologies.

  • Creating and enhancing product features in MVC 4 and WebAPI 2 with C#, as well as some ASP.Net Webforms using VB.Net

  • Working directly with Product Managers, Developers and Quality Assurance to deliver new products and features.

  • Modifying existing applications and features to improve performance, code readability etc.

  • Communicating your ideas across a team of 30 developers



Skills you have include:




  • 3+ year experience and fluency in one or more object oriented languages

  • Experience working with a relational database platform like SQL Server or Oracle, both using stored procedures and an ORM like Entity Framework or NHibernate

  • Building web applications using an MVC framework

  • Writing automated tests using NUnit, JUnit or an equivalent

  • Using distributed version control, preferably Git or Mercurial

  • Breaking down user stories into actionable tasks

  • The ability to communicate cross-functionally among other departments



Ideally, you also:




  • Have built or worked on a RESTful API. Experience with Microsoft WebAPI is a plus.

  • Understand and can recognize design patterns

  • Have worked with at least one NoSQL platform

  • Have implemented responsive design techniques for mobile-friendly applications

  • Have client-side experience in one or more JavaScript frameworks

  • Have worked with a CSS framework like Bootstrap or Foundation

  • Know how to write code that's safe to deploy in a Continuous Integration environment



Why work at uShip?




  • Competitive Salary

  • 100% Paid health and dental insurance

  • Pre-IPO Stock Options

  • Annual uShip Free Shipping Allowance ($500)

  • Free lunch, snacks, and drinks

  • Dog friendly

  • Casual dress code

  • And so much more!



This position is located in Austin, TX.  Please check out our culture page (http://about.uship.com/culture/) to learn more about the perks and benefits of working at uShip!



Hear what our developers have to say about working at uShip...https://youtu.be/Ys-t6_s3PhA

jobs.title: Junior Developer
jobs.content:
We're looking for a junior full-stack JavaScript programmer to help expand the feature set for our database application builder product. Knack is a huge product that touches on all things data: you'll have a huge developer playground to dive right in and make a major impact.

__What You'll Do__

Contribute! We want our engineers to make an impact on the Knack product. This means you're not just implementing features that have been specified to death. It includes developing ideas, making suggestions, and keeping on top of new tech to understand how we can best leverage those to constantly improve the product.

Engage your passion! We have enough areas of need where we want to leverage what you're excited about and use that to make Knack a better product.

Program every day and publish many times every week.

Evaluate existing code and redesign for increased performance and reliability.

Help develop features missing from the current app to make Knack the go-to place for building online databases.

__Our Stack__
* Node.js
* MongoDB
* Solr
* jQuery, Backbone
* AWS
* Github

__What We're Looking For__

Efficiency and productivity, i.e. the ability to get sh!# done.

Great communication. If you like to go off to your bunker and only pop up on occasion this won't work.

An independent and versatile hacker, with the ability to pick up different languages, frameworks and techniques with relative ease.

A practical understanding of what programming is for. Hint: it's our customers.

A very strong foundation of client-side Javascript and Node.js.

A desire to be givin big responsibilites and to make the most of those opportunities to jump start your career

jobs.title: Linux System/Driver Developer
jobs.content:
Cloud Platform Group at Intel is looking for a person to work on pathfinding projects in the area of compute offloading and compute acceleration in a cloud. Big part of considered area of acceleration spans image and voice recognition and HW Neural Networks implementation and learning. We are seeking a software engineer who is highly motivated, creative and innovative, and has a strong passion for designing, developing and implementing new software running driving Intel Hardware. An engineer who has a good understanding of low level software engineering mainly based on Linux Operating system. As a member of the team you will be responsible for designing, developing, implementing and maintaining device drivers and Operating System that support the Intel chipsets. You will have an opportunity to work very closely with internal and external stakeholders.



Your responsibilities will include but not be limited to:



  • Collaborate with business and other technical leaders to clearly understand business objectives, customer needs, and product requirements. Create requirements documents.

  • Research on acceleration technologies that push the boundaries and capabilities of the current software solutions in the area of machine learning, visual and audio processing, security, coding/decoding.

  • Actively participating in all major stages of software development lifecycle, e.g. create high and low level design documents, scope tasks and provide SW estimates, complete implementation and code reviews, unit-test and validate the code

  • Design and implement automated HW-SW integration tests, execute them and report results .

  • Work in an efficient manner with no assistance from the supervisor

  • Work in a diverse team environment, as well as independently

  • Occasionally travelling to and assisting the customers or other Intel teams located across the globe

jobs.title: Digital Project Manager
jobs.content:
The digital project manager role at Therefore is a cross-functional job that is one part project manager, one part product owner, and one part client relations.


We're looking for people who are technically excellent but more importantly we're looking for people who understood how to apply technology.


If you think you're up for it, this role will almost certainly provide excellent opportunities for you to grow professionally, make use of your diverse skill set and keep you on your toes.


In this role, you'll be working directly with clients, or strategy team and production teams on a regular basis. You'll ensure that the team has everything they need to be able to build high-quality software, quickly. Clients will look to you for guidance and support.


The Digital Project Manager role emphasizes exceptional interpersonal skills, adept task planning and management, and a thorough understanding of product and project life cycles in the context of professional services. You’ll be most content in this role if you:



  • Are a natural leader. You use your interpersonal and leadership skills to motivate and guide your team within a quality focused fast growing agency with the goal of consistently exceeding clients’ expectations

  • Are skilled in guiding clients to decisions and managing their expectations throughout the process in order to maximize their goals and satisfaction

  • Have a strong understanding of modern software development tools and methodologies

  • Have a design or technical background, and are passionate about combining the power of design and development in an iterative fashion

  • Want the opportunity to work with clients in large enterprises and are able to easily establish trusting relationships with individuals

  • Have the ability to run workshops with and facilitate decision-making for various groups of individuals that often have competing goals

  • Enjoy creating a plan as much as executing on it to create tangible value

  • Have a design or technical background, and are passionate about combining the power of design and development in an iterative fashion

  • Are open to getting your hands dirty and learning about various parts of the business which include business development, account management, and production delivery

  • Able to juggle a number of responsibilities at any given point in time, and play different roles on the team and projects if necessary

  • Have a positive outlook, great composure, love to solve problems and share knowledge

jobs.title: Mobile iOS Developer
jobs.content:
In the last 12 months we have built a pioneering financial application which we would like to accelerate building as a new venture. Therefore we ramp up a team which will fully focus on the marketing and business development of the product. Working with us means taking responsibility from day one. As the team’s first tech-ninja, you will be in charge of shaping the application. If you are passionate about pushing mobile technologies to the limits, HERE YOU GO!



Tech Stack you need to handle

Your tasks

jobs.title: Senior Back End Focused Full Stack .NET Developer
jobs.content:
We want to work with people that thrive in an unstructured, startup environment who are creative and independent – folks who solve problems they haven’t even been asked to solve.  As important you'll need to have the ambition and eagerness to learn new skills and new technologies.


We value the ability to get things done. We don’t keep track of how much or when you work, just what you accomplish. At Venga you’ll need to speak up and be heard, pitch in wherever and whenever needed. And in return, you’ll have the most rewarding (in many ways) work experience of your life.

jobs.title: Implementation Engineer
jobs.content:
InFlight is looking for an Implementation Engineer who understands the root causes of the problem, delivers a full resolution to the customer, and makes strategic recommendations to the developers. A hybrid support person who does so much more, including work on other development and process-improvement projects as needed. 


What we do


At InFlight, we believe that multimillion dollar enterprise software can and should be every bit as easy-to-use as a $1 smartphone app.


InFlight modernizes and mobilizes business critical enterprise applications for Fortune 500 customers, giving them full control over the user experience.


Our technology is unique in the market and enables customers to completely re-imagine cumbersome and complicated applications to put users first and make it easier for them to complete tasks.


Thanks to InFlight, there are currently over 1 million users who are now more productive and more engaged with the software they rely on to do their jobs.


So what do we need? Someone who wants to:



  • Participate in our team-based sales process (setting up compelling customer-specific demo environments, analyzing customer requirements to determine our product’s suitability, etc.)

  • Install and configure InFlight products in customer environments

  • Help build installer scripts (or helping augment customer-provided installer scripts) for migrations to Production and pre-Production environments

  • Manage the InFlight customer support portal and associated processes

  • Take ownership of customer reported issues and resolving them without the need for escalation

  • Document troubleshooting and problem resolution steps

  • Provide training to customers as needed

  • Champion best-practices to help make InFlight “harder, better, faster, stronger”

jobs.title: Senior iOS Engineer
jobs.content: MassLight is hiring a iOS Developer in our Washington, D.C. office (onsite only). You will be working as part of team developing high profile, public facing, mobile applications. We build apps for equity in startups and on a fee for service basis for mature organizations.

jobs.title: Software engineer
jobs.content:
As a software engineer at data Artisans, you will take a dual role: being involved in both the open source Apache Flink project, as well as data Artisans' products. You should be comfortable with taking responsibility for designs and features, and be able to work both self-supervised and in cross-functional teams. As a citizen of the Flink open source community, you will be in direct touch with Flink users and participate in the day-to-day open source work.


We also encourage engineers to talk publicly about their work at conferences, meetups, and via blog posts.

jobs.title: Agile iOS Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an iOS Developer to join our Apple Client Team. If you have genuine enthusiasm for software development, a deep knowledge of Object Oriented Design and iOS development, you love Apple platform and you are looking for a place to express your talent, Funambol is the place for you.

As an Apple developer, your job will be to write hi-quality, flexible, working code to make the OneMediaHub for iOS app the best cloud app in terms of user experience and reliability.

You will work in an truly agile team located in Pavia (IT) or Leiria (PT)

jobs.title: Principal Architect I
jobs.content:
Shape the future of SaaS architecture


If you want to take the front seat in shaping future architecture of Software as a Service (SaaS) come and join us at Concur!


Be a part of R&D organization setting standards for new development and deployment models, and enabling development teams to migrate legacy systems into future. Concur delivers its vision of the Perfect Trip to customers by empowering developers to build their own vision of a perfect career in a friendly, collaborative, and agile team environment.



In the first 12 months you will:



Design and build Java framework to provide utilities, flow and platform for development of new features and services
Prototype and provide path of migrating legacy code (Progress 4GL) to Java
Enhance the technology behind Concur’s Travel, Expense, Invoice, Analytics, and Government stacks
Work with your team and product managers to identify problems that can be solved as we transition from legacy n-tiered architectures into a modern service-oriented, microservices-based approach
Grow the community and practice of architecture across Concur and facilitate information sharing, adoption of design patterns, and cross-pollination of ideas between teams in R&D organization
Become a liaison between the Concur Government R&D and other Concur/SAP R&D teams



In order to accomplish this you will need to:


Have solid grounding in computer science fundamentals, especially hands-on experiences working at consumer-facing software-as-a-service providers and utilization of public cloud infrastructures
Knowledge of state of the art techniques fundamental to enterprise architecture, as well as demonstrated leadership in transforming organizations’ infrastructures
Gain complex product functionality and architecture knowledge
Use computer programming languages, software tools, and software development environments to code, modify, and prototype programs
Participate in company-wide initiatives to develop design patterns, and champion them on the relevant R&D teams
Provide feedback on functionality requests regarding feasibility and complexity
Actively participate in code and design reviews
Construct Java microservice development/packaging/continuous integration/deployment environment and flow with GitHub/Docker/Kubernetes or similar tools
Have results driven personality, high enthusiasm, energy, and confidence

jobs.title: Frontend Developer JavaScript
jobs.content:
YOUR TASKS



  • Developing and optimising an innovative, customised, web-based software using the latest technologies, together with the team

  • Developing Single Page Web Applications based on JavaScript and REST-APIs

  • Using modern JavaScript Frameworks and Libraries such as jQuery, Ember.js, etc.

  • Ensuring the quality of web applications and taking responsibility for functionality development and testing

  • Taking technical responsibility and incorporating your own ideas

jobs.title: Java Web Developer
jobs.content:
Do you want to be a part of one of the top 10 best retail companies to work for? Do you want to join a team using next-generation technology to change the face of a fortune 500 company? Are you ready to push the boundaries of technology? We are looking for a motivated Java Developer with strong analytical skills to work in a fast paced environment.


This candidate needs to have multiple years experience in software development with an eye for detail and an appetite to leverage technology to solve business challenges. The person filling this position must be a hands-on, proactive, self-motivated, go getter, with a strong desire to succeed in a challenging environment. We value enthusiasm, hard work and dedication to our company and our way of doing business


If you have passion for software development and take pride in your work, then O'Reilly is looking for you. Be ready to push your boundaries and take your skills to the next level. Based on skills and experience, there are remote opportunities for this position.

jobs.title: Senior / Lead SQL Developer
jobs.content:
Exceedra is seeking experienced developers to become either Senior or Lead SQL Developers, who have created robust and scalable OLTP or Data Warehouse solutions.


Candidates should have multi-year experience in both TSQL and Stored Procedures. While experience in either SSIS or SSAS is an advantage, cross-training in relevant BI technologies will be available for successful candidates from a pure OLTP background.


Bringing development experience and best practice to Exceedra’s EMEA Delivery team, Senior and Lead Developers will be accountable for significant portions of projects spanning multiple clients. This will include discussing and agreeing requirements before designing and implementing solutions using the SQL Server stack, ensuring high quality standards are achieved throughout.


Senior and Lead Developers can expect to be recognised as subject matter experts, have leading roles on projects, and mentor junior staff on a day to day basis.


They will report directly to, and be supported by, the Technical Principal (EMEA).


Role Responsibilities:



  • Use analytical, problem solving and engineering skills to deliver solutions built upon Exceedra’s award-winning technology stack.

  • Own significant parts of client implementations, and ensure their high quality.

  • Be responsible for the timely delivery of multiple concurrent projects.

  • Proactively identify risks to implementations, suggesting appropriate remedial actions.

  • Follow internal processes, methodology and best practices, contributing to their continued evolution.

  • Understand the Exceedra technology stack from both a technical and business perspective.

  • Develop your own skillset and that of the team around you, providing expert advice on all areas of the SQL Server stack.

  • Liaise directly with Project Manager, stakeholders and other team members to ensure a common understanding of task progress.

Candidates should have multi-year experience in both TSQL and Stored Procedures. While experience in either SSIS or SSAS is an advantage, cross-training in relevant BI technologies will be available for successful candidates from a pure OLTP background.


SQL Developers will own significant portions of projects spanning multiple clients. This will include discussing and agreeing requirements before designing and implementing solutions using the SQL Server stack, ensuring high quality standards are achieved throughout.

jobs.title: Support Engineer @ Crate.io
jobs.content:
Crate.io is hiring! We are looking for an awesome Support Engineer to join our team in Berlin or Dornbirn (Austria).


Your Responsibilities



  • Working with Crate's wide variety of users and customers to help them disrupt the way they think about data;

jobs.title: Senior Customer Support Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Fugue Customer Support Engineer you will…



  • Act as the primary point of contact for customers regarding software product support during post-sales and selected pre-sales situations

  • Respond to customer product inquiries via telephone, email, or online chat

  • Resolve customer concerns at all stages of product use, including during installation, operation, and software maintenance

  • Answer questions regarding Fugue product usage in context of customer use cases, provide trouble-shooting and assist customers per support procedures

  • Recognize need to escalate incidents, tickets, emails, etc. to Fugue Product Management, Product Engineering or Documentation teams as appropriate

  • Participate in early testing and familiarization of next-release and new software products

  • Maintain Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system data per Fugue support procedures

  • Help define and provide feedback & suggestions on improvements to Fugue customer support procedures

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Full Stack Developer  Europe
jobs.content:
Email Hunter crunches the web's data to allow businesses to connect to each other. More than one hundred thousand users are using our products every week. And our growth continues! We focus on building a powerful, simple and efficient service. We're looking for a Full Stack Developer to help us create the perfect experience for our users.

At Email Hunter, we prefer to spend most of our energy building the best possible product. We believe in systems and processes that let us scale our impact to be larger than ourselves.

We're looking for a passionate developer to work on the application and help all sales and recruiting people dream of. You will work both on the back-end (in particular our API) and the front facing part of our service. Our service is expanding and you'll be part of building this future.

On a daily basis, you obsess over details. You know that small changes in UI or copywriting can make a big difference on thousands of users using Email Hunter every day. At the same time, you're searching for efficiency. You like to focus on what's essential and solve technical problems with elegant solutions. Simplicity is reflected in both your code and the features you build.

REQUIREMENTS

  • You are based in Europe
  • You write high quality, maintainable and testable code in Ruby on Rails
  • You're very comfortable with JavaScript (bonus points for familiarities with Backbone.js)
  • You have strong English communication skills
  • You are detail-oriented and want to deliver the best experience possible to Email Hunter's users!

BENEFITS

We love working at Email Hunter. We're psyched by what we're building and the context we're doing it in. You'll get the chance to feel the same and take part in the adventure with us. The perks you'll get to enjoy:

  • Remote & flexible work
  • 3 company-paid annual retreats to amazing places
  • Profit sharing
  • Flat hierarchy

To apply: Apply online: https://emailhunter.workable.com/jobs/287671If you have any question, please contact Franois: francois@emailhunter.co

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Giant Swarms mission is to give developers the power and freedom to build the software that runs the world.

Developers use Giant Swarm to easily deploy, run, and scale their applications as well as easily collaborate on and share their infrastructure stacks with the community.


# We are looking for a Software Engineer (m/f)#
**Your Job:**

* You will be responsible for architecting and building distributed systems
* You will use a wide variety of open source technologies and tools
* You take part for testing, metrics, continuous integration

**Requirements:**

* You have experience with more than one language and a strong architectural background. One of these languages is Go.
* You love to automate things and you are used to deploy in production multiple times a day
* You are a profound Linux user
* You have worked with docker, experiences with kubernetes, prometheus are a bonus point
* You prefer to build your applicatinons as multiple services instead of a monolith
* You know the concepts of CAP theorem, paxos/raft concensus, distributed databases and message passing

**WHY US?**

We like to give you a glimpse on how working with is like:

**Self-organization**

Creative work needs freedom and openness. We encourage you to do your work wherever and whenever you want. We expect passion and encourage sustainability. If you need rest, take it. We don't count holidays - we count outcome.

**Teamwork**

Our ambitious goals are only achievable as a team. Everybodys input is highly welcome and appreciated. Although sometimes rules and processes are necessary, we try to keep them as lean as possible. Always question the status quo and find new ways of collaboration and team work.

**Learning**

Learning is mandatory and fun at the same time. If you realize you want to expand your knowledge in a specific area, we support you with conferences, books etc.

**Basics**

We offer fair (transparent and open) salaries with benefits like choosing your own laptop, jobticket, coffee flat, mate etc.. And you will participate in our stock options program. Currently our team members have more children than we are employees. So family friendliness is a must.

jobs.title: Senior Software Development Engineer, AWS Networking
jobs.content:
Amazon is looking for Software Development Engineers to build the software that monitors one of the world’s largest and most complex networks. Tens of millions of customers rely on Amazon’s network for using our retail websites, accessing content on their Kindles and building applications and businesses on top of Amazon Web Services (AWS). Our goal is to become The Infrastructure Platform for the world - achieving this goal requires high-leverage, massively scalable software systems. Our success depends on our world-class network infrastructure, and our network depends on our Network Monitoring team.



· You are interested in being part of a high-bar team with global responsibility for the Network Monitoring software used across all of Amazon’s businesses.

· Solving problems at scale excites you.

· You don’t implement specs from analysts and architects - you talk to your customers and design solutions to their problems. You automate and innovate.

· You do not push just one technology agenda - you choose the best tool for the problem at hand.

· You believe that the craft of software engineering is about writing code right the first time. For you, code reviews and automated testing are not chores - they’re a core part of writing great software.

· You don’t throw your code over the wall. You launch it, own it, support it and make it incrementally better for the benefit of your customers.

· You enjoy working in a flexible, fast-paced, collaborative team environment.

· Computer Science degree, or equivalent experience.

· Ability to gather customer requirements and deliver innovative solutions.

· Strong track record of launching projects of significant complexity.

· Ability to mentor other software developers to maintain architectural vision and software quality.

· Experience with software engineering best practices (code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, release and change management).

· Very strong problem solving and coding skills.

· Understanding of data structures, algorithms and their performance.

· Proficient at designing software systems, from high-availability large-scale distributed systems to your application’s object model.

· Understanding of the building blocks of computer systems; comfortable working with bits & bytes.

· Knowledge of at least one scripting language.

· Comfortable with Linux and a good understanding of networking concepts.



· Experience of working in a DevOps team.

· Experience developing robust, highly scalable distributed systems.



aws-sdesdm-ea

jobs.title: Backbone Network Engineer - GNS Core Services
jobs.content:
This position will be responsible for daily operations and engineering within Core Network Services, supporting Apple’s MPLS backbone as well as its extensive edge connectivity. The successful candidate will demonstrate leadership and collaboration skills in working both with other IS&T organizations and their peers to build and maintain the networking infrastructure. They will need to develop and maintain clear documentation and procedures associated with designing and implementing new deployments, provisioning new circuits, and sustaining operations. This position provides the opportunity to build and manage a world-wide, multivendor network that includes metro and long haul optical interconnectivity.


Description


This position will support and implement Apple’s backbone network to address a wide variety of business challenges. The candidate will need to excel in a fast-paced and dynamic environment with the ability to multi-task and provide not only operational support but work closely with members of the Core Services team to provide solutions to grow our network infrastructure. This position requires a collaborative team player who will work in cross-functional groups and have the ability and willingness to work with others. The responsibilities also include updating and maintaining existing networks to current standards, sustaining operations, and contributing to technical documentation. The position includes participation in an on-call (7x24) support rotation with other members of the global network team. This person will need to obsess over the customer experience and to drive operational excellence in every aspect of their work. In addition to the technical networking skills, this position also requires strong people skills and an individual who enjoys the dynamic nature of Apple’s environment.

jobs.title: 7.5TB per day read from our production MongoDB cluster - Help us scale up!
jobs.content:
DevOps Engineer


Sky Betting and Gaming aims to bring the excitement of sports betting, casino, poker and bingo to a rapidly growing number of customers in the betting and gaming market. Through our close relationships with Sky Sports we can provide a unique opportunity to deliver a real experience that makes us stand out in the online gaming sector.   We're striving to be the best digital business in the UK and we're well on our way, this year we've been nominated as one of The Sunday Times Top 100 companies to work for as well as bagging a handful of accolades at the 2015 EGR awards and we're not planning on slowing down anytime soon! From our base in Leeds and across all our sites, we are experiencing rapid growth and are constantly looking for the best talent to help us in our continued success. Are you in?


If you have the right skills and experience, DevOps at SB&G is where we will test it all.  We bridge Delivery and Service Operations.  We sit with the devs, but we are on-call for the services.  We work with the Platform team and 3rd parties.


If you join us, you'll:
•    Be on-call sometimes 24x7 for the main sites and applications
•    Support internal development, test environments and help the devs
•    Own the release of internal code and push out config changes
•    Help automate things and bring older systems and processes forward
•    Be a guardian of code quality, helping the devs to make not just good features, but good systems
•    Set up monitoring for everything in sight - if it moves, graph it
•    Be a point of contact into Operations for various teams


We're looking for a developer with sys-admin war stories, or a sys-admin who can get into the code up to their elbows.  Mainly you need to know your stuff.


Data management - SQL, NoSQL, size, performance - these are mere details; you can make the data dance and the engine hum.


Code - you can branch, code, test, (code, test, code, test…), commit and deploy across a complex estate on just one cup of coffee.


Scaling - you can take a server's temperature, read a load-balancer, you know when to throw tin at it and when to go back to the code.


Automation - you understand the quandary of Chef vs Puppet, and you've had to choose; you know Jenkins' little foibles; your bash skills are strong.


Source - you have a favourite source-control system, a least favourite and the one you love to hate, but mainly you can handle the codebase no matter the size.


Systems - you know your Linux, know your sar from your iostat, you can nurse a sick server back to health in the wee small hours and find out how to make a given application fly…


Experience - whether you've been there and done that or are relatively junior, you've learned from every twist and turn and never tire of new things.  We will consider junior, senior and in-betweeners.


Systems we use


We want you to help manage the LAMP stack but there's other things too - Mongo, Redis and Memcached, RabbitMQ, Tomcat.  There's a lot of internally-written systems.


We write our code in PHP and Javascript, making heavy use of NodeJS.  There's the usual mixture of bash, a little Python, some Ruby.  We use TrafficScript.  Source control is Git.


We have OpenBet systems for the gaming side.  We use Rundeck, Chef, Graphite, Opsview, Splunk, Hadoop, TeaLeaf, Riverbed Stingrays.


We're a RHEL/CentOS house.


As a valued employee you will benefit from Free Sky+HD premium package, an excellent Pension Scheme, Private Health Care together with a range of other benefits to help you make valuable tax and national insurance savings.


Grow with Sky Betting and Gaming


37.5 hour working week

Work with the Scrum Master and Engineering Manager to ensure that development follows an agreed waterfall or agile model throughout the delivery of an individual project.  Ensure that project reports are accurate and reflect known risks and issues to enable progress to be properly reported.

  • Commercial experience of OO development and design patterns.

  • Commercial experience of designing and developing software in an online business.

  • High availability (24×7×365) web systems experience.


As a valued employee you will benefit from Free Sky+HD premium package, an excellent Pension Scheme, Private Health Care together with a range of other benefits to help you make valuable tax and national insurance savings.


Grow with Sky Betting and Gaming

jobs.title: Senior Devops Engineer
jobs.content:
Role: Senior Devops Engineer


Date issued: 14 June 2016


Full Time Post


Salary: £58,000 to £68,000 incl London Weighting


Citizens Advice, based in Central London near St Paul’s, have made the strategic decision to move to Ruby as our de facto open source development language. As we build our new digital development capability and transition from PHP, we require a Devops Engineer who will report to our Head of Software Engineering as we build a fantastic engineering team.


This is an exciting time as you will have an opportunity  to assist in the direction of this important national charity as the team is scaled up . We have a number of exciting internally and externally customer facing digital projects with opportunities for R&D Fridays and creative thinking.    


We help change millions of people’s lives each year. And we need your help to make even more difference.


Why should I choose Citizens Advice?




  • A competitive salary 26 days paid holiday (on top of public holidays), up to 6.5% employer pension contributions.




  • The technology - it's always the latest stuff and forward looking. We are full AWS and deployed Google Enterprise for work across all 6 of our core offices in the UK.




  • Developers kit. Every developer has a Macbook Pro and whatever else we can provide to help you get the job done.




  • Our office is open plan and a great place to work.  




  • We will invest in your personal technical development to keep your skills sharp and encourage you to attend conferences covering the latest techniques to improve yourself  and the team.




  • We are flexible with one or two days of remote working from home.




  • We recognise the benefits of R&D time and opportunity to work on Alpha products.




  • Our great digital products help more than 22m users a year to solve their problems, and make a proven difference in people’s  lives.




Who We are?




  • A leading non-profit with more than 20,000 staff and volunteers in the wider service, and over 2,500 locations.




  • Awesome reach: 22 million people engage with our public facing web sites, and 6.2 million issues are handled in person locally.




  • Amazing customer satisfaction: 95% of our clients say they would recommend us.




  • We have a diverse digital portfolio of consumer products across different areas and markets, including money advice, consumer tools, witness service.




  • Citizens Advice is responsible for listening to people’s experiences, collecting data and then helping the government to instigate reform, as well as helping the millions of people across the UK desperately in need of advice.




What’s our tech?


We spend a lot of time picking and refining the right tools:




  • Our tech stack includes Docker, Jenkins, Chef, Ansible, Git, Elastic Search, Redis, Postgres, MySQL, Ruby, PHP, Ubuntu, Amazon Linux, AWS, CloudFormation, EC2, S3, CloudFront, Serverspec, New Relic




  • We have a road map for continuous deployments and ultimately continuous delivery across all of our digital products.




  • We use GitHub, Atlassian,  Invision, Slack, Google Hangouts et al to stay organised and in touch.




  • We are fully agile using either scrum or kanban.




  • Our approach to testing is to use the best practices for BDD/TDD.




What do we expect from you?




  • Experienced with Linux system administration, we use Ubuntu and Amazon Linux in our environments and you’ll be confident with these flavours




  • Network administration, you understand network protocols, DNS, load balancing and VPN’s




  • Virtualization and containerisation, you’ve worked with various virtualization platforms and have also kept up-to-date with the latest developments in container management systems (primarily docker and the open container initiative)




  • Writing scripts to automate repetitive tasks, if you have to do something more than once then you’d much rather automate it instead and you’ll also be keen to write tests for your automation scripts




  • Configuration management, you’ve used Chef or Ansible to configure large numbers of servers




  • Continuous integration, we currently use Jenkins and are moving to version 2 with the pipeline plug-in driven by JenkinsFiles




  • Cloud provisioning, configuration and monitoring, you have a proven track record of working with AWS




  • Problem solving, you’re passionate about solving issues and sharing your findings so that we can continuously improve




  • Implementing strategies for:-





    • Automation of manual tasks




    • Define, document and continuously improve operational processes




    • Data backup and disaster recovery




    • Monitoring and logging




    • Securing applications





  • We are interested in people who have strong green field development and product  experience, and minds who have spent time sweating the details about what is really important to customers.




  • Flexibility, dynamism, passionate about technology and continuous learning.




  • Experience of working in cross functional teams (highly desirable).




  • Masters in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.




  • People who want to work in a generous, inventive and responsible culture and help change millions of lives for better.




Candidates must be eligible to work in the UK without Visa Sponsorship

jobs.title: QA Engineer - C#, Selenium & WebDriver, Automated Testing for Mobile Payments
jobs.content:
What You Will Do



  • Design, build and maintain test frameworks

  • Write highly performant code

  • Ensure the highest possible quality in code and testing, automate as much as possible

  • Work with the product team to understand customer needs

  • Help with technical innovation



 Who We Are Looking For



  • It is an asset if you have a degree in Engineering or Computer Science

  • You will have 2-5 years working with many of the technologies listed above

  • High level of automation using Octopus/ssh/powershell/bash

  • It is an asset if you have experience of PCI-DSS compliance

  • Experience of Selenium, Appium, RestSharp plus any other test frameworks

  • Strong engineering background with excellent coding skills

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills whether working independently or in a team

  • Strong project and people management knowledge
