jobs.title: Linux Project Engineer
jobs.content:
Do you want to build the software that manages the fastest computers in the world? Do you want to change the world forever and combine High Performance Computing with Big Data and Cloud computing?


Built for the OpenStack cloud, ClusterVision has developed Trinity, a private-cloud next-generation management system suitable for High Performance Computing, Big Data and Cloud.


As our company is rapidly growing, we are looking for an eager Linux Project Engineer with excellent technical skills.


This position involves installing, configuring and testing of our clusters, as well as some technical escalation support. To succeed in this role you need to analyse the technical issues first and solve them in a very pragmatic way. You are able to work alongside our customer and put across out of the box solutions. If necessary, you will provide training in order to support our customers.


You will work with the latest hardware and software technologies such as cutting edge massive storage platforms, high speed network interconnects as InfiniBand, Omnipath and 10GE as well as modern High Performance Computing software.


There will be ample opportunity to develop your skills and professional growth.

jobs.title: IOS Developer

Position


As an iOS Developer at IceMobile you are responsible for creating, developing and deploying innovative Apps. By experience, talent and interest, you are on top of the latest relevant technologies and you know how to use it to deliver the end product to our client.You will be surrounded by talent from all over the world (more than 30 nationalities) who, like yourself, all eat, sleep and breathe mobile technology and are top league within the industry.

jobs.title: JavaScript Developer - Location Barcelona
jobs.content:
What is Casumo


Casumo as a company is a technology startup formed in 2012, Casumo as a product is a recognised and award winning online casino. Casumo as a concept though, is literally a whole new universe. We’re not working with casino, we’re working with changing what the common perception of casino is. Through design, technology & innovation we aim to disrupt a young, but in many ways immature, industry by ignoring rules.


Following initial success and growth Casumo is wholly committed to its focus on great technology as the driving force behind the way we work. We all share the responsibility of finding the right tools which allow us to preserve and fully embrace the flat organisation, and highly democratic workflows we enjoy today.


What would be your role?


Here at Casumo we have our lovingly crafted desktop app, our award winning mobile app, and a suite of bespoke tools to support us in being the best we can be. These are all constantly evolving through the combined creativity of everyone here. As part of the team you will help guide this evolution in collaboration with a full stack team of developers and designers, while working closely with our content producers, marketing gurus, player ambassadors, and anyone else who wants to get involved.


There are many great ideas being suggested here at Casumo, so you will need to explore them and discover for yourself what you find most interesting, and then get stuck in! Collaboration works best with great communication so you will need to share what you are up to with the team, and reach out for help when you need it. We all share the responsibility for improving our products, our code and our teamwork so you’ll need to get involved, and above all be the change you want to see.


Who are you?


You are a JS developer who has worked on a number of interesting and successful projects, where you have needed to collaborate but also driven the project forward yourself. You are an open minded, honest and a driven problem solver who is, not only hungry for more learnings, but also able to spread knowledge to others around you.


Does this sound like you?



  • Takes pride in the code they write and understands the importance of writing in a scalable and maintainable way.

  • Has a true interest that reaches beyond any course or education.

  • Eager to keep up to date with the latest JS developments and tools.

  • Loves that batman joke.

  • Independent and self motivated.

  • Can create positive changes, without losing friends over the existence of semi-colons.

  • Can work with backend developers to design awesome apis.

  • Excited to write in a declarative functional style.

  • Strong with TDD, Unit and Functional Testing in JavaScript.

  • A jolly good sentient being.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
At BearingPoint Ireland, we are growing quickly and have a number of exciting new projects to challenge the very best DevOps Engineers. We are working with a wide range of clients, on a number of complex projects that are transforming the way business is being done in Ireland.


The DevOps Engineer (Java) will be responsible for maintaining and improving an enterprise continuous integration / delivery framework. This person is responsible for recommending, developing, and implementing the automated frameworks to maximize the efficiency of the build and release process. You will work within an Agile delivery environment and support multiple project teams and codebases to enable the deployment of application releases to controlled test and production environments.


The role:


We currently have an exciting opportunity in our Dublin office for a DevOps Engineer. As a DevOps Engineer, you will work within our Release Management Team and work closely with the Development and QA Teams on all software builds and releases.


The role will involve:



  • Collaboration with Software Development, QA Engineers, and System Architects to continuously improve the efficiency and reliability of build and deployment processes to support all phases of development, QA and production releases.

  • Providing and maintaining a detailed understanding of the structure and inter-dependencies of systems and leverage this knowledge to improve our build and release processes.

  • Maintaining and enhancing our Continuous Integration environment on a real-time basis, monitoring builds, maintaining configuration, and developing automation.

  • Demonstrating expertise in a range of automation tools and approaches in a Unix environment (e.g. Jenkins/TeamCity, Maven, Ansible), as well as other scripting languages.

  • Automating the build, Continuous Integration (CI) and deployment processes.

  • Supporting automated build, release & test solutions, internal tools development for automation, maintenance of build environments, etc.

  • Coordinating releases including pre-release checks, validation of release change sets,    release schedule, code freeze, SVN to GIT migration, etc.

  • Creation of new environments and updates to these environments including configuration of Jenkins and application support.

  • Solid experience of the SVN/GIT, Jenkins/TeamCity for Continuous Integration builds.

  • Experience working with DevOps methodologies.

  • Experience with rapidly troubleshooting application configuration issues in Unix environments.

jobs.title: System Administrator Linux
jobs.content:
Wirecard is a globally operating and leading provider of technology for electronic payments in all distribution channels: Online, mobile and at the point-of-sale

As a software and IT service provider listed on the TecDAX of the Deutsche Börse, Wirecard AG, based in Aschheim near Munich, is one of the globally leading independent providers of outsourcing and white label solutions for payment innovations.

The companies belonging to the Wirecard Group develop intelligent solutions to assist mail-order merchants, tourism and haulage companies as well as providers of digital goods and services with electronic payment transactions. 


We are looking for a System Administrator Linux (m/f)  to join our team at Wirecard Technologies GmbH, a subsidiary in Aschheim/Munich.



Your Duties




  • Operating and planning of an enterprise server environment

  • Support of development, QA and production systems

  • Install, upgrade and support of infrastructure services

  • Development and maintainance of different administrative applications and scripts

  • Enterprise-level Troubleshooting and Analyzing

  • Conceptional work and project based work

  • Optimizing performance and reviewing concepts of the current IT Infrastructure

  • Coordination of subcontractors



Your Profile



  • BS/BA in Computer Science or related discipline

  • Several years of related IT engineering or operations experience in an enterprise-class environment

  • Excellent knowledge of linux core platform and infrastructure with Red Hat (RHEL)

  • Excellent history of enterprise-level troubleshooting

  • Excellent knowledge with install, configuration and support of a linux enterprise environment

  • Excellent knowledge of virtualization (VMware) and scripting (Ruby, Perl)

  • Good Knowledge in planing and building IT infrastructure for highly scaleable and high available systems

  • Good Knowledge of IT Infrastructure services (Infoblox, Puppet, Satelitte) is a plus

  • Good Knowledge in working with web servers (Apache)

  • Good Knowledge in working with application server (Tomcat/Weblogic/JBoss)

  • Knowdlege in working with databases like MySQL

  • Good communication skills, including creation of engineering documentation and presentations of varying technical levels

  • Fluent english written and spoken skills



What we offer



  • Challenging and diverse tasks with scope for introducing your own ideas and experience

  • An excellent working atmosphere in a highly-motivated and successful team with an international company culture

  • Further professional and personal development at one of the world's leading providers of payment processing

  • An attractive salary as well as long-term prospects and a chance for promotion in a successful company that is growing strongly

  • A modern workplace with additional company benefits such as a canteen, fitness area, incentives and staff events



Become part of our success story. Become part of a highly qualified team, united by a vision: to make payment happen.

For any questions please contact:

Mr. Benedikt Bossert
Human Resources Manager

benedikt.bossert@wirecard.com
+49 89 4424 1323

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Digital Analytics Team
jobs.content:
The BlueLabs Digital Analytics team is a fast-paced, innovative, and agile group that is at the forefront of revolutionizing the ways that citizens use and learn about services. Our analytics support ranges from strategic analysis—such as identifying year-over-year trends in demand and availability—to operational support—such as measuring the effectiveness of specific outreach tactics. Our work focuses on individual targeted outreach efforts across email, SMS, phone, and mail, empowered by a culture of testing. These contacts have direct, measurable impact on the lives of millions of individuals. We work closely with internal government innovation groups, and build on the analytics methodology pioneered in e-commerce, advocacy, and retail.


AS PART OF THE DIGITAL ANALYTICS ENGINEERING TEAM AT BLUELABS, YOU’LL...




    • Make a difference. The digital analytics engineering team supplies the engine at the heart of our analytics operations. Your role will be first and foremost about enabling the BlueLabs team to succeed in its mandate to improve the lives of citizens.

    • Learn and adapt. As a member of the digital analytics engineering team, you will work in BlueLabs cutting-edge technology stack. You’ll be called on to wear several hats: frontend, backend, DevOps.

    • Design. We’re building a platform to support teams like our digital analytics team, and our engineers are the driving force behind it. You'll need to understand the problem and define it. Your own expertise and experience will help us design the solution we need.

    • Collaborate. Every project benefits from diverse viewpoints from the very beginning, and so you’ll work closely with analysts and data scientists and with our clients to develop the technology that empowers them to drive change.

    • Create. Ultimately, we’re looking for you not just to write code—but to create apps, systems, and solutions that are challenging and exciting.



AS AN ENGINEER ON OUR DIGITAL TEAM, YOU'LL...




    • Join a team of engineers with responsibility for the development, deployment, and support of BlueLabs technology in support of the government analytics team.

    • Architect and implement the data pipelines that power the day-to-day work of our analysts and clients.

    • Participate in all aspects of agile software development, including design, implementation, and deployment, with a focus on owning small-to-medium features.

    • Engage in pairing, design review, and code review to improve our code and systems.

    • Contribute to engineering team’s mission to improve continuously, by leading and participating in planning sessions, code reviews, and best practices discussions.

jobs.title: Java Software Architect

jobs.title: Lead Test Engineer
jobs.content:
HERE is a leader in navigation, mapping and location experiences. We combine highly accurate and fresh maps with cloud technology to enable rich, real-time location experiences in a broad range of connected devices – from smartphones and tablets to wearables and vehicles. To learn more about HERE, including our work in the areas of connected and autonomous driving, visit http://360.here.com 


The Geo Insights team of Here Enterprise is responsible for big data crunching, analytics and cool visualization on HERE maps.  We consist of enthusiastic scrum teams who work together to deploy new code to production daily. 


We are looking for a lead specialist who can help us build effective end to end quality system, plan and execute extensive product and data testing, perform test automation and embed quality into the scrum process.


In this position, as the QA team leader you will be responsible for:


Designing, building & maintaining our quality system based on processes and tests automation


Making technology/frameworks decisions in conjunction with our tech leads to ensure we are building quality into our product throughout its lifecycle



  • Organizing & building automated and manual testing for our servers, web applications, databases and APIs.

  • Organizing & building performance and load testing looking at server and client performance.

  • Supporting the product teams in maintaining a high level of test coverage so we can continue to deploy new releases continuously.

  • Maintaining the tests’ documentation and reports.

jobs.title: Full Stack Web Developer
jobs.content:
We offer an exciting and fast-paced working environment and challenging responsibilities. Working in an Agile environment with three week iterations you will work in an open, collaborative atmosphere. We welcome suggestions and within our flat management structure your ideas become part of the discussion; giving you the opportunity to make a difference immediately.



Our web developers are responsible for participating in application design, development, testing, validation, maintenance, and enhancement projects and should possess specialized technical knowledge covering API, functionality, user experience and document control converting clients conceptual requirements into solutions using appropriate and applicable SharePoint application development.


There is a high level of collaboration between project team members and with other stakeholders. To this end we operate in an open space environment where ideas as well as challenges can be shared to ensure we get to the best solution possible for our clients.



Our developers translate requirements into an appropriate design, formulate and define application scope and objectives, and implement complete solutions.  Our products are developed to comply with architectural and usability standards and established methodologies and practices.

jobs.title: Systems Architect - Fight cancer with code
jobs.content:
Offer


RaySearch is developing the next generation oncology information system to support improved cancer care and is now looking for talented systems architects. This is a unique opportunity to build software that improves the lives of cancer patients around the world.


You will be part of a project consisting of several agile teams, each with the mission to define and develop key product and platform functionality in close collaboration with stakeholders such as other architects, product owners and hospital end-users. You will be part of designing and implementing a new robust and scalable software platform without legacy code.


RaySearch is an industry leader in software for radiation therapy with a strong focus on research and development that offers excellent staff benefits in a stimulating environment with highly skilled colleagues. The position is based at our new head office in central Stockholm and entitles fulltime, permanent work.


Job description


You will work with one or several agile teams. Your mission is to together with the teams define and implement a high-level architecture which supports the functional and technical requirements.


Your focus should be on sustainable software development, ensuring code quality and great engineering practices. You should be passionate about well-constructed and maintainable code.


You should enjoy getting your hands dirty with the source code in order to build great functionality and to get a good understanding of the system and the daily challenges faced by the developers.


Key responsibilities



  • Accountable for quality of code and architecture in your area

  • Establish and drive engineering practices around sustainable software development

  • Identify, motivate and specify internal technical projects and prioritize them with the product owner

  • Act as a role model and coach to other members of the team, using code reviews, coding standard oversight and best practices management

  • Ensure that there is no unmotivated long-term drift in key metrics, such as development speed, performance or memory usage

  • Create cutting-edge reusable and scalable Technologies



Please note: Due to summer vacations applications will be considered and responded to in mid-August.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - C# WPF - Innovative company in Rotterdam
jobs.content:
Our software development team has an open culture. We prefer to work agile (scrum) and in close cooperation with our colleagues from other disciplines such as our analytical consultants and client facing colleagues.


You will join our software engineers to take responsibility for the development of the business logic of our applications. You are able to turn complex business requirements into software requirements and you are able to design and implement appropriate algorithms. You apply a high standard to your code and its maintainability, are used to writing unit tests and are comfortable with a culture of peer reviewing. You are a self-motivated, creative thinker, you are flexible and enjoy working in teams.


Pointlogic accommodates employees that wish to develop their capabilities in relevant areas by means of supporting studies and facilitating R&D projects.


Our offering



  • Exciting development projects;

  • A friendly, international, dynamic environment;

  • Opportunities for professional and personal development;

  • Flexible working hours;

  • Competitive compensation package which includes pension, healthcare and flexible benefits.


If this vacancy appeals to you, please send your motivation letter and CV to Elvira van Noort at careers@pointlogic.com. We prefer to receive responses to this vacancy by e-mail.

jobs.title: Release Manager
jobs.content:
Release Management is central to the way we deliver IT and is one of the most exciting transformations at BearingPoint today. Your position as Release Manager will govern the release process working with diverse teams who drive our delivery success. You need to have experience managing outsourced partners both onshore and offshore and enjoy that diverse challenge.


You’ll think “big picture” and continue to transform Release Management into something that will be a best in class framework of delivery for our clients’ products and services, with the probable opportunity to build and develop the release management function and associated team over time, as more platforms are added. You’ll use your experience gained in a large commercial organisation to inspire, influence, get people on board and lead change especially with our senior management and executive community.


We are working with a wide range of clients across many industries on a number of complex projects that are transforming the way business is being done. We are looking for a talented Release Manager for a permanent full time role in our high performance ITA (IT Advisory) team focused initially in telecommunications.


Responsibilities



  • Support the delivery of projects and programmes for a specified Release through the application of the Release Management Framework

  • Manage relationships with partners, internal and external stakeholders to successful implementation of the specified Release and contribute to the evolution of the Release Management Framework

  • Working both internally with our development, design and test teams, project managers as well as working with the Client (release managers, project managers and other senior clients) to agree and work to a joint process to deliver every release cleanly

  • Drive/evolve our processes, gain clarity on roles and responsibilities as well as working towards “continuous improvement”

  • Act as a point of escalation for all Release Management activities related to the specified Release

  • Own the Critical Success Levels for the specified Release (CSLs) – monitoring critical success levels and quality measures, reporting where decisions will impact our ability to achieve the targets

  • Provide reports on key Release Management plans, metrics, risks and issues, own the regular management reporting for the specified Release and drive continuous improvement

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Web Developer
jobs.content:
ComeOn.com is a service orientated web application available on desktop and mobile devices with the user experience being our top priority. The client side is a multi-device web solution which is rich of AJAX, JavaScript, jQuery and HTML5 to enrich the customer’s experience. On the server side the business logic is proprietary developed Java and Scala code together with open source frameworks and external integration modules.


We are looking for experienced Front-end Web Developers who want to help us build the best gambling site out there, and by best we mean it’s accessible, responsive, performance friendly, scalable and test driven. You will work with all parts of the system and through all stages of the development process in a team orientated and agile environment. As a Front-end Developer you will work closely with our designers, backend developers, testers and the business team in the organisation to develop and implement new features.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer for a Healthcare Company
jobs.content:
Why do you want to work here? Do you crave building experiences and systems that delight users internally and externally? Do you love to continually learn, grow, and work with others who share your passion? Do you want to innovate and make the world a healthier place?


If you answered yes, Premise Health is a leading provider of employer-dedicated onsite health centers that are designed to provide more meaningful, effective and higher quality health care to employees and their dependents. They control and reduce health care costs for corporations, measurably improve worker productivity, and provide an employment benefit that far surpasses the level of service that is found in the community. The result — healthier employees and a healthier world.


We’re creating something truly wonderful and are looking to engage software engineers who can create remarkable experiences that motivate, inspire, and delight our patients in meaningful ways anywhere anytime. We are a company whose culture is focused on finding creative ways to enhance the lives of all of those we come into contact driving care innovation along the way. If you want to grow, build, and lead in a company that shares these values, then we would love to hear from you.


Essential Functions:


Senior Developer is responsible for the design, construction, integration, and implementation of applications software in an exciting, innovative, dynamic environment that supports corporate strategies and objectives. This is considered an experienced development position that requires cultural fit, technical skills, and expertise commensurate with a high quality, innovative team focused on building stellar experiences for our users. This role will be responsible for the following items in addition to other duties as assigned.



  • Provide input and direction to solutions fulfilling product ownership and client requirements.

  • Identify and implement technical and procedural solutions in alignment with operating objectives.

  • Conduct code reviews, and mentor junior teammates in best practices, patterns, and new industry developments.

  • Perform complex programming assignments requiring an advanced aptitude of established programming standards, methods, and best practices.

  • Design, Build, Maintain and Modify service, web, and mobile applications

  • Provide support for critical application problems and issues.

  • Aid and lead in the experience design process.


If you want to join a team of knowledgeable, compassionate, like-minded healthcare professionals, join Premise Health for an unlimited opportunity with the company that is changing the face and the place of the healthcare industry as we know it.


We are an equal opportunity employer.

jobs.title: Lead Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
We are leading the digital transformation of government, making public services digital by default, and simpler, clearer and faster to use. 

We work in small, agile teams of developers, designers, content designers and others. We build a minimum viable product, and then iterate – always asking how we can make things better for users, who are at the centre of everything we do. We designed, built and run GOV.UK, the starting point for 60 million citizens to experience government. 

But we're not just about websites. We're finding ways to help those without digital skills share the benefits of digital government. We’re building platforms like Verify, which confirms users are who they say they are, and the Performance Platform, which gives citizens statistics on how government services are doing right now. We’re also setting standards for digital platforms that are shared across agencies and departments, ensuring technology is consistent and spending is controlled. 

This is just some of what we do. You can keep up to date with our Technology at GDS blog. 

Help us make government better. 

GOV.UK Verify allows people to access their government records and services on GOV.UK securely and safely, without having to use postal or face-to-face services. 

The service is being delivered in a new way for the first time anywhere in the world. Rather than government seeking to verify individuals’ identity online and manage their login credentials, we are using a range of certified companies which users can choose from. 

GOV.UK Verify is currently in public beta and being used to support 9 government services with 3 certified companies on board. A proportion of people will be able to identify themselves to government services entirely digitally, in about 15 minutes. Over time, this proportion will grow as we continue to develop and expand the service. Keep up to date with our blog. 



The role 

As the Lead Web Operations Engineer you will be key in the development of the right tooling to create and evolve a resilient and secure platform on top of Infrastructure As A Service. You will be responsible for the day to day development of the infrastructure platforms supporting GOV.UK Verify, working closely with the Systems Architect. 

You will be working in a relatively unique technical environment where technical problem solving will be related to security, identity management, and scaling in a cloud based environment with heavy use of microservices. 

You will be key part in the development of the right tooling to create and evolve a resilient and secure platform on top of Infrastructure As A Service. 

Main responsibilities 



  • Leading by example both in how you conduct yourself and in providing engineering excellence to the build of the platforms identifying and promoting best practice 

  • Working with the Technical Architects, Head of Operations and Product Owner to provide robust, resilient and scalable platform for GOV.UK Verify. 

  • Mentoring junior webops personnel and developers in best practice for Cloud implementations 

  • Facilitating daily standups, team meetings, sizing and planning meetings, and incident retrospectives 

  • Setting an example for and encouraging positive and constructive communication both within the team and when communicating with other GDS teams 

  • Ensuring the team has right processes in place to deliver quality solutions 

  • Communicating concerns about potential production issues back to Technical Architects and Head of Operations

  • Identifying and measuring relevant KPIs to drive continual performance improvement 

  • Cultivating and maintaining relationships with other webops teams within GDS and HMG 

  • Working with consultants and accreditors on register of technical risks in relation to the Infrastructure 

  • Prioritising and delivering recommendations and improvements in response to incident retrospectives

jobs.title: Senior Application Engineer
jobs.content:
At Swarm64, parallel processor experts and database software specialists teamed up to create a full-stack software and hardware accelerator plug-in for databases. Swarm64’s Scalable Database Acceleration platform plugs into Linux-based servers and delivers huge performance increases without need of changes to the customer’s application.



Our product expresses our ambitions and our style: We strive to create outstanding results. We invent cross-functionally. We work in teams and put people first. We collaborate with customers. We embrace an agile culture.



Responsibilities


The Senior Application Engineer will be a hands-on engineer with the experience and knowledge to:



  • create and maintain the development and production environment for Swarm64’s engineering processes

  • create a production quality server-platform for Swarm64’s SDA including software versioning, packaging, release tests, and continuous deployment

  • be a point of contact at Swarm64 for technical customer interaction


In Swarm64’s cross-functional teams, contributions outside of specific specialisations and skills are strongly encouraged.

jobs.title: API Developer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for ambitious developers to build our public APIs in a growing team of skilled engineers. You will get to develop and deploy features that reach 100.000s of users every day and together with your team you decide how to design and implement new functionality. We work on a .NET stack with a SQL Server backend. Our API serves more than 20.000.000 requests daily and we log more than a GB of data a minute. We index these logs in real-time and create dashboards for instant insight as we need it. We deploy when we want and aim to fix bugs before customers see them.


Is this you?



  • You love designing public APIs - both REST and SOAP

  • You’re a developer looking to gain and share knowledge

  • You're a team player who can also make independent decisions

  • You love to code and get a kick out of seeing your features in production

  • You make mistakes sometimes – but you learn from them and take pride in fixing any issues

  • You and your team are in control - no micromanaging here

  • You challenge status quo


We offer:



  • A chance to work with some of the best professionals in the industry

  • Influence on the tools and technologies in our stack

  • Professional and personal growth through inspiring colleagues, challenging tasks, conferences, hackathons and meet-ups

  • Excellent Christianshavn location with a view of Den Sorte Diamant across the harbor

  • Young and friendly colleagues with a running-club, Friday bars, etc.

  • Free phone, Internet and choice of Mac, Win or Linux work machine

  • First-class canteen


Responsibilities:



  • Build public APIs that directly impact and improve the daily work of 100.000s of customers and partners

  • Work closely together with a dedicated team of passionate developers and the partners that consume our API

  • Write elegant, clean, testable and effective code

  • Review the code of others and have your own code reviewed

  • Write automated tests, and watch them run green in our continuous integration setup after pushing your changes to GitHub

  • Push often, deploy early, and always measure and improve what you work on

  • Be responsible for the daily health of the API


Qualifications:



  • Knowledge of public API design

  • Knowledge of – or an urge to learn – new tools and technologies

  • Interest in Continuous Integration, DevOps and high frequency deployments

  • Excellent English communication skills

  • Burning passion for building, shipping and deploying business-critical web applications

  • You know more than one programming language


Please apply with both CV and cover letter


About Us


e-conomic resides on Christianshavn in central Copenhagen and is part of Visma. We build and design a cloud based accounting product that helps companies run their business. 100.000 happy customers use our product on a regular basis. We are 170 employees from 20+ nationalities.


The development department consists of 40+ people, including Product Owners, QA engineers and UX designers, working with technologies like C#, Node.js, React, MS-SQL, Swift and MongoDB.


We serve more than 50 million requests a day, push to production several times a week, love to talk about (and write) code, believe strongly in automation, and are driven by a desire to measure and monitor in order to constantly improve our product.


If you have any further questions regarding the vacancy, please feel free to contact team lead Sune Alkærsig, on +4561301114 or sal@e-conomic.com.

jobs.title: C++ Developer
jobs.content:
What does working as C++ Developer entail?


C++ developers working on ESET Remote Administrator are involved in developing server-side software, which enables administrators to manage and configure ESET security products deployed on individual devices.


To give you a little taste, a typical task for a C++ developer working in our team can be as follows: “Please propose and implement a new network protocol, data replication between servers and new functionality in the user web interface. Please do it with a high degree of effectiveness because our server system has to be able to handle tens to hundreds of thousands of endpoints.”

jobs.title: iOS Developer to work with Real-Time Sports Data in Barcelona
jobs.content:
Visca Web’s passionate team of developers is behind the popular Futebol.com and Marcadores.com brands. Our upcoming iOS native application will enable iPhone users to fully experience the features of the product: real-time results for 9 different sports and predictions contest with prizes to win.

The development of the first version of the application has been carried out by an external partner and is nearing completion. We want to bring the next steps of our mobile development in-house and we are looking for an iOS enthusiast and experienced developer to join our team in Barcelona, Spain.

Your Role:


As iOS Developer in the Marcadores.com mobile application team, you will have the objective to constantly improve the application and also add new features to it.
The existing code will need to be rewritten (with Swift), constantly adjusted and improved. The application will need to stay robust and stable as traffic and user-base grow.

Summary of responsibilities:



  • Contribute to the launch of the first version of the application

  • Constantly improve the quality of the code, rewrite parts of it, introducing Swift (the current app is based on Objective C)

  • Implement new functionalities (in collaboration with the backend team who develops the API)

  • Fix bugs reported by users

  • Suggest improvements on development and usage

  • Later, you may work on the watch version of the application.


Our Tools

We understand that to make great apps, you need great tools. Our IDE are the latest stable versions of Xcode and AppCode. When debugging use sometimes Charles to hack the API. FauxPas provides us automatic code review. Talking about API, we also use Paw when we need to test it.

We love continuous integration and continuous deployment. We use Bitrise to take care of building and deploying. We also love GitHub, which we use with the GitHub flow, working with pull requests.

We collaborate in English with JIRA and Slack is our favorite tool for team and direct messaging along with the odd GIF.

jobs.title: Drone Software Engineer / UI designer
jobs.content:
We are Intel's unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV) team and we need YOU to make our products fly! Formed by a recent acquisition, we are a small but successful startup within Intel and operate in a highly dynamic and largely independent environment. We are looking for a passionate UI/UX Designer Drone Applications to help us build our next generation platforms.

Our flight platforms are our universal platforms to collect and generate data. Software turns this data into meaningful knowledge. jobs.title: Mobile Developer- C# and Xamarin
jobs.content:
Be part of our cross platform mobile application development team and build a stunning shopping app for iOS and Android using Xamarin, Xamarin.Forms and ReactiveX.


We are constantly looking for mind-alikes to take our mobile application where no man or robot has gone before. We have to confess there are no aliens, robots or rocket science involved in our day-to-day work. In the end it's still work and unfortunately not a ball pit.


But: We do our best to create an enjoyable, focused and stress-free environment. We believe work should not be a burden but a cozy place to hang out. With regular cake breaks, fun, endeavour and challenges we enjoy tackling. An environment full of possibilities, exhausting them is your responsibility.

jobs.title: Software Engineer in Test
jobs.content:
If you enjoy being a part of the entire software development lifecycle; from design to deployment, ensuring the highest code quality and performance at every step, then you’ll love what we have here at Klarna.


We're growing our test engineering teams here at Klarna; building test automation infrastructure to increase test coverage and improve code quality across our entire engineering organisation.


Some of the stuff you’ll do;



  • Build test automation frameworks that enable development teams to deliver high quality software at speed.

  • Improve the quality and health of Klarna's systems by providing information on how their services are perceived from the outside (using both blackbox and whitebox testing).

  • Devise testing strategies for new business features.

  • Advise development teams on software design choices.

  • Act as a technical ambassador for quality throughout the entire engineering organisation.


Realistically, you’ll need experience building test automation tools and frameworks, as well as a strong coding ability; While we mainly use Ruby, we're searching for problem solvers that are confident working with different technologies and willing to learn new skills. You’ll need to know about contract-driven testing, context-driven testing, agile methodologies (pairing, TDD, BDD) and continuous delivery practices.


You'll work in our knowledge sharing culture, receive a generous occupational pension, 30 days paid annual leave, subsidised gym membership and a range of discounts on everything from electrical goods to flights and hotels.


Interested in finding out more?


Send over your CV and let's arrange a chat.

About us


Here at Klarna we’re simplifying buying - We do this by letting the consumer buy online without signing up for anything, they pay after receiving the goods; we assume the credit and fraud risks for the merchants.


We have more than 1200 employees and we’re active in 18 countries. We serve 35 million consumers and work with 50,000 merchants, processing over 400,000 transactions every day.

jobs.title: Senior User Experience Design Lead
jobs.content: Boise, ID

jobs.title: Lead PHP Developer
jobs.content:
As a Lead PHP Developer at Coolblue you will support your team define the shopping experience of hundreds of thousands of people daily.


What you tell your friends you do
"I'm like Yoda. ‘Code size matters not. Judge it by it's size you should not. For my ally is The Code. And a powerful ally it is"


What you will really be doing



  • You will work with one or two cross functional teams formed by backend and frontend Developers, UX designers and a Scrum Master.

  • You will act as the technical conscience of the teams, keeping a bird eye view on the state of our codebase and initiating projects to keep it up to date and in tip-top shape.

  • You will help Product Owners in aligning the functional with the technical needs.

  • You will support team members defining their goals and the strategy to achieve them.


How will you be doing this?



  • Actively coaching and continuously providing feedback to team members, you will make them “a little bit better every day”.

  • Selecting and interviewing candidates for your teams in collaboration with our IT recruitment department and some more HR related tasks.

  • Taking part in team meetings to provide your knowledge and insights where needed.

  • Reviewing code, evangelising best practices and sustaining a culture of pragmatism as well as craftsmanship.

  • Keeping up to date with the latest in Web development, improving our tools and processes where needed.


What we have worked on last quarter



  • Responsive design. One code base, infinitely devices, but always the most optimal user experience.

  • Microservice Architecture. A complete new infrastructure for better performance and scalability.

  • Scalable Team Structure. In january 2016 we introduced a new structure in which every team belongs to one of our four families. Each family is responsible for a domain. This structure permits teams to perform in our dynamic environment. 


What a day in the office might look like
You arrive in the office in the morning, just in time for a coffee before the daily stand up with your team. You discover Marco is working on a story which is becoming more and more complex, so you help him keeping things simple and at the same time aligned better with the business case. After the stand up you sit beside Rafael who is having troubles working on a Google Analytics API client. You try to understand what is exactly the problem and with your help, Rafael come up with a new approach on how to solve the problem.


You meet a candidate over lunch. You aren’t looking at skills yet, you just want to get to know her. How would her personality match with the rest of the herd? Can she communicate ideas clearly and concisely? Can she talk fluently about the technologies Coolblue deploys? It’s your shot at filtering out candidates that don’t fit the mould. Not bad, not bad at all. She passes. For now. Of course, your senior team members will pick her apart technically later.


In the afternoon, you have a face to face sync with Rafael. You ask if the new approach for the API client is working. Then you talk about what he will be focusing on the upcoming months. He has no clear idea about that and so you ask him questions about which epic motivates him the most and which task he prefers. Rafael has a clearer idea now about his focus and he will think how to keep attention in this. 
Since you have no more meetings in the day, you propose a table tennis tournament with the whole team. The team loves that and even if you lose all of the matches, you have a great time.

Team
You'll work with one or two cross functional teams formed by backend and frontend Developers, UX designers and a Scrum Master. They have different levels of experience and you will support them towards becoming even more amazing than they already are. Your teams, together with other teams in the same family, are responsible for a particular domain of our software architecture.

jobs.title: Create smiles by writing awesome code
jobs.content:
As a PHP Developer at Coolblue you will make sure our web shops are ridiculously fast and meticulously kept.


What you tell your friends you do
"I build web shops. And no - I will not fix your computer."


What you will really be doing



  • Coming up with new functionalities and building them.

  • Improving the technology that runs over 300 web shops.

  • Improving the user-friendliness of all of those web shops.


How will you be doing this?



  • You are an all-rounder in a Scrum team. You will have your own specialization, but you will also be able to perform all other tasks within the team.

  • You prioritize your own work together with your team and Product Owner. You will receive immediate feedback from end users and you will have a lot of opportunities to experiment.

  • You will be using the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you. Choices that were made in the past are not rules.

  • You will work in a motivated team to meet ambitious deadlines. There is always a budget for good ideas.

  • Big data is your guru, your gut feeling isn't. To measure is to know.


What we have worked on last quarter



  • Faceted search. Search and filter real-time product information, hundreds of times per second, for 90.000 products in 280 shops.

  • Responsive design. One codebase, lots of devices, but always the optimal user experience.

  • Reviews. A completely new infrastructure for better performance and scalability. Improved usability for both customers and moderators. More reviews, more interaction, less spam, better conversion rates.


What a day in the office might look like
You open a pull request in GitHub for your last changes in the Javascript codebase of one of the back-end services for our new faceted-search functionality. You have fixed a bug in a de-serialisation method that was causing metadata to leak from JSON objects. Considering the large amount of simultaneous, relatively small requests these services process, Node.js seemed the obvious choice. So you had to abandon your usual work field of PHP and give the old Javascript another chance. Once again it proved itself a powerful language, capable of building beautiful stuff. Maybe the front-enders were right after all? Now that this has been tackled, you return to PHP. You had this idea to optimise the determination of the sorting order of the filters on the site...


Team
You will be working in a family with three to five other developers, each of them with their own specialization, ranging from PHP to Javascript. Your team will be managed by a Team Lead, a Scrum Master and a Product Owner. You and another team are part of the same family, so you’re both responsible for one specific domain of Coolblue.nl.

jobs.title: Lead Delphi Developer
jobs.content:
As a Lead Delphi Developer you will lead development on the application that is the backbone of Coolblue - Vanessa.


What you tell your friends you do


"I'm a roadie for Coolblue. I work behind the scenes to make sure everyone is able to do their work as fast as possible."


What you will really be doing



  • You will lead a team of experienced Delphi and PL/SQL developers.

  • You will build new functionalities and optimize current ones for all the processes behind the scenes of our online shops and physical stores.

  • Coupling Vanessa (back office system) and its Oracle DB with other systems, including Google Analytics,  Coolblue Business Intelligence and the rest of our microservices based back office.

  • Implementing a system for continuous delivery of Vanessa.


How you will be doing this



  • Actively coaching and continuously providing feedback to team members, you will help make them 'a little bit better every day'.

  • Selecting and interviewing candidates for your team in collaboration with our IT recruitment department and other HR related tasks.

  • Using Scrum you prioritize your own work together with your team and Product Owner. You will receive immediate feedback from end users and you will have a lot of opportunities to experiment.

  • You will be using the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you. Choices that were made in the past are not rules.

  • Creating extremely well crafted code that is robust and maintainable, and delivers on the user's expectations. 

  • You will work in a motivated team to meet ambitious deadlines. 

  • There is always a budget for good ideas.


What we have worked on last quarter



  • Logistics.22,000 square meters of warehouse space: thousands and thousands of products in all shapes and sizes, ordered before midnight, delivered the next day.

  • Replenishment of stores.New functionality was built to improve the restocking of the physical stores.

  • Optimising callsmade by the web stores through our internal service to the Oracle DB. Increasing our ability to serve many customers concurrently.


What a day in the office might look like


Parcel sorter will be the next story of the sprint you are handling. Using this link diminishes the amount of times a package has to be picked up, checked and put away by a whopping 15,000 times. Logistics will be happy. The data model only needs minor adjustments. The service that takes care of communication is easily fixed. FTP is more demanding than a web service, but you know how it rolls. Twenty packages are stuck in line somewhere and you and another team member need to find out why. Found it: the creation of multicolli packages happens in a different way. Tuesday is release day, so then you get to see the happy faces in Logistics when they put your work to use.


Team


You'll become part of an agile, multidisciplinary team, ranging in size between four and six members. You get your own team room, a scrum master to help guide the process and a product owner to represent the business' needs.

jobs.title: I'm a roadie for Coolblue! Creating Stability behind the scenes!
jobs.content:
As a Delphi Developer you will optimize all processes happening behind the scenes at Coolblue.


What you tell your friends you do


“I'm a roadie for Coolblue. I work behind the scenes to make sure everyone is able to do their work as fast as possible.”


What you will really be doing



  • Coming up with and building new functionalities for all the processes behind the scenes of our online shops and physical stores.

  • Optimizing routes.

  • Coupling data with systems, such as Google Analytics and Business Intelligence.

  • Implementing automatised quality control.

  • Splitting systems into services.


How will you be doing this?



  • You are an all-rounder in a Scrum team. Besides your own specialization you will learn to perform all other tasks within the team.

  • You prioritize your own work together with your team and Product Owner. You will receive immediate feedback from end users and you will have a lot of opportunities to experiment.

  • You will be using the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you. Choices that were made in the past are not rules.

  • You will work in a motivated team to meet ambitious deadlines.

  • There is always a budget for good ideas.

  • Measurements on results and experience are your gurus, your gut feeling isn't. To measure is to know.


What we have worked on last quarter



  • Logistics. Introduced zone picking. The traditional wave picking didn't scale well when we doubled our warehouse size in 2015, so we are migrating this to zone picking. 

  •  The implementation we worked on is a hybrid between zone picking and wave picking, which is already a huge improvement. In the coming year we will keep refining this method.

  • Returns. Better streamlining of the returns process, like introducing a quick-repair wizard for service desks in stores and many other improvements.


 What a day in the office might look like


Parcel sorter will be the next story of the sprint you are handling. Using this link diminishes the amount of times a package has to be picked up, checked and put away by a whopping 3,500 times. Logistics will be happy. The data model only needs minor adjustments. The service that takes care of communication is easily fixed. FTP is more demanding than a web service, but you know how it rolls. Twenty packages are stuck in line somewhere and you and another team member need to find out why. Found it: the creation of multicolli packages happens in a different way. Tuesday is release day, so then you get to see the happy faces in Logistics when they put your work to use.


Team


You'll become part of an agile, multidisciplinary family, ranging in size between five and seven members. You get your own team room, a scrum master to help guide the process and a product owner to represent the business' needs.

jobs.title: Think big, build small and stay ahead of the curve
jobs.content:
As the .NET Architect at Coolblue you think big, build small and stay ahead of the curve.


What you tell your friends you do
"I act as forward reconnaissance for our development teams. I look ahead, find potential challenges and figure out how to deal with them before they slow us down." 


What you'll really be doing



  • Setting development teams up for success by helping them overcome the tricky bits before they get tricky.

  • Developing a long term vision for our systems architecture in collaboration with other Engineering Solution Leads.

  • Creating technical standards, such as design constraints and code conventions.

  • Finding different ways of accomplishing our goals, weighing the short and long term, and providing stakeholders with options. 


How you will be doing this



  • Getting hands on, coding, working with teams to help them achieve your shared goals. This role is about collaborating, not dictating – if you want an ivory tower, play chess.

  • Finding and using tools and approaches that actually work in practice, and are not just a trending topic in the blogosphere.

  • Bringing big, abstract concepts back to earth by making them simple, explainable and understood by all – technical and non-technical alike.

  • Prototyping, researching and investigating possible angles for upcoming projects.

  • Balancing off-the-shelf components, and building it ourselves.

  • You think big and build small. In the end it's about getting things done. 


Our stack
Coolblue uses quite a broad technology stack and we greatly value open standards and interoperability. We actively develop in PHP, Node.js and C#, and maintain a large Delphi codebase. Our data is currently being handled by Oracle and MySQL RDBMS, Elasticsearch, Memcached, Redis and RavenDB. We apply continuous delivery through tools like GitHub, TeamCity, Octopus Deploy and Puppet, on both private and cloud infrastructure (Azure, AWS).

Team
You collaborate with other Engineering Solutions Leads and report to our Development Manager. You'll frequently work closely together with one or more development teams.

jobs.title: Front End Web Developer
jobs.content:
Welcome to Ayuda, the newest tech visionary in the heart of Berlin.


We have a vibrant team of developers working to make the DOOH industry the very best it can be. Our central Berlin office definitely gives a taste of how engaged and passionate our team is and we are looking to add a Front End Web Developer to our team!


Your responsibilities will include:




  • Build, extend, and improve the Ayuda Platform front-end user experience




  • Implement JS framework components with the help of the latest web-standards (HTML5, CSS3, …)




  • Ensure the front-end UX is optimized for speed, scalability, and usability




  • Work with a team of front/backend developers

jobs.title: Software Engineering Team Lead
jobs.content:
We're growing our software engineering teams across multiple domains; data infrastructure, order management and payment processing. We build global payment services using Java, Scala and Erlang, to power over 400,000 global transactions every day.

What you'll be doing



  • Inspiring, mentoring and guiding teams of 5-7 Software Engineers towards clearly defined goals.

  • Coding in either Erlang, Scala or Java, depending on the domain.

  • Leading design discussions and empowering teams to find solutions to complex engineering challenges.

  • Ensuring testing best practices and Agile development processes are followed.


What you'll need to have



  • Experience building scalable software in a distributed architecture.

  • Experience leading a team of Software Engineers.

  • The ability to write clean and highly performant code yourself.

  • You should be comfortable leading design discussions.


Benefits



  • Competitive salary.

  • 30 days annual leave with the ability to take 4 weeks consecutive leave.

  • Get your choice of Macbook or PC and iPhone or Android.

  • 30 days annual leave with the ability to take 4 weeks consecutive leave

  • A product development focussed culture.

  • A learning and development centric environment with an emphasis on knowledge sharing across teams, training and regularly sponsored Tech Talks.

  • Extensive learning and development opportunities.

  • Generous occupational pension and insurance plans.

  • International English speaking office in central Stockholm with over 38 nationalities.

  • Subsidised gym membership.

  • The opportunity to shape the future of the online payment industry.


Interested in finding out more?

Send over a CV in English and let's arrange a chat.

jobs.content: We are looking for senior backend developers, who are interested in further exploring and expanding his/her skills in a creative environment. Standards are important, but knowing how to bend them to the will of a project is at least as, if not more important for the creation of innovative and high-impact solutions for our clients.You should have an interest in design and branding and enjoy working in a close-knit team environment. Attention to detail and a logical structure should be integral aspects of your development process.

jobs.title: PHP/Symfony2 Developer
jobs.content:
Our team is working on a set of web based systems, which we developed ourselves. We have multiple tools for planning and running our bus fleet, which are built as a service oriented architecture. We respect modern web technologies, open standards and contribute to open source projects. We live agile principles and own our process.


We are an extremely unusual IT team for the average bus operator: we consist of 40 people in multiple locations, speaking several languages and want to grow even more.


To augment our team in Berlin, we are searching for an experienced web developer (f/m) for immediate start.


What we offer:



  • Experience a fast growing startup with incredible offline value (You have probably already seen our green buses on the streets, right?)

  • Real agile development based on current situation, without Gantt-charts and dusty specifications

  • Join a diverse, experienced team to exchange your ideas and contribution

  • Professional trainings if you don't have any or too little experience with Symfony2 yet

  • Office at Alex

  • competitive salary

  • soft working hours

  • conference visits


Here is a video from our head of software architecture about why it is interesting to work for us: 


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TUWB7cW8UTg

jobs.title: Scrum Master
jobs.content:
3DEXCITE R&D is responsible for providing applications and software components for realtime and offline 3D visualization, ranging from geometry optimization tools over scene editing applications to rendering solutions. You will be part of the Technologies team responsible for providing the Stellar rendering framework, acting as Scrum Master of two teams which work on distributed rendering and rendering in the cloud.


Job Responsibilities


Scrum Master for two 3DEXCITE development teams



  • Organise and moderate ceremonies

  • Help teams detect and remove impediments

  • Cultivate self-organisation within teams

  • Continuously coach developers, Product Owners, and stakeholders in agile practices and principles

  • Proactively facilitate communication between developers, Product Owners, and stakeholders

  • Closely cooperate with Scrum Masters and Product Owners of other teams

  • Live the role of servant leader by example

  • Supervise team members (set and review annual goals, relay requests for trainings, participate in hiring process)

jobs.title: Senior PHP Developer
jobs.content:
As a PHP Developer at Coolblue you will make sure our web shops are ridiculously fast and meticulously kept.


What you tell your friends you do
"I build web shops. And no - I will not fix your computer."


What you will really be doing



  • Coming up with new functionalities and building them.

  • Improving the technology that runs over 300 web shops.

  • Improving the user-friendliness of all of those web shops.


How will you be doing this?



  • You are an all-rounder in a Scrum team. You will have your own specialization, but you will also be able to perform all other tasks within the team.

  • You prioritize your own work together with your team and Product Owner. You will receive immediate feedback from end users and you will have a lot of opportunities to experiment.

  • You will be using the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you. Choices that were made in the past are not rules.

  • You will work in a motivated team to meet ambitious deadlines. There is always a budget for good ideas.

  • Big data is your guru, your gut feeling isn't. To measure is to know.


What we have worked on last quarter



  • Faceted search. Search and filter real-time product information, hundreds of times per second, for 90.000 products in 280 shops.

  • Responsive design. One codebase, lots of devices, but always the optimal user experience.

  • Reviews. A completely new infrastructure for better performance and scalability. Improved usability for both customers and moderators. More reviews, more interaction, less spam, better conversion rates.


What a day in the office might look like
You open a pull request in GitHub for your last changes in the Javascript codebase of one of the back-end services for our new faceted-search functionality. You have fixed a bug in a de-serialisation method that was causing metadata to leak from JSON objects. Considering the large amount of simultaneous, relatively small requests these services process, Node.js seemed the obvious choice. So you had to abandon your usual work field of PHP and give the old Javascript another chance. Once again it proved itself a powerful language, capable of building beautiful stuff. Maybe the front-enders were right after all? Now that this has been tackled, you return to PHP. You had this idea to optimise the determination of the sorting order of the filters on the site...


Team
You will be working in a family with three to five other developers, each of them with their own specialization, ranging from PHP to Javascript. Your team will be managed by a Team Lead, a Scrum Master and a Product Owner. You and another team are part of the same family, so you’re both responsible for one specific domain of Coolblue.nl.

jobs.title: Industrial Designer
jobs.content: Middleton, WI

jobs.title: Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
As a C++ Software Engineer your core responsibility is to deliver new product features. A major part of this is writing and owning the code that drives our products. But the role of a C++ Software Engineer is much bigger than ‘simply’ writing code. Software Engineers work on the whole development process, including:




  • suggesting and deciding what features to build




  • driving the design




  • writing the code (of course)




  • pushing, testing, documenting the feature




Engineering Driven. Our engineers have full ownership of their projects. Our management structure is flat and lightweight. Software engineering is run by software engineers -- you are in charge of delivering your work from design to code to test to customer shipment.   


Insane amount of automation! We put a premium on building and using tools that make everyone super-productive. This translates into quicker turnaround times on new features and products for increased revenue with smaller teams.   


We value openness. No part of the company is off-limits, meaning that our engineers have the chance to work on a variety of different areas. Our interns have the same responsibility as our full timers who have the same responsibility as our old timers and all get to work side-by-side on important, customer-impacting projects.

jobs.title: Senior Automation Software Engineer - Sofia, Bulgaria location
jobs.content:
Responsibilities:

This is a position within VMware automation teams. Teams consist of highly experienced developers and automation experts, with a strong track record of delivering high number of automated tests for critical VMware releases. Candidate will own the UI and/or API automation of specific areas of the products by utilizing existing and extending existing frameworks, by overseeing the execution of these tests and analyzing the results. These frameworks are based on Java and Java + Selenium (FLEX) as well as industry leading automation tools that have been developed within VMware.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer for a Music Company
jobs.content:
You will be joining a midsized cross functional team, consisting of front and server side developers, a tester, 2 UX designers and a Scrum Master. The team works in an Agile way, utilizing Scrum to deliver shippable product increments in 2 week sprints. Everyone is encouraged to actively participate in the Scrum ceremonies i.e. Sprint Planning. The flat structure of the team ensures a level of autonomy, whilst encouraging collaboration and the generation of new ideas.


We are a music company with some very ambitious plans so there is a wide variety of challenges to get involved in. In the short term, you will either be assisting in modernising our website, ensuring that it contains all of the functionality expected from a modern commercial music provider, or working on our music services platform which helps get our music into other products via APIs and HTML plugins.

jobs.title: Medior & Senior .Net Developers needed for creating the future
jobs.content:
To further develop our next generation ERP system we need expansion of the development team. To create the future we need you and your skills to make the difference in the food industry and beyond. 


The team exists of 15 Dutch developers who will work closely with you and an external team of 5 Romanian developers.  


Based on the functionalities of the current ERP systems and the knowledge of the market of our sales department and implementation consultants you work on the successor of the current Reflex 3000 ERP system. Within the development team there is a lot of freedom in developing our future. 


Do you want to be part of a enthusiastic team, you will be more than welcome to respond. We are looking for a Dutch speaking addition of the Dutch branche.

Considering the large amount of simultaneous, relatively small requests these services process, Node.js seemed the obvious choice. So you had to abandon your usual work field of PHP and give the old Javascript another chance. Once again it proved itself a powerful language, capable of building beautiful stuff. Maybe the front-enders were right after all? Now that this has been tackled, you return to PHP. You had this idea to optimise the determination of the sorting order of the filters on the site...


Team


You will be working in a family with three to five other developers, each of them with their own specialization, ranging from PHP to Javascript. Your team will be managed by a Team Lead, a Scrum Master and a Product Owner. You and another team are part of the same family, so you’re both responsible for one specific domain of Coolblue.nl.

jobs.title: Angular.JS & Node.JS fullstack web developer
jobs.content:
We are seeking a talented Node / Angular / full stack JS dev to join our growing team.


Constantly want to learn something new?


Want to be part of the whole development process from planning right through to product launch?


Tired of being just a dev in a cubicle?


Then read on...


We are looking to hire a dev who works well as part of a team, but also can get there head down and smash through large features independently.


Someone who enjoys working in an agile fashion and has experience of JIRA.


Having MEAN stack experience is a huge bonus. As this will form a large part of what we have planned in the coming year. 


Commercial experience is very important and a demonstrable portfolio is a must.

jobs.title: Web Developer Front-End
jobs.content:
Job Description

Are you a Web Developer looking to work at the forefront of technology and innovative products used by millions of players?

As you will be developing and maintaining systems to enable people to have fun, we strongly believe you in turn should have fun doing this. So we have an onsite pool and foosball table and a gym (that’s fun for some people!)

Focusing more on the job itself, as one of our highly skilled Web Developers, you will analyse user requirements and produce corresponding development tasks, ensuring their completion by putting together a robust end to end process. You will maintain our existing systems, develop new system applications and improve functionality to ensure high quality in any software releases. 

You will also be working on innovative projects such as: Real Time CRM, Marketing Platforms, Customer Messaging Systems, Web based Store, Back office applications and dashboards for our business customers etc

The Web Developer job is based in our Dublin service office forming part of our Software Development Services team. As part of this team, you will provide contract research and development services to our gaming companies. And trust us, there are plenty of pioneering projects across the Group.




Additional Information

The salary for this job is based on experience, so whilst we are not able to go into detail at this stage, we can say that we offer great salary packages and also like to throw in a discretionary annual performance bonus.

We offer health and dental insurance for you, your partner and your children (if you all live at the same address). In addition, you are entitled to an annual health assessment and to join our company pension scheme.

Our in-house training and development team deliver fantastic support in terms of developing your skills and helping you progress your career.

We have a canteen which offers hot and cold options for breakfast and lunch and we contribute €3 daily towards this. In addition, there is free fresh fruit, snacks and drinks.

jobs.title: Solutions Architect - come and help us design innovative client driven projects
jobs.content:
Are you looking to work on new projects designing solutions to help some of the world’s biggest companies deliver their ‘whats next?’?  If so please read on.


DigitasLBi is a marketing and technology agency that builds complex digital marketing solutions delivered to range of devices for an ever-growing portfolio of clients.  


As Solutions Architect we are looking for you to use your proven industry experience in working with web-centric technologies to help build large-scale digital platforms for our blue-chip clients.  Whilst learning from colleagues, Architecture Directors, and the Technology leadership team to further and grow your own career.   


Being a part of DigitasLBi means working in multi-disciplinary teams made up of specialist technologists as well as Creative, UX, Strategy, Data Science, Client Services and Project Management.  You’ll work collaboratively to challenge and stretch our teams and clients alike, towards the same end goal of solving the clients problem through combined and individual excellence.  As a Solutions Architect you will engage directly with clients to help them make the right decisions and help them implement the best solutions.


We have a strong community culture, regular off-project workshops and an opinionated but collaborative mind-set that helps us drive best practices from the bottom up.

jobs.content:
Are you looking to work on digital transformation projects helping some of the world’s biggest brands deliver their ‘whats next?’?  If so please read on.


DigitasLBi is a marketing and technology agency that builds complex digital marketing solutions delivered to range of devices for an ever-growing portfolio of clients.   As a Senior or Lead Front End Developer we are looking for you to use your proven industry experience and expertise to influence our teams, whilst learning from colleagues to further your own knowledge in pursuit of delivering work of the highest quality. 


Being a part of DigitasLBi means working in multi-disciplinary teams made up of specialist technologists as well as Creative, UX, Strategy, Data Science, Client Services and Project Management.  You’ll work collaboratively to challenge and stretch our teams and clients alike, towards the same end goal of solving the problem through combined and individual excellence.   


We have a strong community culture, regular off-project workshops and an opinionated but collaborative mind-set that helps us drive best practices from the bottom up.
