jobs.title: Java Developer
jobs.content:
Detailed Description


We are looking for a Java Developer to join our development team. The selected candidate will play a key role in the design and development of online financial products for world-leading brands.


Our developers should have the ability and discipline to develop a project and make educated design decisions. They are also able to work independently and make schedule decisions according to the tasks assigned by the product manager.

jobs.title: Senior Mobile Developer
jobs.content:
Wrangler of Mobile Bits - Senior Mobile Dev Position @ LifeTales


What we want to see in you:



  • You’re fluent with modern mobile development technologies and techniques and are willing and able to learn more. You want to build products that solve problems and make a positive impact.

  • Fluent in Agile and believe in the process. You are constantly striving to improve best practices.

  • You’re an innovative developer that can take instructions and find effective ways to work with our UX team to consistently deliver high quality code that is well tested using TDD (automatic integration - CircleCI, xcodebuild).

  • You bring a problem solving attitude and approach to development. You’re self-driven, quality focused, goal oriented and pursue learning as a lifelong achievement.

  • You have strong mathematical skills and are skilled at turning abstract concepts into algorithms.

  • With your research skills, you can find the latest advances on a given topic, and can quickly incorporate the key learnings into your work.

  • Have a GitHub profile with public repos and will provide the link in your application.


A little bit about us:



  • We want to create a profitable business while contributing to the overall important social well-being of our customers. We care about our members and put their needs first.

  • Our vision is to enable people everywhere to preserve their life experiences for themselves, their close friends and their descendants, in a fun way and with little effort nor planning.

  • We appreciate new and emerging technologies and considers how they can transform people's lives.

  • We are looking for a developer who has the desire to do not only do great work but also do social good.


What we can do together…



  • Build a culture that considers the wider impacts of it's decisions and focuses on the greater good.

  • We will push technology limits, learn lots, have fun, and build a great tech company headquartered here in Toronto.

  • Work collaboratively in a small, high performing, cross-functional team.

  • Regularly deliver completed stories using Scrum methodology including regular Standup and Retrospectives.

jobs.title: Point 7 will amaze you...
jobs.content:
DevOps Engineer - Gaming


As a DevOps Engineer in the Gaming team at Sky Betting and Gaming you will be responsible for for the development and support of Sky Betting & Gaming’s PaaS toolset. You will be an excellent communicator who is excited by technology, with an ability to communicate technical information to non-experts.  You will be working closely with other areas of the business and third party suppliers, helping them translate business requirements into effective automation solutions.

jobs.title: Front End Developer @ RevBoss -- $1.1M Seed Round
jobs.content:
RevBoss is on a mission to automate the sales prospecting and funnel development process. We’re looking for a junior/mid front-end developer to help us ship new features that will help our customers. 


We have customers, revenue, and a strong sales funnel...and we closed a $1.1M seed financing in late 2015.  We're staffing up a software engineering team so that we can scale our offering and create more value for more customers.


As an early hire on our product team, you will have an immediate impact on our product, our customers, and process.  And you’ll play a key role in taking a new product to market.


This is a junior / mid role — experience is important, but we’re most interested in candidates that have proven that they can solve problems, learn quickly, and work well with a team.


Our engineering team is distributed, so experience working with remote teams is very important.  Our HQ is in Durham, NC and our VP Product is in St. Paul, MN — so we might have a slight preference for candidates in these areas.  EST and CST time zones preferred.

jobs.title: Front-End Developer
jobs.content:
As a front end developer you will get to contribute work to a range of sites, from large scale e-commerce systems to simple stylish campaigns and the occasional responsive HTML email. You will create work for multinational clients, and will be involved in all stages of a project lifecycle, from concept and ideation, through to build and continuing to develop and improve on it in the future.



You will be a good communicator, with a strong understanding of front end web development and comfortable making decisions on the company's approach and direction regarding front end development. You will have experience, or be happy to take on, managing the time of yourself and your team, delegating tasks when necessary, and reviewing the work of others in order to help them improve.


The role comprises overall ownership and day to day responsibility for a large membership databse/ CRM platform. This includes management of general system performance including automated scripts/processes, management of reported system issues, resolution of data queries, understanding and continual refinement of system logic/processes and collaboration with both service manager and client. There will also be the opportunity to work on Python/Django web applications. 


Responsibilities:



  • Developing high quality front end code for new builds, and maintaining and developing existing sites

  • Work with development teams to deliver the desired look and feel

  • Contributing to the general standard of front end within the company, and taking ownership of improving and maintaining this to a good standard

  • Advising on front end best practices and ideal approaches and techniques to use on projects

  • Providing estimates for future work

  • Reviewing the work of others in order to maintain a good standard of work throughout the department


You will get:



  • The opportunity to work with highly talented people who are passionate about all things web

  • The chance to work on some great sites for globally recognised brands

  • A yearly training budget

  • Free breakfast

  • Season ticket loan

  • Workplace pension scheme

  • Cycle to work scheme

  • Free eye care vouchers

  • Childcare vouchers

jobs.title: Cloud Sales Executive, UK
jobs.content:
Req ID: 138421

Position: Cloud Sales Executive

Ericsson and Cloud

At Ericsson, our vision is that of a Networked Society, where every person and every industry is empowered to reach their full potential. Our strategy to achieve it is founded on three pillars: Mobility; Broadband; and Cloud. Ericsson will do with Cloud what we have so well achieved with Mobility: a globally‑scaled infrastructure roll‑out play. We have a clear plan and the means to make it happen; and we have a track record of excellence in executing our strategies to attest that we will succeed.

The ambition is high. That is why we are seeking ambitious and experienced individuals that share our vision and want to be part of it to accelerate the momentum.

Job summary

You will be the driving force behind a tremendous sales acceleration of IT Cloud solutions to a select customer / small group of customers. The focal point in all business development and sales initiatives directed at building, consolidating, optimizing and transforming the cloud operations and infrastructure of your customer base. Your scope cuts across all cloud service models (IaaS-PaaS-SaaS), architectures (Private-Public-Hybrid) and nature of workloads (Enterprise, Business Support Systems and Media).

The successful candidate will combine a ferocious appetite to develop business; an exceptional acumen in technical, business, market and operational aspects of cloud; and a keen interest to actively develop her organization’s capabilities.

Responsibilities

  • Secure sales targets
  • Seek and qualify leads: conduct in-depth 360° discussions to take stock of the customer business and technology environments, requirements, plans & issues; secure participation in relevant procurement processes (e.g., RFXs)
  • Mobilize organization to pursue opportunities: decompose opportunity situation and develop pursuit plans anchored on compelling events to act now; provide structure, clear directions and objectives for engagement teams to act
  • Lead sales engagements: lead direct and indirect, virtual/cross-functional teams, seeking assistance within a large, complex organization on proposals, offer development, demos, proofs of concepts, strategy development, 3rd party solutions, etc.; lead responses to procurement processes (e.g., RFXs)
  • Close sales: maintain a continuously updated 360° map of “what is needed to close the business”; early and clear articulation of case towards own stakeholders; secure all of the company’s strengths, capabilities and possibilities to secure business on “D-day”
  • Own and manage a 48 months sales funnel that secures a significantly growing business
  • Identify strengths and weaknesses of Ericsson’s positioning vs. competition in any given situation through research, industry contacts, personal networks, etc.
  • Drive knowledge transfer and thought leadership: secure knowledge continuity through immediately-near individuals; active high level participation in global re-use and knowledge sharing

Basic qualifications

Cloud domain

  • Thorough knowledge of cloud economics: TCO and commercial models, their cost structure and value drivers; make‑buy analysis
  • Relevant real‑life experience with bimodal IT operations: procuring, selling, implementing, utilizing and/or operating such infrastructures – private and/or hybrid
  • Expertise on at least three of the following five cloud stack elements: Hardware / Software Defined Infrastructure, Data Storage, Data / Application Platform, Security, Data Center Facilities
  • Expertise on processes and interventions to build, consolidate and optimize cloud operations; and/or to transform data centers into highly available cloud platforms
  • Fluent in the ITIL/ITSM framework, agile methodologies and DevOps practices
  • Knowledgeable about the most relevant industry players, offers and dynamics: infrastructure, professional services and XaaS

Superior soft skills across‑the‑board:

  • Entrepreneurial & Commercial thinking: ambitious, self-driven, go-getter, risk-taker, persuader and influencer, persistent, action oriented, change driver, opinionated (“my business!”)
  • Solutions-focused: curious, positive, collaborative, issues into possibilities
  • Consultative skills: establish credibility; explore requirements; plan in view of interests, ambitions and possibilities; handshake engagement; deliver on it
  • Organizational awareness: establish power-base mapping to sensibly act and plan in accordance
  • Superior presentation / communication skills: purposeful structure, crisp content (less is more), actionable delivery
  • Maintains good rapport and demonstrates leadership and teamwork in cross-functional teams.

Ericsson provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, national origin, ethnic background, age, disability, political opinion, social status, veteran status, union membership or genetics.

Ericsson complies with applicable country, state and all local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location across the world in which the company has facilities. In addition, Ericsson supports the UN Guiding Principles for Business and Human Rights and the United Nations Global Compact.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and development.

Ericsson expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, national origin, ethnic background, age, disability, political opinion, social status, veteran status, union membership or genetic information.

Primary country and city: United Kingdom (GB) || London || Horseferry Road, SW London || SalesStratMkt&ComMgt

jobs.title: Senior Developer

Sqore has a young and ambitious IT team focusing on product development. We adopt cutting edge technologies and industry best practice working process.

jobs.content:
TradePMR is building the future of financial advice platforms. We are looking for creative, passionate developers to continue our role as a technology leader for both financial advisors and retail investors. As a full-stack developer, you'll work with everything from front-end HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and React, to server-side C#, open-source frameworks, proprietary APIs and several different data stores including MS SQL Server and Redis.


We want the right person for our challenging, fast-paced environment. You'll enjoy a competitive salary, leading-edge equipment, and access to the most up-to-date training resources available.

jobs.content:

jobs.title: QA/Service Engineer

jobs.title: Full-stack Java Web Developer
jobs.content:
You are a full-stack web and Java developer, equally comfortable in server side Java as in your browser's developer tools.  You have a strong 'traditional' computer science and web development foundation, but are increasingly excited about the way the Web is evolving and the power that frameworks like Ember and React are bringing to client side development. You are looking for an opportunity be part of Web's transformation, and to be surrounded by people who are passionate about building fluid modern,, responsive (or adaptive!) and engaging user experiences for the browser!


This is an excellent opportunity that will provide you with a platform to really impact our business; you’ll make sure that best practices are followed and you’ll shape the strategy for delivering a major project for our client.


Key Experiences



  • A web developer at heart – excited about modern web development

  • Personable, enthusiastic, a strong communicator, and are detail oriented.

  • Computer Science degree or equivalent, with strong CS and development fundamentals, including OOP

  • Min. 3+ years Web Development experience

  • Min. 3+ years full-stack development experience

  • Min 2+ years development in the Java stack, including IntelliJ or Eclipse, Artifactory, etc.

  • Strong expertise in core web technologies (HTML5, CSS), and JavaScript

  • Single Page Applications such as Angular, Knockout and React

  • Experience with Web Content Management Systems(Hippo CMS preferred)

  • Strong awareness and adherence to best practices of coding, testing and deployment

  • Experience as a consultant (working w. external clients) preferred

  • Nice to haves: experience in testing frameworks (Selenium, Cucumber, Sonar Qube), knowledge of Adobe Life Cycle and Adobe DRM, experience with MongoDB, familiarity with User Experience best practices

jobs.content:
You are a full-stack web developer, equally comfortable in server-side code as in your browser's developer tools.  You have a strong 'traditional' computer science and web development foundation, but are increasingly excited about the way the Web is evolving and the power that frameworks like Angular and React are bringing to client side development. You are looking for an opportunity be part of Web's transformation, and to be surrounded by people who are passionate about building fluid modern, responsive (or adaptive!) and engaging user experiences for the browser!

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Developer
jobs.content:

jobs.title: Awesome Python Developer to help create the next generation of AI Marketing
jobs.content:

You will work in our London office. Some of our tech team are remote, meaning you will need to be able to work independently. You will need a have wide range of experience, and a desire to constantly learn new skills.

jobs.title: Backend Developer w/ Mobile Experience for Leading Cybersecurity Startup
jobs.content:
LogDog is helping people around the world fight off hacking. 


We are developing a new kind of cybersecurity solution that protects personal online accounts - you know, where people keep *everything*. We keep the atmosphere here open and friendly. Every Monday we get together, we put everything on the table and listen to everyone's opinion. We've raised money from great tier A investors and are growing the team. If you're good and want to do something meaningful and pretty cool - you should join us!

jobs.title: Flitsmeister zoekt voor 1 mln. users een sterke iOS dev.
jobs.content:
Hallo! Bij Flitsmeister zijn we op zoek naar een slimme iOS dev.


Lijkt het je leuk om ons ontwikkelteam te komen helpen?


FULL TIME · VEENENDAAL


Onze apps informeren je over de locaties of lengtes van files, wegafsluitingen, verkeersmeldingen, ongelukken, mobiele flitsers, flitspalen en trajectcontroles die alleen voor jou belangrijk zijn. Daarnaast word je met Flitsmeister ook gealarmeerd voor naderende hulpdienst voertuigen zoals ambulances en auto's van Rijkswaterstaat. Rij veiliger door voortijdig een signaal te krijgen en bespaar door op de hoogte te zijn van allerlei verkeersmeldingen.


Flitsmeister heeft een hechte community van vele gebruikers op alle mobiele platformen. Deze community zorgt ervoor dat flitsers worden aan- en afgemeld waardoor we de beschikking hebben over de meest accurate informatie over het Nederlandse wegennet.


Nederland is een mooi land, maar er zijn nog veel meer mooie landen die wij willen gaan veroveren. Voor deze verovering hebben we hulp nodig bij het doorontwikkelen van de apps en daarom zijn we op zoek naar een iOS developer.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer - 0616
jobs.content:
SparkNET Technologies, a growing software development firm in Wayne, PA is seeking a DevOps Engineer. 


Are you a skilled engineer, who loves innovation, works hard but knows how to have fun as well? Do you enjoy a new set of challenges daily and working with bleeding edge technology? Do you enjoy a small team where everyone's opinions matter and are heard? 


Welcome to SparkNET. We build inventive applications to solve our clients' problems. Along the way we also build some pretty neat products as well as commit a lot of code to open source projects that we utilize. 


To be considered for this job you will likely have:



  • A belief in communication, teamwork, and continuous improvement.

  • A wealth of experience in managing and deploying mobile and web applications

  • Experience managing virtual machines in EC2 and VMWare

  • An opinion that automated deployment is the only way to do things; extra credit if you have used more than 2 Server/Application deployment scripting frameworks (Chef, Ansible, Puppet and/or Capistrano)

  • Ability to help scale (in an automated way) large web applications.

  • Commitment to testing what you build and taking responsibility for software quality.

  • Ability to be productive in an environment where you have a high degree of autonomy and responsibility.

  • A Joy of new technologies and an ability to learn them quickly.

  • 1+ years of professional experience.


Perks:



  • Benefits including Medical and Dental

  • Snacks and Drinks Galore

  • Excellent Gear (we Apple computers and big monitors)

  • Paid Vacation and Flexible work schedule.

jobs.title: BI Developer
jobs.content:
As market leaders, we have high expectations of ourselves – quality, reliability, safety of our products – and strive for continuous improvement. We work with the best, to be the best, and the secret of our success is simple: we keep learning and exploring. We’ve set our eyes on the world – we want to offer our safety software globally, to complex businesses in many industries. Care to join us?


As an integral member of our product team, the Business Intelligence (BI) Developer is responsible for the entire development cycle of our mission-critical enterprise BI solution. Working with cross-functional teams, you will take responsibility not only for design and development of the platform but quality assurance and maintenance as well.


Using your skills and experience as a BI Developer, you will then shape the underlying architecture of our data warehouse according to business needs identified and projected by the Product Manager.


We are looking for BI Developers.


Accountabilities:


As a Business Intelligence Developer within eVision, your accountabilities will include (but not be limited to):



  • Participate in design and analysis of our solutions

  • Assist Product Manager with translating business requirements into product specifications

  • Implement and guard technology best practices, guidelines and development processes

  • Work closely with Chief Architect to ensure seamless integration with our core products

  • Streamline Quality Assurance by automating tests

  • Provide support to eVision Professional Services to ensure the availability and performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal stakeholders

  • Provide technical assistance and cross training to other team members and Professional Services teams

jobs.title: PHP, Magento, WP position in Fort Collins, CO
jobs.content:
Creative Team Developer


Our Development team plays a key role in the success of our clients and our company. Developers work with Marketing Executives, Project managers & designers in order to bring web sites and projects to life. They are creative thinkers with an ability to think outside of the box and solve problems/challenges.


This is a salary position

jobs.title: Backend Developer
jobs.content:
ParkBee is changing the world of parking, and we need you to help make this change! We’re looking for an account manager to further enhance the growth of our network of private parking garages.



ParkBee



Almost every major city is dealing with parking problems; Parking is extremely expensive and it’s very difficult to find a parking spot. However, there are sufficient vacant parking locations, only not accessible for the general use. Think of all the private parking garages of office buildings, right in the city centre that could join the sharing economy. ParkBee is a startup that has developed a smart technology to open up these parking locations to the public. Check us out at www.parkbee.com!




Sales Account Manager



As sales account manager you are focused on creating a world in which parking is no longer a pain.  This means finding the underutilized private parking spaces and making them available to the public. That’s the core of the ParkBee initiative and the key responsibility of this role.



ParkBee is growing rapidly, and this function is of crucial importance to further enhance this growth. This role requires attracting new real-estate owners (clients) with parking locations to the ParkBee network. We are looking for an ambitious and outgoing professional that will attract new clients to ParkBee and help manage the existing portfolio of clients. You will be working closely with the commercial director and business development team.



Responsibilities:




  • Enhance lead generation to realise new acquisitions and optimise the process

  • Research and scout new ParkBee locations and find creative ways to get in contact with the right owners

  • Develop innovative sales strategies in line with the marketing team to grow ParkBee in the real-estate market

  • Work closely with strategic partners on joint procurement initiatives

  • Maintain communication to clients about the activities performed and planned activities for their locations

  • Inspire the community while building and maintaining a portfolio of clients

  • Ensure updates and full-use of the CRM system



Requirements:




  • 2+ years of experience in sales or account management (real-estate is a plus)

  • Capacity to independently plan, structure and execute effective sales methods;

  • Ability to organise work methods to ensure targets are consistently met.

  • Team player with a dynamic, outgoing personality; strong communication skills, both verbal and written, are essential;

  • Strong work ethic with enthusiasm to work for a startup;

  • Ability to represent your ideas and sell to management team;

  • Fluent in English and Dutch



The Perks:



ParkBee creates an environment with significant freedom and responsibility. Working for an innovative and growing startup can be challenging but extremely rewarding! You will have an important role in this crucial stage where ParkBee is expanding to new territories. At ParkBee we have the motivation to change the world’s parking industry in a climate-friendly way. We have the proven technology to do so, now it is up to great people to assure we will get this done.



  • Work in an entrepreneurial environment where collaboration is key and you will also get insight in other processes.

  • Opportunity to work with experienced (real-estate) business development team.

  • Sharp, motivated and international team that continues to grow

  • On-site Chef every day for lunch to keep the ParkBee team healthy and happy

  • Friday afternoon drinks and crazy team events




Join us!



Start your journey with ParkBee by sending your CV and motivation to Scott Moran, s.moran@parkbee.com by no later than Friday, 19th of August.  Creativity is always encouraged!

jobs.title: Lead UX Designer
jobs.content:
What it´s all about: We are looking for a Lead UX Designer (f/m) for parental leave substitution. In this role, you will apply your passion for brand, craft, and design fidelity to guide research and design processes, mentor talented members of your team, and collaborate with leaders of other teams. You will be responsible for providing leadership and direction for a team of designers to improve the user experience for innovative and intuitive applications used globally in many languages.


Your Responsibilities:



  • Responsible for leading and developing the UX team across all platforms (mobile / web)

  • Ensure a user centered approach is at the core of everything we do

  • Working in a matrix stucture within an agile environment

  • Help define the UX strategy, goals, functionality and requirements

  • Be proactively involved when required across any topic, no matter how big or small

  • Apply a data-driven approach to UX design


We offer:



  • Highly relevant, insightful and challenging tasks

  • Seeing your ideas become a reality and generate value

  • Participation in an open, creative, innovative company culture

  • Flexible working hours

  • Working with 200 people in a beautiful loft in Berlin

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Job Summary:


Design and build new features for our health and safety products


Member of a product development team, working in a very agile way


Own parts of the product, participate in creating vision and coordinate product evolution


Focus on code quality and continuously improve with every next release


You work with:


A product development team composed of software developers, QA engineers, UX Designer and a Product Manager


Professional Services associates who deliver projects to our customers


Your very own team lead, that helps you grow and be effective as a professional


Desired Background, Experience and Education:


2+ years of experience in software development


Good knowledge of, and proven experience with: C#, .NET Framework 4.0+, LINQ


Firm grasp of design patterns and of SOLID, and experience using them in a commercial application


Knowledge of Domain Driven Design, CQRS, Event Sourcing desirable


Good experience with code quality – unit testing, TDD, code review, automated testing concepts and defensive coding are essential


Strong knowledge of continuous integration and deployment;


Knowledge of HTTP and .NET HTTP frameworks – ASP.NET MVC


Knowledge of relational and non-relational data stores – MSSQL (preferred), RavenDB (optional)


Able to understand and write multi-threaded code


Good grasp of both technical and functional characteristics of software products, particularly in terms of scalability, performance, usability and quality


Knowledge of concepts of scripting and automation


Experiences with developing for mobile platforms (Android, iOS) is desirable and a plus


Good communication skills in English, both written and verbal


In possession of a valid European work permit.

jobs.title: Program Manager
jobs.content:
Amazon is looking for a talented, smart and passionate Program Manager PC Gaming (m/f). The person in this role will develop marketing strategies to drive demand and new customer acquisition across multiple traffic channels, supporting our vendors and partners. This person will also work closely with the Vendor Management team to build, implement and analyze marketing and merchandising programs that promote top brands on Amazon.



The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment. This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities who strives to answer business/marketing questions and who operates independently and works across functional boundaries. We are looking for someone to develop a healthy obsession with understanding our customer and providing services that meet their needs. This person must also enjoy being a creative contributor and thrive in working in the exciting PC Gaming environment.



In this role, you will have the opportunity to display your skills in the following areas:

  • Act as the voice of the customer in understanding their behavior and needs.

  • Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing marketing and traffic metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions.

  • Create an engaging One-Stop PC Gaming Store experience that makes shopping both easy and fun for customers. Integrate state-of-the-art website features in the store and on detail pages.

  • Plan, coordinate and execute innovative marketing and merchandising initiatives to drive traffic, revenue and conversion across Amazon product lines (e.g. PC, Video Games, Electronics)

  • Develop a Gaming hardware launch strategy to establish exciting customer experience.

  • Work with vendors and vendor managers to create on-brand, best-in-class content to promote our Gaming products across Amazon product categories.

  • Negotiate and manage marketing budgets with alliance partners.

  • Collaborate with vendors, alliance partners and PR on E-Sports events.

  • Operating as an effective point of contact for Merchandising Managers, Vendor Managers, Instock Managers, Legal, and PR. Interacting with vendors and other external partners, and working with internal technical teams to roll-out new website features.




  • Multiple years in digital marketing or related field, including e-mail, SEO, traffic analysis

  • University degree required ideally in a technical or analytical discipline

  • Outstanding organizational, attention to detail and multi-tasking skills.

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to influence others internally and externally.

  • Experience designing and executing visible online customer experiences

  • Proficiency in Excel and data analysis

  • Demonstrated positive, results oriented attitude.

  • Excellent team player capable of learning and sharing knowledge in a team environment.

  • Experience interpreting and communicating analytics




  • Gaming industry experience preferred

  • Superior analytical skills. Demonstrated ability to identify and solve ambiguous problems. In particular, identifying customer needs and inventing new ways to meet those needs

  • Experience in data mining (SQL, ETL, data warehouse, etc.) and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets.

  • Proven track record in vendor negotiation and relationship management

  • Extreme attention to detail and willingness to roll up your sleeves.

  • Demonstrated success planning and executing innovative and targeted marketing programs

  • Strong bias for action with ability to prioritize, multi-task, and meet deadlines


Your benefits:


  • The opportunity to work for a leading worldwide online retailer

  • An engaging working environment with excellent career progression

  • A competitive salary including stock units and other benefits


By submitting your resume and application information, you authorize Amazon to transmit and store your information in the Amazon group of companies' world-wide recruitment database, and to circulate that information as necessary for the purpose of evaluating your qualifications for this or other job vacancies.

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content: Trifacta, a world-class startup from San Francisco, is looking for a talented and dedicated Full-Stack Engineer to join our team in Germany. You will work as part of a team that builds end-to-end functionality, turning ideas into polished, production-ready features and contributing across all of our codebase. Above all, your work will impact how the world works with data.

jobs.title: Software Developer C++/Qt
jobs.content:
As a C++ software developer you’ll be working as part of a small, professional development team responsible for designing, implementing and maintaining new and existing software applications that integrate with current and emerging video technologies. Our Video Management Software platform is at the cutting edge of video management used predominantly for integrated security solutions but increasingly being deployed across business intelligence and other exciting new applications.


This particular role is focussed on the development of a desktop client and its underlying functionality. Making the complex simple is at the core of our business and you’ll be instrumental in ensuring Wavestore is able to maintain its leading position in a world where ever-increasing integration across disparate devices needs to be managed effectively and emerging technologies such video analytics and the Internet of Things (IoT) are becoming increasingly important. You’ll be able to use your ideas and skills to shape our product in an environment that offers real challenge and excellent support.


The successful applicant will receive a competitive salary, training and scope for continued professional development.

jobs.title: Full stack Developer
jobs.content:
Solinor offers an interesting and rewarding position on designing and implementing payment services. You will work with Payment Highway service and innovative customer projects using the latest technologies.


While our systems emphasize on Java and Scala, we welcome awesome developers who love to solve problems and are eager to learn and stay on the top. Other keywords are, for example, Beacon, PCI DSS, AWS, ISO8583, Security, DevOps, iOS, Android, JavaScript, Ruby, Python, and Linux. Best of all, you can work remotely whether you live in Helsinki or elsewhere.


What is Payment Highway?


Payment Highway is the smoothest service for accepting card payments, one-click payments, recurring charging and tailored payment solutions. Our goal is to revolutionize the ease of payments and challenge our competitors in the field of payments.


https://paymenthighway.fi/en


Does this sound like you? Send your open application or ask for further information:

jobs.title: Full-stack Developer
jobs.content:
Solinor offers an interesting and rewarding position on designing and implementing payment services. You will work with Payment Highway service and innovative customer projects using the latest technologies.


While our systems emphasize on Java and Scala, we welcome awesome developers who love to solve problems and are eager to learn and stay on the top. Other keywords are, for example, Beacon, PCI DSS, AWS, ISO8583, Security, DevOps, iOS, Android, JavaScript, Ruby, Python, and Linux. Best of all, you can work remotely whether you live in Helsinki or elsewhere in Finland.


What is Payment Highway?


Payment Highway is the smoothest service for accepting card payments, one-click payments, recurring charging and tailored payment solutions. Our goal is to revolutionize the ease of payments and challenge our competitors in the field of payments.


https://paymenthighway.fi/en

jobs.title: Senior Front End Developer
jobs.content:
We are a fast paced team where developers are responsible for all aspects of feature design and development. Our ideal candidate would bring ideas to the table and be able to quickly iterate on them.


Our application, https://www.stream.me, is in a space where innovation and new technology is important; we expect team members to be able to explore novel tasks and pragmatically build out the features.


We are looking from someone with strong Front-End skills who has experience working with a full Javascript stack. We use React and Express to render views on both the front and back end (isomorphic/universal). Most of our components are built in house and we are often experimenting with new and unexplored technologies. We expect our developers to be able to use existing open source tools as well as judge when a custom component should be made.


All team members participate in code reviews, helping improve the work as well as knowledge of the code base. Our Senior team members should also help improve our best practices and help teach other team members. We release to production multiple times a day and developers are responsible for getting their features into production. Senior team members are also responsible for helping maintain the applications in production and debugging issues to help "put out fires".

jobs.title: Software Engineer - API/Backend
jobs.content:
As a Software Engineer you have the opportunity to work on all of our software stack and learn about state-of-the art web and mobile development. Technologies that you will work on are ElasticSearch, Realm.io, RabbitMQ, Backbone.js, Docker, Amazon Web Services, MySQL and interfacing them with different programming languages like Python, Java, Objective-C and Javascript.


Your responsibilities



  • Software Engineering with focus on API, web or mobile development

  • Being integrated in the whole development cycle; including planning, designing, implementation, testing and deployment processes

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Milyli is hiring a smart, passionate, and hardworking individual to join our development team and help build our latest software products and solutions. In this role, you will work alongside other developers, QA engineers, UX designers, and project managers to solve real-world business challenges. We’re looking for someone who takes pride in and ownership of their work, and who has the desire to continue learning and improving their craft.


 We believe that giving the best people the best tools to work with in a fun, casual work environment will result in the best work. If you are committed to working at the highest level in order to provide the best customer experience, we want to speak with you.


What your days will be like:

  • Writing usable, effective, and maintainable code

  • Creating automated tests to help ensure code functionality

  • Troubleshooting issues and solving problems


Additional Details

  • We offer a variety of competitive benefits.

  • There is minimal travel required for this position.

  • You must be able to legally work in the U.S.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack .Net Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Senior Full Stack .Net developer to join our London development team and drive our business forward and help harness the power of the platform for our clients.


With a solid foundation of .Net experience, the ideal candidate will be a polyglot developer, able to work across the stack and take leadership of all aspects of a website build, such as: Server configuration, .Net MVC, HTML/CSS, Javascript, API development, automated build processes & deployment etc. We looking for a senior technologist to set technical the standards of our company moving forward!


Along with daily technical duties in London, the ideal candidate will spearhead new initiatives and promote best practices and new techniques across the ORM development teams in London and Europe.


Aside from technical skills, the ideal candidate will be well experienced in the non technical aspects of web development, such as project cost estimation, work prioritisation, inter department liaison (such as reviewing designs, providing structured feedback on UX proposals, advising the Strategy team on pitches etc.) as well as documenting work and clearly communicating/escalating issues to the project team.


Key Responsibilities:



  • Technical ownership of projects

  • Senior escalation point for technical issues

  • Day to day coding

  • Server & Build system configuration

  • Mentoring/advising members of the team

  • Project duties (Time estimation, Documentation, Reviewing work etc)

  • Client facing duties (Workshops, Technical liaison, Presenting work in progress etc)

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Ideagen are looking for a Software Developer to add to our existing (80+) Technical Team in the UK.


This role will involve building the current and future versions of our high quality product suite.


Do you have a love of technology and a passion for getting your hands dirty creating "best of breed" software?


What's in it for you?


While we take our work and deliverables seriously, we have a relaxed working environment complete with in-house table tennis, dart board, PS4 Leader Board, weekly five-a-side football, and regular nights out and nights in.


At Ideagen we want our people to be rewarded for their hard work so we offer benefits such as Life Insurance, Private Medical Insurance, Contributory Pension Scheme, Free Fruit, Cycle to Work Scheme and 32 days’ holiday including statutory holidays, plus a day off to celebrate your birthday!


Whether you have a love of web-based software, an obsession with databases, or just an ability to see things differently, Ideagen could have the perfect opportunity for you.

jobs.title: Applications Development Lead
jobs.content:
Job Description


Are you an experienced developer interested in building the next generation of apps for Investors? The Connect Team is a select group of developers and designers on the leading edge of financial services technology. Our mission is to deliver the highest quality business applications to Investors, enrich their digital experience and provide the best data where and when it is needed most. The team is idea driven and works with business partners to deliver robust technology solutions that meet their evolving needs.



The Investments Technology Team is seeking a full-stack developer lead with a passion for delivering exceptional experiences to global users. The successful candidate will be the driving force that takes ownership of complex initiatives and lead developers in a fast paced, agile environment to deliver applications that make a difference.



Qualities



Commitment. You give 100% to everything you do. You are passionate and believe in delivering the best possible product.



Creativity. You are not just a great coder. You are an innovator who is ready to make significant contributions on every project and define patterns for success that are reusable throughout the firm.



Leadership. You are a thought leader who is ready to share ideas and help us solve problems.



Motivation. You must be ready to hit the ground running and help us achieve our mission from Day 1.



Vision. While delivering frequently and maintaining high velocity for your scrum team, you still are still able to think strategically and can develop components that meet our immediate and long term objectives and constantly drive us towards the strategic end state.



Connect Team


The Team is responsible for the design and development of Investor facing applications, translating complex business requirements into immersive user experiences. Our objective is to rapidly prototype app concepts, validate with end users and push designs into development sprints as efficiently and effectively as possible. The environment is fast paced and there is a strong commitment to delivering the best possible solution. UX is at the forefront of this initiative, and our teams work to apply a consistent styling and logic to everything we produce.



Key Responsibilities


· Scrum manager create and lead a team of developers responsible for specific applications


· Full-stack architecture, design, development for Investor Tools and Applications


· Delivery of software on time and on budget, based on original scope & requirements


· Designing software and producing scalable and resilient technical designs


· Digesting and understanding Business Requirements and designing new modules/functionality to meet those needs


· Creating Automated Unit Tests using Flexible/Open Source Frameworks using a Test Driven Development approach


· Partner with supporting tech leads to develop realistic and achievable project estimates


· Analysis and build within Control, Stability, Resiliency, Capacity & Performance areas


· Testing: Unit, SIT & UAT planning and management


· Robust delivery of code into the production environment


· Take part in decisions affecting long range organizational goals & strategic planning.


· Proactively look to develop, implement and further development best practices across the group. The areas of focus should include, but not be limited to quality improvement, code reviews, code/architecture standards, code reuse, and reduction of support calls, technical documentation and technical design specifications.

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Developer - possible Team-Lead
jobs.content:
Ever dreamed of disrupting an entire industry?


Join ARGO and change the way companies participate in international trade!


Have you ever wondered how Western companies sell goods to countries such as China or Tansania for hundred thousands of Euros without fear of never being paid? We help them do it!


ARGO is building a new way to take the risk of non-payment out of international trade transactions. Thus, making global transactions as easy as PayPal did for consumers to buy in the dangerous world wide web.


We have just started on our big vision! We are backed by one of the best European VCs, we have a great complimentary management team and are right in the middle of building our first product.


But now its time for us to get help. We are looking for experienced Ruby on Rails wizards that share our vision of creating a big disruption and want to build something exciting and fresh from the ground up!


As core member of our backend team, you will build...



  • a Rails 4 API on postgresql hosted on Heroku serving all our clients

  • an admin interface that builds the core for our internal processes

  • a broad test coverage to ensure service availability


Both in Berlin as well as in a remote position, we offer you...



  • a small team of super smart and driven people that believe in changing things to the better 

  • an informal working atmosphere based upon direct communication and feedback with no bureaucracy or unnecessary disturbance: we believe in Slack, limited meetings and fast honest talk

  • direct influence on anything you build: We know what we want to do, but if you know a better solution, we will go your way!

  • an environment to grow: learn from your team, help others around you getting better every day, visit conferences, get and give feedback regularly and understand more than just the technical side of our business

  • lots of additional perks such as awesome team events, regular team lunches and dinners, free of choice hardware,...


We hope to find in you...



  • experience in Ruby on Rails development proven by contribution to at least one or two projects

  • a passionate developer that loves to code

  • a team player that can talk code and English

  • test-driven development skills 


 We are super excited to hear from you!

jobs.title: Product Owner - Banking Technology - Glasgow
jobs.content:
The Core Components and Architecture (CCA) group within the Technology division of J.P. Morgan Asset Management serves all aspects of the business, providing best in class architecture and enterprise data solutions and services used as the foundation for technology development.
Enterprise Data Platform is next generation highly scalable, reliable data distribution, validation and event notification platform leveraging on cloud, Asynchronous messaging and big data technologies.
Data Distribution: Bulk, Ad-hoc data distribution and delivery with RESTful, Streaming mechanism.
Responsibilities:
• Gather business requirements and translate them to features
• Create a compelling vision for the segment and engage the team with this vision
• Put projects in understandable wording for stakeholders with a less technical background
• Drive creativity by gathering new ideas and constantly challenging the team to think outside of the beaten tracks
• Collect, interpret and translate data to support business decisions
• Follow a 'small steps philosophy' for example by challenging the team to find the smallest possible step to achieve the result
• Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of both customer and business requirements.
• Perform both qualitative and quantitative analysis of customers and the market.
• Work with department heads to create company-wide goals and objectives.
• Work with the Chief Product Owner to develop and maintain the product roadmap.
• Author documentation to support engineering, including business requirements, product requirements, flow charts and wireframes.
• Document business requirements in specification by example mode in the form of feature files
• Prioritize a backlog of user stories based on stakeholder metrics.
• Lead sprint planning, maintenance, and backlog meetings.
• Analyze and communicate the performance of product initiatives
• SQL – Experience writing and debugging stored procedures and scripts
• Java, Tomcat, J2EE, JavaScript, JSP
• Open source web technologies like Apache, Tomcat, Spring, Hibernate etc.
• Source Code management techniques/tools for software management. Knowledge of release management.
• HTML/XML
• UNIX shell and shell scripting
• Build tools like Jenkis/Maven/Nexus
• Test tools like JUnit, Cucumber and Selenium
• Performance analysis and tuning across system boundaries

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Team Profile:


Morgan Stanley’s market leading institutional equity derivatives business is powered by a world class technology platform from front to back. The system manages the pre-trade workflow for sales and trading including product definition, pricing and quoting, pre-trade approvals and STP integration with booking systems. This flow is handled through a range of inputs from high-touch bespoke exotics to direct FIX connectivity and auto-pricing.


As the business continues to grow and in order to evolve the platform, the equity derivatives pre-trade pricing and execution technology team is undertaking a programme of change to increase our external connectivity and to improve STP for all aspects of the pre-trade workflow. We will also be extending the platform to support the commodities business. Whilst much of the platform is relatively new, there are still significant components that need to be developed and key architectural decisions to be made.


Reflecting the global nature of our business and systems, the pre-trade pricing and execution team is distributed between London, New York, Hong Kong and Mumbai. Our strongest location in terms of numbers is London, the ideal time zone for running a global team and where many of our business sponsors are also located. We are active in many out of work activities both socially and volunteering our time through various firm sponsored initiatives.


Role Profile:



  • You will be a technically proficient and enthusiastic developer, with a desire to work on the full stack in order to help engineer new and existing components.

  • You will support and lead different phases of the product lifecycle including analysis, development and testing.

  • You will develop new and existing components in Scala or Java. Previous commercially proven experience in either Scala or Java is required, with a strong desire to develop your skills more widely.

  • You will be expected to promote best practices in terms of TDD, development tools and technologies.

  • Your role will involve constant interaction with front office business users, analysing and gathering requirements.

  • You will be expected to collaboration with members from the wider global team, as well as neighbouring teams and systems such as pricing and trade capture.

  • Additionally, there is an opportunity to work with C#/WPF and influence the HTML5 strategy for the team.


Tech Stack:



  • Latest versions of Java (8) and Scala (2.11)

  • Extensive use of open source, including Spring, Gradle, Akka, Guava, Apache CXF, Commons and Zookeeper

  • Globally distribted n-tier platform  deployed across Tokyo, Hong Kong, London and New York

  • Utilisation of the latest Firm technologies including Treadmill PaaS, Splunk-based LaaS and Service Discovery

jobs.title: Android Engineer
jobs.content:
A challenging task


As part of our XING Events Market team, you are responsible for building our Events features into the well-known XING Android app that is used by many XING users every day. A lot of features are already planned, but not much is implemented yet, so you have the chance to really build something new. Within this excellent Scrum team, you will play an active part in shaping our product, as for us this is teamwork. The Events backend is built in Ruby on Rails by your teammates, and you will use the internal REST API to call the backend. Your code resides inside our central Github, and the app is built with Gradle. It is very likely you will contribute also to the open source projects we are using, or building.

jobs.title: Senior PHP/ Symfony Developer
jobs.content:
We are the next generation Website-as-a-Service Company. As website-provider for small and medium-sized companies, we convince not only with outstanding quality, but also with excellent service and fair prices. We are looking for you to support our growth and vision: to become the leading full-service-website-provider. How to achieve that? We combine artificial intelligence and sense for beauty.


Why should you accept the challenge and join Websitebutler on its journey?



  • Together we will develop and improve the best website creation and publishing tools for SMBs on the market

  • You will utilize AI to inject corporate identity into beautiful unique websites

  • You will seek for new ways to improve and advance our own CMS and CRM called “James”

  • Through continuous observation of our user’s behavior you always strive for the best UIs which allows users to operate faster

jobs.title: .Net Software Developer
jobs.content:
Datel are looking for a developer to join our award winning Research and Development team. 


Datel is a leading UK Sage Business Partner and Sage Reseller specialising in Sage ERP software Sage 200, Sage 1000, Sage Line 500 and Sage X3 and CRM software, Sage CRM and Saleslogix.


R&D are our progressive Application development team, focussed on blue sky thinking and creating innovative new products to expand the world of Sage.


We are looking for somebody with strong development skills, with the ability to understand business concepts and experience working in a collaborative environment. You will ideally have skills around the following



  • C#

  • Net

  • MSSQL


Experience Java would be useful aswell. We are also moving more and more to mobile technologies, with recent apps developed in Xamarin, so if  you have touched on this, that will be great (though by no means essential)


In return we offer a competitive salary and benefits which include pension, healthcare scheme, shopping discounts, free onsite gym and discounted canteen. We see ourselves as being in that sweet-spot, where we are big enough to make a difference, but small enough to care (you won’t just be another number here!)


We are based in Warrington and many of the team commute in from the surrounding areas (Liverpool, Manchester, Wigan, Runcorn, Newton Le Willows, Cheshire, Lancashire, North Wales etc) Our working hours are 9 – 5.30pm, though we can be a little flexible depending on circumstances.


 We are looking for somebody to join our team ASAP, if this sounds like you, then apply straight away!

jobs.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Team Profile:


The position of a Java developer has become available within the London Prime Client Service Technology team. The team is closely aligned to the Prime Brokerage business unit. PB has a global footprint with offices in all the main financial centers, it provide consolidated clearing, custody, financing, foreign exchange and portfolio reporting services to the most sophisticated limited partnerships, asset managers and institutions. Prime Brokerage is very successful collection of businesses (PB, Listed Derivatives Clearing, OTC Clearing and DSP) and is seen as a market leader in its field in a number of global regions.


Morgan Stanley is the number one prime broker on the Street, a major contributing factor to this success has been the emphasis placed on technology. To maintain the competitive edge Morgan Stanley Prime Brokerage is continually looking to deploy innovative technology to deliver solutions to their Clients and well as internally to service their client base. The team has a number of bespoke systems developed to assist the global business unit in the management and servicing of Clients. Users are both internal and external to the Firm. The team is responsible for a number of core systems that enable Client coverage (Client Service, Sales, Capital introduction, onboarding etc.) to be best in the Breed service to our clients.


Role Profile:



  • You will work as a server side Java developer focusing on projects targeted to both internal and external users. There is extensive use of middleware services written in Java on a Linux platform with Sybase data repositories, and IBM MQ Series messaging queuing. You will also have the opportunity to work on the new JavaScript/HTML user interface and help to steer the strategy.

  • You will have the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment on localized and global projects, with considerable opportunities to get exposure to the business both directly related to Prime Brokerage but also other departments within the Firm.

  • You will interface with business unit sponsors to gather requirements and document detailed deliverables

  • You will be expected to be involved in the full development lifecycle of projects.

  • You will be expected to collaborate with others in the wider team as well as working on your own initiative.

  • You will be integral in the decision-making processes with team members both in terms of new system development and enhancement to current systems.

jobs.title: SENIOR ANDROID DEVELOPER
jobs.content:
At Routes.Tips we’re transforming the way people enjoy traveling. Our mission is to make unique travel experiences easily available to everyone. But pursuing such an ambitious goal can be quite daunting, and we need to continue to build a world-class team to take advantage of the many opportunities in front of us.

So if you would like to play a key role in an early stage startup, make waves in the travel industry, influence the company, it’s products and not being just a tiny gear in a strict 9-5 environment, then we would like to hear from you. Applications are now open for open-minded, creative and innovative thinkers.


Who We Are:
Beautiful engineering is a core part of who we are. We work hard to be the best breed of engineers, and cultivating our superior engineering culture across the entire organization.

The Team:
You will work with a team of experienced and open-minded engineers, striving to make perfect products.

The engineering team takes pride in its focus on engineering fundamentals, and is a team that has a close bond with one another, with no big egos, and welcomes self-driven engineers to come and join in the adventure.

Working in an early stage startup like ours ensures that everyone in the team is constantly learning at an incredible pace. This affords you the chance to develop your skills effectively, quickly and on the go.

jobs.title: Ambitious Web/ Software Developer
jobs.content: • Are you an experienced .Net Software/ Web Developer who loves to work on a variety of projects with different technologies? If you have a thirst for knowledge, a passion for problem-solving and a desire to be working on a varied portfolio of projects and clients then you’ll fit in well.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Avaloq Innovation's Development Centre in Edinburgh is now recruiting for a Software Engineer to join the Localisation Europe team.  Working with the team of highly trained and capable specialists, you will:



  • Design, develop, maintain and continuously improve frameworks and applications at the heart of our clients’ operations

  • Help shape a market leading product and define the future of banking at Avaloq

  • Work in a mature Oracle environment combined with customised DSLs

  • Attend client workshops and demonstrate product expertise as a trusted advisor, gathering requirements and evaluating use cases to resolve client issues


Our current projects:


In an evolving market, where we are co-inventing banking, our projects are at the forefront of innovation:



  • Implementation of a UK Tax Engine to model and report client taxes to the UK tax authority (HMRC)

  • French Taxes Offshore Solution to report to the French tax authorities on overseas clients

  • MiFID II Regulatory Reporting compliance for banks which provide services to clients located in the EEA

jobs.title: (Senior) JavaScript Developer for SAP Cloud for Analytics
jobs.content:
PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES



We are at the early stages of building the next generation, industry-leading cloud Analytics platform, just announced in October 2015 on http://sapcloudanalytics.com, and we’re growing fast. Do you want to be at the forefront of leading innovation in Analytics? Do you want to be in a fast-paced, startup team culture with the massive market share, muscle and stability of SAP? Are you an energetic and passionate programmer or system administrator who wants the opportunity to work in a global team? Do you want to hone and deepen your skills using cutting-edge technologies for cloud, big data, mobile, SAP HANA (in-memory database and platform) and modern visualization? Do you thrive in an environment where highly skilled engineers work collaboratively, and where every member of the team including management makes technical contributions? If so, then this is the right job for you! Help us shape the future.



EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS



Are you a virtuoso in web programming? Do you love to develop web applications and know HTML5, JavaScript and CSS like the back of your hand?



As Developer in our team, you will be working with a group of exceptionally talented and motivated colleagues. Our development process follows the principle of continuous integration, and we use the latest tools such as Git, Gerrit, Jenkins and JIRA with custom-tailored extensions in conjunction with in-house developed software. In our team you will develop and improve our cloud analytics platform, SAP Cloud for Analytics, as well as cooperate with user interface designers and sales colleagues to deliver the best user experience for our customers.



On a usual day you will...



  • develop and improve SAP Cloud for Analytics using JavaScript and SAP UI5 on top of our cutting edge technology, SAP HANA.

  • write unit tests for your code and define end-to-end tests for the application.



In addition to that you will...



  • work closely with our designers to provide our customers with fresh, friendly, and elegantly simple user experiences no matter their function or role within the application.

  • engage with our sales team and customers to better understand the needs and workflows of the end users, and collaborate on concepts for new functionality.

jobs.title: SAP HANA Cloud platform developer, Java
jobs.content:
Paul Hendrix, VP Research & Development:


“I need someone who can guide us through a process. We’re on a journey to build something new, something exciting. New technology, new functionality resulting in a software package that could be considered disruptive. And we’re facing challenges in realizing this, mostly because we’re figuring out the best way to accomplish our journey. However, we have a great team with smart guys working for us, we have the whole organization backing us and we are confident enough to say we will make this new software a success! I am looking for some-one who has a broad understanding of the HANA Cloud Platform (HCP) and can help us in the decisions that need to be made and decide the way forward for our architecture.”  



Responsibilities:



  • Developing new functionality in Java, Javascript and HANA XS.

  • Determining the architecture.

  • Coaching/supporting the team of 5.

  • Handling integration issues.

  • Doing business analysis.

  • Coordinating and discussions with SME’s(subject matter expert).

  • Keeping up-to-date with the latest developments in SAP HCP and in Java.

jobs.title: Ethical Hacker
jobs.content:
Ethical Hacker

An exciting role where you will get the opportunity to work amongst world class ethical hackers and security professionals and gain exposure to a variety of technologies and systems.

What are you going to do?
You will report to the Ethical Hacking team lead in KPN’s Information Security Office and will perform penetration tests of KPNs core networks, products and services and KPN client’s systems as required. You will apply your expertise to isolate, research, and exploit vulnerabilities on hardened devices. You will also be responsible for documenting your findings and creating recommendations for improved network, device, and application security. You will be performing penetration and vulnerability tests in accordance with industry-accepted methods and protocols.

Projects may include:



  • Perform redteam exercises against KPN and customer environments

  • Performing network-based and application level penetration tests

  • Performing security assessments of radio networks (e.g Wifi GSM LTE)

  • Reverse Engineering embedded devices

  • Developing testing scripts and procedures

  • Other security-related projects that may be assigned according to skills

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We are looking for a Software Engineer to participate in the development of bespoke built and scalable electoral modernization portfolio products and solutions to keep Innovating Democracy Worldwide. If you are a strong Software Engineer with an excellent knowledge of the Java stack who also finds the joy working with Javascript (AngularJS) to perform some tasks in the frontend when needed (or you have the interest to learn it), this is position is specially made for you.


This position is based in Scytl Headquarters in Barcelona.



How can you help us?


Your responsibilities as a Software Engineer will be the following:
 



  • Development and optimization of reliable and secure applications used by millions of people.

  • Participation in the analysis and architectural design of a mission critical software.

  • Participation in the delivery of projects Worldwide. Some sporadic short-term trips may be required.

Job Advantages:



  • International working environment.

  • Creative and results focused team.

  • Opportunity to be part of the worldwide leader in its market.

  • Good offices in Barcelona city centre.

jobs.title: Senior RubyOnRails Engineer
jobs.content:
Senior RubyOnRails Engineer (m/f)


Can a marketplace solution platform be a technology software company? Yes we already do! And for the growing IT department we need next software engineers, visionary employees to build for complex market our software any modern, state of the art and trend-setting technology. Be part of this talented group and get a big piece of responsibility in creation this mission. This is movinga - join us and apply now.


YOUR TASK



  • Designing, building and maintaining efficient, reusable, and reliable Ruby code

  • Integration of user-facing elements developed by front-end developers with server side logic

  • Working in Scrum sprints along with developers, scrum masters and product owner

  • Integration of data storage solutions

  • Develop sophisticated algorithms to to automated pricing and bundling

  • Identifying bottlenecks and bugs as well as devising solutions to these problems

  • Helping maintain code quality, organization and automation


YOUR PROFILE



  • Computer Science degree or equivalent software engineering background

  • 2 years hands-on experience with Ruby on Rails

  • Follow clean coding practices using Robocop or similar conventions

  • Strong background in docker

  • Proven track record in BDD using rspec. And code review in team

  • Experience with data storage solution, SQL database knowledge

  • Additional code experience in html and javascript is a big plus

  • Knowledge in building scalable systems


WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT



  • A fast-paced working environment in a rapidly developing company

  • Challenges which let you grow day by day

  • Flat hierarchies with space for your own ideas in a dynamic, dedicated and motivating environment

  • An attractive remuneration

  • Fresh fruits, cereals and softdrinks as well as various benefits for restaurants, gyms, cafés etc.

  • Loft office in the heart of Berlin's trendy district Prenzlauer Berg


If you want to be a part of a young, dynamic company with a unique team-culture, then you are just the person we are looking for. Apply for the job today!

We code stuff that matters and reaches millions of people. We believe in lean and agile software engineering. Our technology stack is plain Java, MySQL, Hadoop, Spring, Eclipse, Lucene and Tomcat.

Our goal is to build a system which is able to analyze huge amounts of data in real time to allow us to derive accurate data driven business decisions. Thus, we are looking for an additional “Java Backend Developer (m/f)” to join our business intelligence team.

  • Ensuring the performance and scalability of our data warehouse system and business intelligence infrastructure

  • Extending our database schema in order to deal with new kinds of data

  • Connecting external data sources to our system (ETL)


What we offer:

  • Opportunity to work independently and gain lots of insight into the field of e-commerce

  • Continuous training possibilities and room for further personal development

  • Flexible working hours and a great office in the heart of Berlin

We are looking forward to receiving your application!

jobs.title: Java Performance Engineer
jobs.content:
As Java Performance Engineer, you will be responsible for end to end analysis of performance in JEE-based Web applications.

You will take ownership for hands-on fixing of performance problems in Java and JavaScript (AngularJS), in addition to defining best practices for the implementation (coding, configuration, instrumentation, metrics) and monitoring of high-performance Web applications including SOA REST services for mobile applications.

You will also be responsible for the performance testing of Web applications, including response time, scalability (load tests) and network bandwith requirements etc.


As the successful Java Performance Engineer, you will be working within a highly capable team of Software Engineers and Business Analysts within the Edinburgh Development Centre.  You will be instrumental in improving team performance across design, development, testing and consulting, to help to avoid customer escalations and meet and exceed industry standard response times.

jobs.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
Are you the product-hero Scripbox deserves? Or are you the one we need?


We are looking for creators who can build products that our customers love. The challenge for you will involve understanding, and building for, an unforgiving consumer who invests a lot of trust into the product YOU will build. Your product will be used by thousands.


Scripbox is making a difference in the world of personal finance and investing and we would like you to be part of the team that makes it happen.


You'll be responsible for:



  • Writing quality code using language best practices.

  • Working in a highly collaborative team.

  • Building good software using the latest tools and techniques.

  • Participating in design reviews, coding modules, code reviews and unit testing.

  • Good OO skills, including strong design patterns knowledge.

  • Familiar with datastores like MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redis etc.

  • Worked with testing tools / frameworks like RSpec / Capybara / Jasmine.

  • Knowledge of deploying software using/to Capistrano, Chef, AWS, EC2, Heroku.

  • Experience working with, or interest in Agile Methodologies.

  • Knowledge of software best practices, like Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Continuous Integration (CI).


Good to have:



  • Participation in open source projects.

  • Actively involved in solving problems on Github, Stackoverflow and similar other community groups.

  • Passionate about blogging technical stuff, speaking at meetups, conventions.


What you’ll get:



  • Very competitive salary with performance bonus.

  • Active promotion of your professional career by sending you to events, hackathons, user groups etc.

  • Weekly time-slot where you are encouraged to spend time to play around with new technology or self-learning.

jobs.content:
Position


As a Developers you will use your skills and experience across technology and finance to create industry leading software components for pricing and risk models, algorithms and computational methods and optimization frameworks.



Scope


You are an expert in Java or another object oriented programming language. You can work independently or as part of small groups in the development and delivery of software components and services. jobs.title: Backend developer
jobs.content:
Are you the engineer, who is all about continuous delivery, XP and building high traffic software? Do you want to be part of a dynamic and fast-growing fashion E-commerce department? Then we are looking for you!


As our new Backend Engineer you will be part of our E-commerce department in the centre of Amsterdam, where you will be working together with more than 100 colleagues from all over the world in a young, fast-paced and agile environment. You will play a key role within our Amsterdam office, leading the way to help BESTSELLER E-commerce push quality of the systems to the next level. In the technology team you will, together with your colleagues, ensure that we improve and maintain our E-commerce platform, omni-channel initiatives and our backend systems, such as our Order Management System.


Moreover, your tasks will include:



  • Building new features into different micro services within our AWS architecture

  • Conducting code reviews and writing automated tests

  • Defining improvements for the application(s) you’re working on 

  • Implement Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery practices

  • Defining improvements to our way of working

  • Sharing knowledge with your team members

  • Fixing bugs and analyse errors using all available information and tools


Why work for us?


Sound interesting?  Besides being a challenging and inspiring place to work, we value a good work atmosphere and equally offer good benefits. To this extent, you can think off an excellent daily lunch made by a professional cook, a ‘fit for less’ plan, regular Friday events with colleagues and on a monthly basis our own office games, the ‘BSE Olympics’. Last but not least, we have employees from all over the world and encourage international candidates to apply. If applicable, we will assist you in relocation formalities, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.

jobs.title: Java / Selenium Test Engineer - Winery Software
jobs.content:
In the great Northwest they call it an SDET.  Other places they call it a Test Engineer or Test Developer.  Whatever they call it, it's you.  You've somehow found yourself writing code that tests other people's code.


At Granbury we respect the mighty SDET and we'll need your help laying a safety net for a major refactoring effort.  You'll use a new front end test automation tool we've built on top of Selenium WebDriver to make sure our wine club, wine e-commerce, and tasting room point-of-sale systems work reliably and accurately.


Like Wes Mantooth, the other developers may hate you for it, but they will respect you.


And they'll work with you.  When you need DOM elements to have id's, they will give you id's.  You won't have to slog your way through with unwieldy xpath expressions.  You won't be a second class citizen and you'll get the respect and support you need.  No code ships without a green bar from you.


And you'll do all this from the comfort of your own home.  This is a remote position, but you'll keep in touch with your team with daily virtual standups.  We'll pick a spot on the map every so often and get together for a technical conference (including PNSQC in October) or an in person design confab.  And yes, there will probably be free wine and excuses to take your main squeeze on a trip to Napa Valley.  After we ship the most stable release in the company's history thanks to your efforts, you'll walk into the Napa office to a slow teary eyed round of applause.
