jobs.title: API Architect
jobs.content:
Job description

API Architect for a Leading Fintech company

When it fits, you feel it! Together with a team of fellow architects, 10+ POs and highly interactive scrum teams, you are a key player in defining Binckbanks future products and services integration.

You are our subject matter expert when it comes to all things concerning APIs and as such can support a growing number of teams with your expertise during their participation in a variety of epics. You will take the lead in our migration from an enterprise service bus towards APIs. A technical vision is needed to ensure that best practices in the field of API design are adhered within our company. Nevertheless, your role extends far beyond being the internal reference point of API excellence: You will define the strategy for third-party consumption of Binckbanks public APIs. In this you collaborate with product owners and marketing experts (to position our API solutions, e.g. through Hackathons). Engagement with external developer communities to encourage the use of your API landscape as a foundation for the development of new, unexpected products is also required.

If you're self-motivated and looking for a fast-paced, agile, and nimble environment to build highly visible, high traffic customer experiences, then find your fit at Binckbank!

Responsibilities:

  • Take charge of Binckbanks strategy for both internal (private) and external (public) APIs
  • Provide leadership to further decomposition of Binckbanks application landscape through an effective API approach
  • Provide expert support to a team of 5 developers (and counting) towards excellence in their development of Binckbanks public APICollaborate with internal and external users of your teams APIs to ensure that their needs are met
  • Develop our firms API excellence and boost constructive working relationships across both departments and borders
  • Design and build scalable, secure, and extensible APIs that power engaging customer experiences
  • Implement a robust API management platform for orchestration, developer sign-up, API docs, caching, security, and more Drive speed of high volume digital channels through performant API architecture and tuning
  • Own the code, spending 40%-50% of the time in hands-on activities
  • Champion the use of web standards, REST architectural style and conventions, and industry best practices
  • Guard the integrity of the companys API as a public contract

Requirements

  • Extensive experience designing and developing RESTful APIs
  • Deep knowledge on REST API design concerns, with opinions about HATEAOS, PUT vs PATCH, API versioning, and more
  • Broad knowledge of web standards relating to APIs (OAuth, CORS, JWT, etc.)
  • Metrics-oriented and concerned about testing throughput, latency, security and other non-functional requirements
  • Extensive coding experience with either Java/Spring or Node.js
  • Experience with a leading API Management platform (e.g. Apigee, Mashery, Layer7)
  • Knowledge about cloud computing (IaaS / PaaS) on major providers (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform)
  • Strong command of object-oriented design principles and prevailing design patterns
  • Able to convince teams and management of embracing API principles

About Us

  • Binck is Fintech
  • International (Netherlands, Belgium, France, Spain, Italy)
  • Growing
  • Young of age and culture
  • Very mature agile change practice
  • Large internal software practice

If you have any further questions regarding the vacancy, please feel free to contact hiring manager Hedwig van Gastel.

Please apply online via the link.

Click here to apply

Agency calls not appreciated

Keywords: Vacancy, Full-time, Amsterdam, IT architect, API solutions.

jobs.title: IT System Administrator
jobs.content:
movingimage is in a process of fast growth and therefore looking for qualified tech specialist for its newly formed teams. We are hiring talented engineers with a broad and deep understanding of technology, visionary, yet very pragmatic engineers, who can envision and implement next generation software innovations.


You will be working with our multinational team on designing and implementing enterprise software solutions. And there's a lot more to learn about us, for example from our video: http://www.movingimage24.com/de/ueber-uns/jobs/


Interested?


Then you're in the right place, because we are currently looking for an experienced:


IT System Administrator (m/f)


Would you like to…



  • take a leading role in the planning, installation, integration, operation, optimization and continuous development of our IT-infrastructure?

  • be a competent point of contact for the implementation of individual video management solutions for our customers?

  • provide and maintain a reliable infrastructure for our software development process?

  • administer Linux- or BSD-based systems?

  • contribute new creative ideas for the further development and enhancement of our network operation system?

  • manage complex networks, and uphold and implement the highest safety requirements?

  • help to professionalize our classical help-desk-services (Windows, Linux, Mac)

  • prove your team skills as a member of an agile team?

  • experience, how the principles of the Agile Methodology are implemented and lived within the whole organization?


Are you able to…



  • show us your experience in the administration of Linux-systems?

  • administrate web services (Apache, Nginx), database- and cluster-systems (MySQL, MongoDB, RabbitMQ, Zookeeper)?

  • understand infrastructure- and network-systems deep and profound?

  • prove us your experience with virtual machines (VMware, LXC, OpenVZ)?

  • handle firewalls, load balancers, DNS, Web caches, monitoring systems, scripting?

  • demonstrate us your experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery?

  • understand and ideally code in object-oriented programming languages such as PHP, Java, Perl or Python?

  • deal with GIT/SVN and CDN-technologies?

  • communicate in German and English in a professional way?

  • present at least a bachelor’s degree in computer sciences (or some other significant degree) and relevant work experience of minimum three years?


 Do you feel addressed? We should get to know each other!


 We offer…



  • an exciting perspective, a wide range of tasks, constantly new challenges and a desire for thinking out-of-the-box as part of our corporal culture

  • an open working environment that is characterised by teamwork and cross-functional cooperation and in which heart and humour are key figures

  • freedom to introduce your own ideas and to take responsibility

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
movingimage is in a process of fast growth and therefore looking for qualified senior software engineers for its newly formed teams. We are hiring talented engineers with a broad and deep understanding of technology, visionary, yet very pragmatic developers, who can envision and implement next generation software innovations.


You will be working with our multinational team on designing and implementing enterprise software solutions. And there's a lot more to learn about us, for example from our video: http://www.movingimage24.com/de/ueber-uns/jobs/


Interested?


Then you're in the right place, because we are currently looking for an experienced:


Senior Software Engineer (m/f)


Would you like to…



  • be an important part of our multinational agile software development team?

  • implement the new version of our APIs using technologies like GRPC, Spring, HATEOAS, Akka, Mongo DB, RabbitMQ and Kafka?

  • implement high-quality and scalable video asset management and video streaming solutions for enterprise customers?

  • deliver a rich, engaging and unmatched user experience?

  • write well-structured and documented “clean” code?

  • continuously update and expand the existing product?

  • experience how the principles of the Agile Methodology are implemented and lived within the whole organization?


Are you able to…



  • present at least a bachelor’s degree in computer sciences (or some other significant degree) and relevant work experience in building high traffic web applications using J2EE, Spring, Scala or Golang of at least 6 years?

  • demonstrate that you are a language agnostic with core understanding of mainstream programming languages and proven programming experience in either Java or C++?

  • demonstrate that you are a native user of linux systems (preferably Debian-based distribution)?

  • be hands-on in designing software and solving complexity by using OOP design patterns and SOLID principles?

  • prove that you are experienced in building Domain Driven Design (DDD) applications and web services?

  • show that you are familiar with asynchronous and event-driven programming using frameworks like Vert.x, Reactor and Netty?

  • show strong knowledge of NoSQL databases (especially MongoDB and ElasticSearch) and MySQL?

  • ideally also prove previous experience in implementing RESTful APIs for mobile and web applications?

  • communicate in German and English in all relevant courses of business?

  • be open and a team player who is able to carry out goal-oriented analysis and solve problems?


Do you feel addressed? We should get to know each other!


We offer…



  • an exciting perspective, a wide range of tasks, constantly new challenges and a desire for thinking out-of-the-box as part of our corporal culture

  • an open working environment that is characterised by teamwork and cross-functional cooperation and in which heart and humour are key figures

  • freedom to introduce your own ideas and to take responsibility


Even more interested?

jobs.title: Software Engineer Backend
jobs.content:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility. With the set of principles that we give our teams - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust them to shape the future of Zalando.You will be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.


What makes your individual impact at Zalando limitless is the possibility to tackle and create new opportunities. At Zalando, it is not only about growth and improvement - it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue. We strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.


You Are Setting Standards


Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will join one of our 90+ teams to build, scale and continuously improve a variety of products that create value for our platform.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


Ownership.You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.


Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.

jobs.title: Full stack engineer, flexible hours
jobs.content:
We believe in properly flexible hours, working from home a couple of days a week, and value good code over hours at a desk. Escape the structure of a traditional job and work when you’re in the right mindset, and do something else when you’re not.


We’ll give you a broad and interesting role – one day might be working on customer facing pages, another on an API integration, a third drilling into customer behaviour and helping strategy decisions. There's considerable scope to tailor the role to what you're best at or enjoy most. We believe good engineers code well in any language and choose the right tools for the job.


A typical day might include:


- Review any support requests or system alerts that have come in about your features, and deal with anything time-critical
- Share your recent progress & plans for the day with other developers at the morning standup meeting (either in person, or via skype)
- Work with a product owner to understand a new feature and discuss implementation. The build, test and release.


We're a small company with no red tape to slow you down - you'll be trusted to work independently, bring new knowledge and ideas to the team and get satisfaction from doing things right.

jobs.title: Customer Operations Specialist
jobs.content:
DealDash is looking for talented and motivated individuals who are interested in joining a company with startup roots that has now grown into an e-commerce success.
This is an English language position within our Customer Support team.

You will need to demonstrate you're capable of independent work, fresh ideas and the drive to be part of a successful team. Successful applicants will begin with a two-week training period, following which the work becomes a remote based role.

This is a 5 day per week position with shifts that may be from Mon-Sun and may include evening work.

Values are important, this is what we believe in at DealDash

  • Talk with, listen to, and understand your customer. Treat them as you would want to be treated yourself.
  • You can truly learn anything. Get off the couch! Develop new skills and expand your perspective.
  • Take ownership. Take initiative. Take action. YOU are the Company.
  • Break assumptions. Pursue unconventional ideas.
  • Data is worth more than 1,000 smart opinions. Data is everywhere, use it!
 

Some Fun Facts About DealDash

  • Our team is spread out over 6 countries
  • 14 nationalities
  • We offer a $6,000 resignation bonus to anyone who resigns
  • We believe people who work at DealDash should only do so because they love it, not because it's their only option financially)
  • Every employee talks to Customers every week, no matter what your function! We love our Customers!
  •  92% of our revenue comes from repeat buyers! (And we are growing!)
 
We encourage applicants from the following locations:
  • Canada
  • USA (Minnesota & Illinois only)
  • Finland
  • UK
  • Spain
  • Germany
  • Estonia
  • Hungary 

Meet James, one of our team members  https://youtu.be/WRcYDQf81E0?rel=0

This position is available immediately, so please apply ASAP!

To apply: Please apply at: https://dealdash.workable.com/jobs/220403

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer (EU)
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Malta
URL: http://www.hotjar.com

We are looking for exceptional and ambitious developers who enjoy working both on front-end and back-end development. This role is ideal for somebody who is passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to have a real impact on a product used by over 120,000 users from 184 different countries. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.

What skills are we looking for?

As a full-stack developer in the Hotjar tech team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in JavaScript, AngularJS, Python and PostgreSQL. You will be creating production grade JavaScript and Python code and will have the opportunity to implement solutions designed to handle incredibly high levels of traffic. You will need to be highly process driven and eager to learn new technologies and programming languages. You will also be communicating directly with our users on a regular basis to investigate issues and truly understand how your work is being used.

Job Perks:
  • Work remotely from the comfort of your own home
  • A free Kindle and Fitbit when you join Hotjar
  • 3,000 home office budget
  • Yearly personal development budget
  • Access to thousands of online courses
  • Attend conferences around the world
  • Regular company meetups

Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.

To apply: Apply on http://careers.hotjar.com/o/full-stack-developer.

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer - In the business of building businesses
jobs.content:
We're in the business of building businesses.



  • We uncover, incubate, scale and back game-changing businesses and products to create unfair advantage for the world's most important companies.

  • Corporations will own the next horizon of innovation.

  • We have entered a decade of disruption of large corporate business models, driven by a step change in the power of technology and the audacity and speed of start-ups.

  • To be fit for the future, visionary companies will deliberately re-imagine themselves by injecting or attacking established models with new ideas fueled by technology.

  • We are an ever-growing global team of innovators, operators, entrepreneurs and investors committed to this belief.


As a software engineer at BCG Digital Ventures you will be working with some of the largest companies in the world, on big problems that matter, with the latest technologies. You will be exposed to many clients and many industries, each with their own unique challenges. You will be working with some of the best people in the industry. You will have opportunities to learn and grow, either as a technical specialist, or as a manager of teams and products.


We hire people to be part of a full-stack, cross-functional, co-located product development team. We seek creative, passionate people with a collaborative mindset who can work effectively together to form high performance teams and solve complex problems. We seek engineers who are versatile, with a broad range of skills, who also bring a depth of knowledge in engineering practices, tools and specific languages/technologies.

jobs.title: Senior IT Administrator
jobs.content:
The European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) is one of the highest ranked scientific research organisations in the world. The Headquarters Laboratory is located in Heidelberg (Germany), with additional sites in Grenoble (France), Hamburg (Germany), Hinxton (UK) and Monterotondo (Italy).

The Hamburg Unit of the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) carries out research in structural biology and operates leading research infrastructures for applications in life sciences, which are made available to an international research community. These facilities require state-of-the art IT infrastructures, with high demands for data storage, transfer and computational power.

Reporting to the Head of Unit, key responsibilities are:


  • Installation and maintenance of desktop systems and servers


  • Management and Helpdesk support on Linux, Windows and Macintosh platforms


  • Maintenance of the local area network, backup and data storage systems


  • Management of IT upgrade projects


  • Supervision of the IT team members

jobs.title: Social Media/ Community Marketer
jobs.content:
At Recruitee, we believe great teams are built together. Recruitee is a cloud-based hiring solution. Founded two years ago, our cloud-recruitment platform has grown from 30 beta users to over 1000 users worldwide from startups like Usabilla and Hotjar, to corporate clients like Vlisco and TransIP. Our team works remotely in both Poznan (development team, design, growth hacking) and Amsterdam (marketing, sales, support). We're proud to be mentioned as one of the fastest growing startups in the Netherlands. 

Do you know what it takes to grow an online community? We're looking for a community marketer to manage the communication with leads and followers in our online communities and social media accounts, as well as the distribution of our content. We are a fast-growing start-up and this will be a new created position in the team. Your input for creative inbound marketing strategies will be important.

Responsibilities:

  • Build and manage the companys social media profiles and presence, including Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and additional channels that may be deemed relevant.
  • Write content based on our content strategy and research.
  • Distribute shareable content appropriate for specific networks to spread both our brand and our content.
  • Monitor and engage in relevant social discussions about our company, competitors, and/or industry, both from existing leads and customers as well as from brand new audiences.
  • Work alongside the content marketer to help distribute content that educates and entertains our audience and supports marketing goals.
  • Drive consistent, relevant traffic and leads from our social network presence.
  • Explore new ways to engage and identify new social networks to reach our target buyers.
  • Track, measure, and analyze all initiatives to report on social media ROI.

We offer:

  • Test, learn and grow fast
  • International remote team 
  • Market conform salary
  • Yearly team holiday trip

Requirements
  • BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience.
  • Extensive writing skills (with proven examples)
  • Active and well-rounded personal presence in social media, with a command of each network and their best practices.
  • Excellent communicator and creative thinker, with an ability to use both data and intuition to inform decisions.
  • Proficiency in using social media software to monitor social media conversations. You will be our ear to the ground to route the appropriate marketer, sales rep, and/or support rep to social conversations.
  • Working remotely for this position is fine. It would be a plus if you are available to meet in Amsterdam a few times a year (travel cost will be reimbursed).

To apply: Apply here: https://jobs.recruitee.com/o/social-media-community-marketer

jobs.title: Mobile App Developer
jobs.content:
Abbott is a global healthcare company devoted to improving life through the development of products and technologies that span the breadth of healthcare. With a portfolio of leading, science-based offerings in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott serves people in more than 150 countries and employs approximately 73,000 people. Please note that candidates need to be eligible to work in the U.S. without Abbott sponsorship.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

PRIMARY FUNCTION:

Contribute to the design and development of software applications, firmware and device drivers for embedded microprocessors under a disciplined product development process that meets FDA requirements. Works on software design, coding, and validating embedded software, supporting verification and validation testing, and ensuring that all product development conforms to design specifications and coding standards for medical devices Exercises judgment in coding following the software designs and conducting investigation activities following defined methods. Develops productive internal/external working relationships.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

1.Design and implement programs in current application and firmware programming languages (e.g., C-Sharp, Java, C, C, Assembly, etc). 2.Development of the test protocols for the purpose of design verification and validation of the system software. 3.Assist in the preparation of software design requirements and detailed design specifications for implementation of software designs per Abbott design development process. 4.Assist in the evaluation of selected designs through testing and full documentation of the results. Work on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Exercising judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action.

Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and performing other duties as assigned by management

Note: This job description describes the principal and main elements of the job. It is a guide to the nature and main duties of the job as they currently exist, but is not intended as a wholly comprehensive or permanent representation.

MINIMUM EDUCATION REQUIRED:

BS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science.MS degree ideal.

MINIMUM TRAINING & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

2 yrs experience in software engineering. Solid knowledge of software engineering principals. Knowledge of design controls and regulations for medical device development. Knowledge of the principles of quality software engineering as described by software lifecycle development processes that are consistent with ISO, IEEE, or other FDA recognized standards. Experience in design, engineering, and testing of software contained in medical devices developed under the FDAs regulations for 510(k) or PMA products is preferred. Technical experience in software engineering with excellent written and verbal communication skills is essential. Minimum of 2 years of structured software development and/or Object Modeling Design experience. Minimum of 2 years of solid programming experience using current programming languages (e.g., CSharp, Java, C, C, Assembly, etc). Experience with software development life cycle processes is highly preferable. Good troubleshooting skills is highly preferable Testing experience of software based systems is highly desirable Experience on multitasking in RTOS and/or Windows OS software design and development is highly preferable. Experience on Internet technologies (web development, application servers) and database design is a strong plus. Experience on device driver and low level device interface design and development is a plus. Knowledge and experience on RF software design, device driver configuration, and test is a plus. Experience in Com...

jobs.title: IST Trainee Program - A gamechanger
jobs.content:
We have a mission and a plan. We understand that there are many ways to reach our goals. We need you to help us find yet unexplored paths.


From day one, you will have a challenging assignment. The assignment is connected to our plan for expansion and will challenge you to perform beyond what you thought was possible.


At IST you will get the chance to learn from the best in the business as well as contributing to, or participating in a constantly developing organization, depending on your own ambition and level of expertise.


You are hired based on skills and potential and will be provided with an accelerated learning curve and you are expected to take on great responsibility. Via our trainee program you will have a solid and challenging career development and become part of our next generation of key contributors in the specialist field.


Still with us? Good. Because it just keeps getting better.


Practicalities.



  • The program will last for 18 months, starting August/September 2016.

  • You will have an assignment from your first week.

  • You will be employed from day one. The first three months is a probation period.

  • You will get the chance to work at least two of our Scandinavian sites.

  • We will help you to find acommodation.

  • You will have a personal mentor throughout the entire program.


We will customize the content and schedule as we go along and invite lecturers and adjust the training and mentorship depending on your needs and preferred focus area. You will experience different learning situations, on-the-job-training (around 80% of the time), just in time learning situations, knowledge transfer and inspiration, field trips to different front line enterprises.


Below you see some examples of learning modules in the program (some 20% of the time)



  • Innovation and creative processes

  • Disruptive technology and innovation

  • Business transformation and concept development

  • Complexity theory

  • Project management

  • Group development

  • Personal and professional development plan

jobs.title: Senior System Administrator  Microsoft Exchange / Skype for Business
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Do you get a real kick from good server practices? Do you know Microsoft Exchange and Skype for Business as well as you know your own family? We’re looking for an expert System Administrator who can take responsibility for our internal communication tools to make sure that our 1,000 plus employees stay connected.





What you'll do:



  • Plan, design, implement and maintain Microsoft Exchange and Skype for Business solutions in our head office in Düsseldorf and our other branches all over the world to ensure that they’re working well 24/7.

  • Plan, design, implement and maintain our Asterisk servers which provide the connection between our internal Skype for Business systems and SIP providers.

  • Troubleshoot problems related to our Exchange and Skype for Business servers in our complex technical environment.

  • Stay up-to-date on industry updates to ensure that we stay ahead of the curve and suggest new projects we can develop to push our infrastructure forward.

  • Act as the in-house technical expert on all Exchange and Skype for Business issues, providing assistance to others in your team should they need it.



What you'll definitely need:



  • Around 5 years’ experience installing, monitoring and troubleshooting servers for Windows Server and Client System 2008R2/2012/7/8/10, Skype for Business/Lync and Microsoft Exchange 2013-2016.

  • Considerable experience working with Active Directory, scripting and networking.

  • A good understanding of best practices for private cloud security.

  • Good knowledge of SIP, RTP, etc.

  • Flexibility and adaptability: in the rare chance of a serious issue occurring outside of office hours, it may be necessary for you come into the office to resolve it.

  • A bachelor’s degree in an IT-related field (only necessary for non-EU applicants).



What we'd love you to have:



  • MCSE certifications in Communication and Messaging.

  • German language skills or the enthusiasm to learn the language.




Start date:



  • As soon as possible.




Life at trivago is...



  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

  • Self-determined working hours based on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.

  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.

  • Working at our head office in Düsseldorf, a city boasting the 6th highest quality of life in the world for expats.



Additional information:



  • Applicants from outside the EU must hold a bachelor’s degree in order to be considered for this position.

  • Please note that only online applications will be considered. Any paper applications that we receive will not be processed or returned.

  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

jobs.title: Lead Technique Javascript
jobs.content:
Notre activité évoluant toujours plus, au cœur de l'innovation, nous renforçons dans ce sens notre pôle technique, une équipe ambitieuse, passionnée, et créative.


Vos choix et actions auront un impact fort dans l'avenir technologique de notre entreprise. Chaque personne de l'équipe fait partie intégrante de nos décisions, perspectives, et innovations.


Vous rejoindriez notre équipe en tant que Développeur clef de notre organisation, à l'aide d'un background Javascript expérimenté.  Vous travaillerez directement en collaboration avec notre CTO dans le cadre de projets innovants.


Vous êtes à l'aise avec la maintenance d'applications Javascript, leur développement, leur mise en production. Vous êtes également confortable avec un environnement de développement JS et disposer de compétences en architecture, vous permettant une certaine autonomie.

jobs.title: Angular Developer
jobs.content:
Come help us save the environment and disrupt a whole industry while doing it!


Metry is built to boost energy efficiency by making it fun, easy and truly scalable to develop services that saves energy and the environment. We manage billions of data points and provide the world’s most comprehensive infrastructure for collecting and distributing energy data. Real estates, industries and utilities save energy by using services they already love -- while we automatically extract data from energy bills, utility web-sites and smart-meters.


Grow with us


We are now expanding in Europe and look for a front-end developer to join our growing team in Gothenburg. Your main responsibility will be to implement UX-features and surprise our users with great details that make energy data collection efficient, convenient and a peace-of-mind experience. You will also be working with the On-boarding experience and managing our Javascript SDKs.


Your responsibilities



  • Manage the User portal which is the web app for our customers

  • Manage our internal portal that is used by Dev Ops, Support and Sales.

  • Manage, document and write Javascript SDKs

  • Be part of planning and architecture decisions regarding cloud infrastructure and API-design.

  • Help our customers with support questions about the API and data collection

  • Pet-projects: Play around with the API and IFTTT to demonstrate and inspire how Metry can be connected to smart lights and web services

jobs.title: Senior Engineer/Web Developer
jobs.content:
HappyCo is looking for a Senior Software Engineer / Web Developer (Front-end) with experience in designing and creating high quality software applications. As a member of our core engineering team you will participate in important design decisions and play a key role in the development of HappyCo’s software, used daily by our rapidly expanding customer base. You will take the lead on software feature creation, interacting with different internal team members and provide mentoring where required. You will also participate in the development of the software development process and drive the creation and adoption of organizational standards. jobs.title: Front-End Engineer
jobs.content:
At Noggin we solve big problems and make a real difference to the world around us by helping create more resilient communities. Implementations of our software support diverse uses: evacuations of major cities, counter-terrorism, national security, responses to floods, saving beached whales, even fighting Ebola.


We have an excellent opportunity for a talented Front-End Engineer to join our growing team and work on a new single page app product. This is a full-time role with an immediate start.


The boxes you tick:



  • Bachelor degree in business / commerce / information technology / computer science, or equivalent qualifications or experience

  • A minimum of 3+ years' experience in Front-End development

  • Advanced skills in: Javascript and related technologies

  • Experience in: RequireJS, LESS, SVG, Web Sockets, Flexible box model

  • You are able to legally work in Australia and you currently reside in Sydney so that you can work in our Australian headquarters


For the problem solver, working on the software to support these uses is equally as exciting and challenging. Our software touches everything; it is used to gather intelligence, manage information, plan, communicate, collaborate, take action, analyse and report. It also includes powerful workflow, business rule and process automation, spatial functionality, messaging and digital and social media communications.


That's why we're focused on employing some of the brightest and most innovative people in Australia. At Noggin, your voice is heard and valued, and you have direct input to our thought leadership in the resilience space.


For a confidential discussion please contact Kara Stevens, our Talent Acquisition Manager, on 02 9219 8860.

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer  C#/.Net
jobs.content:
Crate and Barrel is one of America’s most exciting housewares specialty retailer with 100+ locations and over 6,500 associates nationwide. We are seeking a Senior Web Developer – C#/.Net to join our team in developing the next generation of our eCommerce architecture.  This position is located at our Northbrook, Illinois corporate offices.


As a Crate and Barrel Senior Web Developer – C#/.Net, you will join an innovative eCommerce team responsible for delivering solutions built for sustainability and performance.  You will collaborate closely with product managers, testers and other software engineers to design, test, code, deliver and maintain software modules within an Agile Scrum environment via website architecture built on a cloud infrastructure. 


Come be a part of our exciting fast paced team, proud of building the solutions that drive our websites seen by millions of Crate and Barrel customers.


Job Description:



  • Design, develop, and implement solutions using C#, ASP.NET (MVC and WebForms), and Javascript Frameworks as your tools and Visual Studio 2015 as your environment.

  • Conceive and build unit testable solutions for our website applications.

  • Participate in technical design meetings with other developers and assist in defining the system architecture and choosing technologies.

  • Work on a cross-disciplinary Agile team to develop, estimate, test, and maintain our websites, while collaborating with team members on product backlog grooming, sprint planning, execution, review, and retrospective.

  • Work directly with business stakeholders to understand requirements and communicate progress.

  • Be an active contributor to back-end development practices and code reviews.

  • Update and maintain site documentation.

  • Communicate effectively and efficiently with all associates and business contacts and promote a strong sense of teamwork.


Requirements:



  • You have been building websites for 5+ years with C#, ASP.NET, MVC with a preferred focus on e-commerce solutions.

  • Possess 5+ years experience with relational databases like SQLServer, NoSQL experience a plus.

  • You have strong communication skills and experience working with business stakeholders and web designers.

  • You can work with jQuery right away. You have some experience and knowledge of another script framework (e.g. AngularJS, node.js).

  • Real world problem solving and technology excites you.

  • Experience working in a web environment such as IIS administration.

  • You have worked in an Agile environment.

  • You can write unit tests and testable code.

  • Ability to work efficiently and meet project deadlines with minimal supervision.

  • Ability to analyze business problems and provide accurate development estimates

  • Experience in domain-driven development and cloud technologies is a plus.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or comparable work experience.

  • You have good reading, written and verbal language skills (English).      


For immediate consideration please apply on-line at http://crateandbarrelcareers.silkroad.com/.

jobs.title: Front End Developer

Crate and Barrel is one of America’s most exciting housewares specialty retailer with 100+ locations and over 6,500 associates nationwide. We are seeking a Front End Developer to join our team in developing the next generation of our eCommerce architecture. This position is located at our Northbrook, Illinois corporate offices.


As a Crate and Barrel Front End Developer, you will join an innovative eCommerce team responsible for delivering solutions built for sustainability and performance. You will collaborate closely with product managers, testers and other software engineers to design, test, code, deliver and maintain software modules within an Agile Scrum environment.

  • Work with product team and stakeholders to understand and communicate progress.

  • Update, maintain and adhere to pattern-libraries, styleguides, and site documentation.

Requirements:

  • You can communicate to people in product management, design, user experience, and QA, and they will understand you.

  • You have excellent knowledge of CSS and Javascript coding best practices.

  • You can build responsive, cross-browser, highly-performant, and accessible applications.

  • You can work with jQuery right away. You have some experience and knowledge of another script framework (e.g. AngularJS, node.js).

  • You have worked with Twitter Bootstrap or Foundation or the like. You know about CSS preprocessors (LESS or SASS).

  • Maybe you’ve worked with C#, ASP.NET MVC, the .NET Framework, and VisualStudio.

  • Bachelor’s degreein Computer Science, Graphic Design, or Visual Communication desired but not required.

  • You have good reading, written and verbal language skills (English).

jobs.title: Lead Web Developer - C#/.Net
jobs.content:
Crate and Barrel is one of America’s most exciting housewares specialty retailer with 100+ locations and over 6,500 associates nationwide. We are seeking a Lead Web Developer - C#/.Net to join our team in developing the next generation of our eCommerce architecture.  This position is located at our Northbrook, Illinois corporate offices.


As a Crate and Barrel Lead Web Developer - C#/.Net, you will join an innovative eCommerce team as a technical leader responsible for delivering innovative eCommerce solutions built for sustainability and performance. Your passion for architecture optimization will enable you to become a key contributor in the development and enhancement of our core eCommerce architecture. You will be a go-to-person in designing and guiding teams in the delivery of high quality software that scales and performs at a best-in-class level. Collaborating closely with product managers, testers and other software engineers, you will design, test, code, deliver and maintain software modules within an Agile Scrum environment.


Our teams are composed of talented software engineers working in a very dynamic, challenging, fast-paced, sustainable and fun Agile (Scrum) environment.


Job Description:



  • Translate business requirements into architecture designs:

    • Understand the existing software core architecture, interactions and dependencies between its main components.

    • Support product managers to gather and filter key information from stakeholders.

    • Evaluate risk by identifying development complexity, limitations and impacts.

    • Determine development feasibility within identified constraints.



  • Support product managers with drafting functional specifications.

  • Write minimum technical specifications and documents.

  • Participate in detailed development reviews and demos.

  • Write unit tests.

  • Troubleshoot and guide the team to resolve complex problems.

  • Suggest core infrastructure enhancements based on current and future technology trends.

  • Brainstorm and solve very interesting problems that will considerably increase product user experience.

  • Coach and mentor junior team members:

    • Contribute and promote software best practices and processes across the team.

    • Participate actively in code reviews.

    • Provide teammates continuous technical support.

    • Provide guidance for new feature integration and key architectural decisions.



  • Share knowledge through collaboration, training, peer review, presentations, and articles.


Requirements:



  • 7 + years of C# and ASP.NET experience.

  • 4+ years of hands-on technical leadership experience around system engineering.

  • 2 + years of MVC experience.

  • 2 + years experience working under Agile scrum framework.

  • Strong knowledge of SQL Server.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field; Master’s degree preferred.

  • Strong experience with web development (HTML, JavaScript, AJAX, CSS, relational databases and SQL).

  • Experience with MongoDB or NoSQL preferred.

  • Experience implementing REST architecture preferred.

  • Good reading, written and verbal language skills (English).

jobs.title: Software/Productivity Engineer
jobs.content:
We need super smart engineers from all levels to help us build one of the best engineered e-commerce platform in the world (big talk we know, but that is our goal!). Our engineers combine creativity, curiosity, and drive to continuously perfect and revolutionize Jet from the inside out. We are looking to bring more intellectually curious engineers who are passionate about technology in general (Jet is a technology first company and prides itself on its culture of learning and knowledge sharing and we want all our engineers to be as passionate as we are!) 


The Environment


Our platform is largely an event driven platform implemented via a microservice architecture. The platform runs on Microsoft Azure and uses a large number of technologies and middle ware. The bulk of backend code is written in a functional style (F#) and our system of record is an event sourced system (essentially a log of all actions on the platform). We use a mix of Kafka, Redis, Elastic Search, Azure SQL, Event Store and Azure Storage for our data stores. About 50% of the platform runs on Linux and the rest Windows (although we move into more containerization we will see a shift towards Linux).


The Job


We are looking for talented Software Engineers who are passionate about improving the state of Software Engineering. This role impacts all of our engineering team and will help improve speed of development and quality of product. Responsibilities will include: Identify and develop technologies/tools which can drive improvements in efficiency of our system; recognize potential risk factors on our website; Performance, integration and chaos engineering; provide best practices to the engineering teams. Our software is quickly evolving and used by millions, this role will be dynamic, challenging, and critical to our success.



  • Identify and develop technologies/tools to improve the efficiency of our system.

  • Risk assessment: help determine functionality that have the biggest productivity impact on the site.

  • Performance/Integration/Chaos Engineering.

  • Provide best practices to the engineering teams.


The Person



  • Must have good programming skills with OO (preferred experience with functional programming)

  • Knowledge of distributed systems

  • Working knowledge chaos/performance engineering;

  • Working knowledge of continuous integration/continuous deployment process

  • BS or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field is preferred

  • Experience with building code static analysis tools


Compensation Philosophy


Our compensation philosophy is simple but powerful. Give everyone a meaningful stake in the company—the purest form of ownership. That’s why on top of base salary, Jet’s comp structure is heavily weighted in equity. Our collective hard work, high performance, and tenure are rewarded as our equity builds in value.


Benefits & Perks


Competitive Salaries.  Real Ownership in the form of Stock Options.  Unlimited Vacation.  Full Healthcare Benefits.  Exceptional Work Environment.  Learning & Development Opportunities.  Just for fun Networking & Events.

jobs.title: Principal Full Stack Rails Engineer Manager
jobs.content:
At Stitch Fix, our goal is to help our customers look great and feel great about themselves by revolutionizing how people shop. In a time-starved world where shopping often feels overwhelming, our business connects customers to clothes they love. Whether it’s helping someone dress for success at a new job or taking the stress out of packing for a family vacation, we fix clients’ closets – and they love us for it!


We’ve built unique, innovative software for merchandising, warehouse and inventory management, remote styling, and logistics. We leverage vast amounts of client data to make decisions throughout the company. All of this results in a simple, powerful offering to our clients and a very successful business. We believe we are only scratching the surface of our opportunity, and we’re looking for incredible people to contribute!


About the Role


Product is our primary concern. We hire engineers with great Product instincts because we are also the Product team. Building great software is a collaborative effort, so we work directly with stakeholders in the business. We deliver products & solutions—not features—because we understand how Stitch Fix works and are trusted to focus our time and effort where they are needed most.


We are looking for an experienced principal full-stack engineer who has built or worked heavily on a couple of Rails applications and has some other MVC framework experience. You want to help lead a team to success.


You love talking to your clients & users about what you can build for them. You are interested in how Stitch Fix works as a business, not just in the technology, and you would like a chance to make it work even better.

jobs.title: iOS Developer
jobs.content:
Dynamic Signal is the leader in Employee Advocacy, building a social sharing platform. Dynamic Signal’s mobile applications redefine how top companies such as IBM, Salesforce, and 3M communicate with the world.


The ABCs:



  • Architect: With 2 or more years of Objective-C experience, you have no problem taking technical ownership of projects from start to finish. You have extensive hands-on experience creating custom UI controls, designing protocols, and implementing delegate interfaces.


  • Build: Develop cool features across the Apple ecosystem including iPhone & iPad apps, app extensions, Apple Watch apps, and more. Translate mockups into localized, modular, high-performance code.


  • Collaborate: Collaborate with product management to develop the creative vision for new features. Sync with the web and back-end teams to make sure you get the data you need. Integrate social media APIs such as Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and YouTube.

jobs.title: Engineer 1, Data Centers
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Platform Services includes three companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




Job Summary:

Responsible for participating in project teams, researching technical topics related to Company operations, new product implementation,

assisting with existing products and services, and the overall upkeep and maintenance of designated areas of engineering. Performs event

correlation and identifies probable root cause; provides trouble isolation, basic troubleshooting, and break/fix activities.



Core Responsibilities:

- Must be able to work any shift.



- Assists in the risk assessment, quality, and scope management of deployment project plans.



- Responsible for the racking and stacking of equipment within the Data Center.



- Responsible for the operational inventory of all Data Center equipment in Aperture



- Installs, maintains and troubleshoots all Data Center cabling and infrastructure.



- Manages Data Center cable running lists, and records of deployed equipment.



- Supervises the maintenance and repair of all facilities systems and hardware.



- Ensure all equipment is labeled in compliance with DCM standards



- Maintain copper, fiber and power cord inventory



- Monitor security within the data center and raised floor environment



- Interfaces with vendors to maintain, troubleshoot and install related equipment.



- Monitors and optimizes Data Center power utilization, HVAC utilization and related requirements.



- Continued focus on streamlining Methods and Procedure for equipment deployment and implementation.



- Some direction required for job duties and high performance



- Knowledge and experience of providing Tier I IT support.



- Some travel required



- Be available to support 24 x 7 shift schedule

- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

jobs.title: Senior Algorithm Engineer
jobs.content:
Visible World is the leading provider of targeted TV advertising solutions. Our technology makes television advertising inventory more valuable for inventory holders, advertisers, and viewers. Visible World's HighYield tech stack is an end-to-end programmatic TV ad sell-side platform. Whether through programmatic sales infrastructure, household addressability, automated versioning, or Smart TV insights, Visible World offers the most complete automated solution for targeting, selling, and managing impression-based television ad campaigns.





Since 2000, we have been developing technology that makes TV advertising more efficient and effectivewe've been awarded 24 U.S. patents to date for technology we developed in house, and more are on the way. However, we're not just doing R&D. Today, Visible World empowers more than 300 advertisers to deliver more targeted, effective and accountable local TV ad campaigns to consumers in approximately 80% of U.S. cable homes in 210 DMAs and our household addressable footprint includes 3 million homes. Smart TV DNA is used by over a dozen leading networks to track their program promotion campaigns. Our AudienceXpress group is using the HighYield platform to lead the programmatic TV ad buying industry. Visible World employees operate at the cutting edge of TV technology. In June 2015, Visible World became a subsidiary of Comcast, joining one of the most innovative media and technology companies in the country. Come help us craft the future of TV.






Responsibilities:

- Explore state of the art prediction methods

- Efficient Inventory allocation

- Clear communication of code design and implementation

- Work with product managers for fast paced feature development





Skills:

- Linear Programming and Optimization techniques

- Statistical Modeling

- Relational Database technologies

- Analytic background





Languages/Packages:

- Python (numpy/pandas/scikitlearn)



- PostgreSQL



- Spark



- Impala



- Hive



- Javascript



Job Specification:



- Bachelors Degree or Equivalent inEngineering orComputer Science



- Generally requires 7-11 years related experience

jobs.title: Sr. Solution Architect
jobs.content:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.






Job Summary:



The ERP Sr. Solution Architect will be responsible for developing and delivering cross ERP architecture standards that span development, security, integration, and operations. This candidate will assist Comcast ERP teams to design and implement cross platform technology solutions. They will also lead troubleshooting of large, complex, technology issues and manage cross ERP projects.



Core Responsibilities:



-Access the technology landscape and identify critical deficiencies. Recommend solutions for improvement.



-Establish, define, maintain and communicate guidelines, principles, standards and best practices across all ERP systems architectures.



-Provide technical leadership for solution architecture management with key focus in the areas of systems design, integration, security and management.



-Collaborate with Comcast development, security, and support organizations to establish reusable frameworks and govern adoption/usage.



-Serves as the subject matter expert in SOA concepts and strategies and lead the ongoing efforts to mature our integration solution portfolio.



-Serves as the subject matter expert in approaches and best practices that enable the development or transformation of internal solutions to externally managed, cloud-based technologies.



-Understand, advocate and augment the architecture principles within the software suite leveraged by ERP, while ensuring alignment to support forward looking business and technology strategies.



-Analyze enterprise business trends and developing strategies to derive future state integration architecture for ERP Services.



-Drive and influence the successful implementation of strategic architectures.



-Develop trusted relationships with technology teams and business leadership through regular interactions and thought leadership.



-Drive efficiency through the unification of process, tools, and technology.



-Develop and maintain delivery and operations key performance indicators and lead betterment programs to improve metrics and efficiency over time to demonstrate value.



-Prepare and deliver powerful presentation materials to senior level IT and business leadership.



-This position description identifies the responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the performance of the position. Other relevant essential functions may be required.



Job Specification:



-Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field. Combinations of relevant education, certifications, and experience may be considered in lieu of a degree. Continuous learning, as defined by Comcast's learning philosophy, is required. Certification or progress toward certification is highly preferred and encouraged.



-5-8 years of progressive responsibility in an IT environment with demonstrated technical knowledge which provides the necessary skills, knowledge and abilities.



-5-8 years related experience planning, designing, delivering, and improving platforms, services, and customer experience with technology solutions or innovations.



-3-5 years relevant experience with enterprise-wide integration architecture required. Additionally, this position requires demonstrated knowledge and expertise in a broad range of information technology applications and infrastructures, as well as knowledge of how these technologies can be leveraged to solve business needs.



Required Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities:



-Clear understanding of commonly used development, operations, and architecture guiding principles and best practices.



-Experience with related industry frameworks and methodologies including waterfall, iterative, agile, SCRUM, and ITIL.



-Strong verbal and written communication skills with presentation experience.



-Ability to work as a collaborative member of a team while also being comfortable in leading a work initiative when directed to do so.



-Ability to set strategic architectural direction in integration technologies.



-Deep knowledge in service oriented architecture frameworks, standards and tools.



-Recent working knowledge for design, configuration and management of one or more application development platforms and frameworks including Weblogic, JBOSS, .NET, AJAX, .NET, REST, Perl, HTML5, and Objective-C.



-Recent knowledge of business and systems flows within ERP environments, a plus.



-A clear understanding of the architecture standards and best practices surrounding integration technologies



-A clear understanding of the security considerations and implications surrounding SOA and architectures and security frameworks used to mobile-enable business functions within the organization.



-Ability to determine the architectural implications from requirements that might impact other application ecosystems.



-Ability to breakdown requirements into project estimates and determine timelines and dependencies with the other domains/ projects.



-Ability to manage small work teams with experience in one or more project management tools.



-Clear understanding of ongoing and planned projects and their interdependencies/timelines.






Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Software Development & Engineering
jobs.content:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.






Job Summary:





Work as a software engineer on the Development and Architecture (DNA) team within the Video on Demand (VOD) organization. Create and maintain software that supports the company's cross-platform VOD navigation and content delivery infrastructure for over 25 million video customers nationwide.





Major Duties:





Participate in the design review of new features and projects assigned to the team.





Participate in requirements collection and analysis as needed.





Engage in collaborative design with teammates, operations counterparts, and customers for components of software projects as needed.





Work independently and with others to implement software for assigned projects.





Provide automated tests when implementing new functions or fixing bugs that prove that delivered work meets defined customer needs (acceptance criteria).





Engage in pair programming, team code reviews, and peer code review and user story acceptance as needed.





Document software and processes as needed.





Develop and support automation that allows for continuous testing of software created by the team.





Work with teammates and operations to automate deployment of systems and software created by the team.





Work with operations as needed to help automate monitoring, metrics collection, and other systems administration tasks related to software developed for the team.





Other duties as assigned.





Required Skills/Experience:





Solid Experience developing server-side applications using Go.





Experience developing applications using Ruby.





Team player with professional work ethic and positive attitude.





Minimum of 4 years experience writing software as part of a multi-person team.





Good understanding of Linux system administration and command-line usage, including experience with scripting in at least one Linux shell.





Understanding of troubleshooting, software lifecycle and quality assurance practices.





Experience with relational databases, including an understanding of database schemas and concepts and exposure to administration and/or scripting for at least one widely used relational database system.





Understanding of automated testing libraries and practices.





Experience with source code control on multi-developer projects.





Able to stay organized and switch between multiple projects.





Able to learn new technologies as needed and open to changing technological direction as required by the team.





Education:





Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent in work experience and self-study.

jobs.title: UI/UX Engineer I
jobs.content:
GENERAL SUMMARY:


The software development department at Ambry Genetics is looking for a UI/UX developer that is passionate about the field of software development and has some experience with the design and development of engaging user experiences. You should have an eye for clean and artful design, possess strong UI skills, and be able to translate high-level requirements into interaction flows and artifacts, and transform them into beautiful, intuitive, and functional user interfaces. Knowledge of the genetics and/or genetic testing industry a huge plus and a sense of humor is a must.


PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:


You will be working with product management and engineering teams to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience. Your stakeholders are mostly internal and need to be able to support them when necessary. You are required to use the ticketing system in place as we follow HIPAA software development guidelines.

jobs.title: Business Analyst
jobs.content:
GENERAL SUMMARY:  


The software development department at Ambry Genetics is looking for a business analyst that is passionate about the field of software development and has some experience with web development. You will be responsible for working closely with our development group to identify, assess and document business requirements and be a general liaison for one or more applications. The technologies we use include Symfony2, jQuery, AngluarJS, ReactJS, MySQL, MongoDB, and Elastic Search.  Knowledge of the genetics and/or genetic testing industry a huge plus and a sense of humor is a must.


PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:


You will be working in a team that is handling one or two applications. You will be collaborating with the technical leads and reporting to the project manager or director of the department. You will need to analyze new and existing business processes utilizing metrics and analytics tools, evaluate and interpret end user information requirements, and develop and implement appropriate technical solutions. Your stakeholders are mostly internal and need to be able to support them when necessary. You are required to use the ticketing system in place as we follow HIPPA software development guidelines.

jobs.title: Front End Engineer
jobs.content:
What You’ll Do


As part of the Artemis engineering team you’ll help craft simple and — dare we say it? — fun tools that help benefits professionals get value out of their healthcare data. You’ll have a lot of variety in what you work on (from custom data visualization to fluid user interfaces), and you’ll have a lot of autonomy in how you get the job done. Consequently, we expect you to take initiative in planning out how you’ll implement features and proactively consult other team members when you need input.


Please Have Experience With Things Like...



  • Javascript

  • AngularJS

  • d3.js

  • HTML5

  • TypeScript

  • CSS, LESS

  • Bower

  • Gulp


Bonus Points for Experience With...



  • Building web-based enterprise software

  • Healthcare data in general

jobs.content:
What You’ll Do


Help us build the most robust health data pipeline ever! If you don’t want to be a cog in a machine, you’ll love it here. We need your help in a lot of places:

jobs.title: Senior Web Application Engineer, Prospecting
jobs.content:
About the Role:


The Prospecting team at AdRoll is seeking a Senior Web Application Engineer to develop a new, innovative data product as a part of AdRoll's marketing platform. You will work closely with a small team of engineers, product managers, and data scientists to implement user-facing features for Prospecting and our library of shared UI components. If building scalable, usable, modern UIs is close to your heart, this is your dream job.


In this role, you will collaborate with our Product and UX teams on designing new features and improving existing products based on usage data. Through this cycle of iteration you will learn what makes great products tick and ultimately make life better for our users.


At AdRoll Engineering, we value the freedom and autonomy we give to our employees and encourage everyone to use a multitude of different technologies based on their interests. As a UI engineer, you have an opportunity to share your knowledge and help other engineers build modern web UIs and shared components.


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate with other engineers and product managers on building web applications, APIs and data visualizations

  • Make well-founded decisions on new technology and processes to adopt

  • Perform A/B tests, participate in user interviews and analyze usage data to make informed decisions

  • Mentor, teach, hire and share your knowledge to make our engineering team stronger


Qualifications:



  • 3+ years experience building web user interfaces for B2B or B2C products

  • In-depth knowledge of JavaScript as a language beyond popular frameworks

  • A solid foundation in data structures, algorithms, and computer science fundamentals

  • Experience with (or willingness to master) our stack, in order of importance: React, Redux, ES6, SASS, Python, SQL, Docker, and AWS


Bonus Points:



  • Contributions to the open source community

  • Experience building shared components or libraries

  • Experience with internationalization (i18n) and localization (l10n)

  • Experience in visual arts, graphic design, usability research or human-computer interaction


Compensation:



  • Competitive salary and equity

  • Medical / Dental / Vision benefits

  • Paid time off and generous holiday schedule

  • The opportunity to win the coveted Golden Bagel award

jobs.title: Senior iOS Engineer
jobs.content:
Rover.com is a place where dog owners can find and book dog sitters and dog walkers in their area. We help owners find quality sitters and facilitate the entire experience, so dog owners can comfortably travel without worry about the wellbeing of their furry family members. We are a rapidly growing and well-financed startup founded and based in downtown Seattle.

The Job:

Rover is looking for a senior iOS developer who has deep experience on the platform, including supporting rich feature sets across multiple iOS SDK versions, unit testing iOS application code, planning & executing iOS architectural decisions, and shipping & maintaining iOS apps in the marketplace.  Rover is currently using CoreData, AFNetworking, Bolts, OCMock and migrating towards Swift.

Our style:

  • Dogs in the office. Bring yours, too!
  • Lightweight, Agile processes constantly improved with retrospectives.
  • Fully automated testing and deployment system.
  • Integrated teams where developers and designers work side-by-side.
  • Data-driven decision making with A/B testing.
  • Contributions back into the open source community.

Our tools:

  • Xcode
  • iOS 8+
  • Sketch
  • Github
  • Travis CI

Why we'll hire you:

  • You're a great developer who wants to get even better
  • You play nicely with others
  • You can take loose requirements, figure out what needs to be done, and make it happen
  • You have experience using our tools or similar ones.
  • You can be your own QA team, producing quality code the first time around
  • You can pitch your own ideas and shepherd them through to completion
  • You know when to call it 'good enough' and ship, and when to put in the extra time to polish

If you're up for all of this and ready to hang out with a bunch of dogs, give us a shout. We're excited to hear from you!

This position is based at Rover HQ in Downtown Seattle. Competitive salary & benefits depending on experience. Candidates must be eligible to work in the US.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Chaordic+Linx+Neemu are set to change the ecommerce world by giving each user a unique, exciting experience when shopping online!


We have the largest database on online shopping behavior this side of the Equator. We use it to build awesome recommendations that tens of millions of people use. We lead our market and our customers love us. https://www.chaordic.com.br/en/solutions/how-we-do-it/


We need more people who can take this gigantic, ever-growing database and turn it into stuff that makes people's lives better. Yes, it's an open problem. Fraud protection? A social network? Robots? Lasers? We need people who will help shape our future.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Here at Rally we believe in teamwork, communication, trust and not taking ourselves too seriously. We believe in the power of small teams. We believe in supporting personal growth and the importance of nurturing a great culture.


About us:




    Flexible minds: We need to do a lot with a small team, so it's important to use the right tools for the right job and be willing to change down the line if we find a more efficient solution. We also believe in "strong opinions, weakly held," being humble, accepting and giving feedback.




    Self-driven: Developers are given a large amount of autonomy in how they work, who they work with, when they work, and are responsible for a large part of driving project functionality and seeing them through to completion.




    Quality-focused: Quality code helps a small team do more. Increasing communication through code readability decreases the cost of maintenance to ensure we don't work weekends.




    Entrepreneurial: Developers are given complete ownership over their projects from design to implementation, testing, deployment and production maintenance.




    Communicative: We believe in teamwork and sharing the experience through design reviews, code reviews and weekly technology presentations.

jobs.title: Business Operations Analyst
jobs.content:
PerfectVision Manufacturing, Inc. is currently providing an opportunity for a qualified professional to join a motivated business operations team, and to become an integral part of the continual success of the organization.


The Business Operations team goal is to create efficiencies through systematic enhancements, reporting, process identification and documentation, and data validation. Internally we collaborate across teams to identify, develop, and provide the information and systems necessary to successfully manage a profitable business. We create the tools that will allow PVM to support our customers in a manner that cultivates an integrated, long term relationship. This is all done to achieve our primary purpose, providing the operational support needed to execute the PerfectVision strategy.


The Business Operations Analyst is responsible for developing a deep understanding of PerfectVision, becoming a functional subject matter expert in business operations. This individual will work on an operational team that facilitates collaboration across departmental teams to translate business needs into detailed requirements that can be implemented by the MIS development team. This position will be responsible for the design, testing, and implementation of various processes and system changes. This individual will also be responsible for various manual reporting using a combination of Microsoft SQL Server and Microsoft Excel. Additional responsibilities include project management and leadership roles in a number of key initiatives for the organization.
